review_content: Fortissime note di caffè. Mi sembrano eccessive rispetto ai miei ricordi di Guinness alla spina bevuta a Dublino. Ok, contesti e forse anche spirito della birra (non è la original) diversi. Ma così è troppo
It could do with some sprinkling. We like the taste but it is totally dead and that reduces the experience.
Love the looks of it, in the can and in the glass. Very dark, and the notes fit in with this: coffee and roasted malts. Bitter but not too much.
Black, ever so slightly translucent appearance with a smooth, tan head. Roasted coffee aroma. Coffee notes in the taste, slightly thin mouthfeel, and supremely smooth finish. Always a reliable go-to!
440ml can . Dark and creamy whitebrownish foam . Good aroma and taste of coffe . Drinking beer have fealing like drink cream realy nice .

퍼포먼스면 포퍼먼스, 개성이면 개성으로, 맛이면 맛!?이라곤 못하겠지만 한국에선 편의점맥주의 끝판왕이라 할 수 있는 기네스 드래프트.

​영문 이름부터가 간지 그 자체인데 GUINNESS .. 손으로 써보시라 유려하면서도 힘이 있다. 그 말인즉슨 탱탱하다는 말인가.

​개인적으로 감성 심야에 마시면 매우 만족도가 높은데, 아무것도 하지 않고서 맥주를 마시는데 집중하면 정적 속에서 하프에 선율이 느껴질 정도..? 마음이 아주 평온하다. 안주는 필요없다 책 한 권이면 충분하지.

붉은 빛이 아주 미세하게 남은 흑진주 컬러에 질소볼로 인해 만들어진 거품은 30분이 넘도록 유지되며, 잔을 기울일 때마다 크리스탈이 쏟아져 내리는 듯 하다.

​향은 두꺼운 거품으로인해 느끼기 힘든 편인데 로스팅 맥아의 고소함을 살짝 느낄 수 있으며, 두껍고 조밀하게 형성된 거품층을 뚫고 맛을 보면 텁텁하고 크리미한 기네스가 들어온다. 미약한 탄산조차 없다면 이건 커피가 아닐까 싶은 그런 맛이다.

​즉 고소하다는 말인데 그 고소함을 천천히 음미해보면 적당한 산미와 더불어 견과류의 담백함 그리고 카라멜의 달콤함에서 과장하면 카카오의 향까지 느낄 수 있다. 참고로 카라멜이나 초콜릿향은 이 드래프트가 아닌 오리지널을 마시면 비교적 더 선명히 느낄 수 있다.

​물론 홉의 향이 존재하긴하나 로스팅 맥아의 향이 압도적이라 시종일관 고소함을 유지하다 삼킬때 마지막에서야 홉향을 조금 느낄 수 있으며 그 향은 영국산 홉의 흙향과 나무의 향이다.

​통상적으로 씁쓸하다고 표현을 하는데 본인이 홉이 강조된 IPA 계열을 즐겨마신다면 전혀 쓰지않고 재미없다고 느끼게 된다. 모든 맥주가 마찬가지이긴 하지만, 그 중에서도 에일은, 그 중에서도 #기네스드래프트 는 특히나 잔에 따라 마셔야한다.

질소가 충전된 위젯을 반응시키고 잔을 거꾸로들어 따름으로서 내용물이 뒤섞여야 케그에서 갓 나온 생맥의 맛을 온전히 즐길 수 있는데, 캔 째로 마시게되면 드래프트(Draught)의 ‘생’맛이 아닌 생생한 간장 맛을 맛 볼 수 있다.

​다 따르고도 질소가 열심히 파도타는걸 2분 정도 기다려서 잔의 전체적인 색감이 윗 사진처럼 흑색이 나왔을때가 제 맛이다. 오피셜에서 제안하는 시간은 120초도 아니고 정확히 119초다..

​안그래도 낮은 도수에 양까지 440ml 적다보니 항상 반 캔만 더 마시고 싶은 생각이 든다.

330ml dark bottle from local store but also had the can countless times, drinking it on 02/07/2021 Pours very dark brown with red reflexes and creamy brownish foam on top, moderate lacing. Aroma is quite nice of roasted malt, toast, chocolate, coffee. Taste is quite easy and enjoyable with delicate roasted malt, milk chocolate, some licorice flavours and quite mild and overall sweet i would say, though i guess that depends on your experience. Used to find it even bitter the more i drinked it once, before being exposed a little to IPAs, german rauchbiers and other stouts. Finish is a bit dry but lovely aftertaste. Sessionable at 4.2% abv and slightly watery. Could be a bit stronger i guess. Medium body and really smooth in mouth, low carbonation. Really easy stout, good, cheap enough and could have so much of it, i guess that's why i don't mind it at all! Really nice.

Nitro can. Thanks, Carlson, for a beer that doesn't suck! Pours black, with a beautiful nitro head. The nose is pleasant, mild coffee, black bread, and cacao. Sweet and malty, with a touch of bitterness. Light body, with a chalky, crisp palate. This is a simple, quality stout.

Also, makes a really nice Dog's Nose cocktail. You should try one!

Dark dark wood with mahogany hints. Thin to medium beige head with medium retention. Aroma intensity 4/5. Caramel, toast and malt aroma, notes of leather and candy. Light to medium bitter. Soft carbonation. Medium body

Tap at anchor fish and chips. Black with that classic creamy tan white head. Slightly sweet nose. Creamy full mouth feel, rich and malty throughout. Long soft finish. Light amount of bitterness. A satisfying and comforting experience.

Typical draught can drunk with pasta and San Daniele Ham overlooking the Dolomites. Perfect tight creamy white nitro head that lasts until you drink it away, over black beer. Flavor is a perfect roasted malty coffee taste, dry with present but smooth bitterness on the back end. Low carbonation. How is this great flavor and head possible in a can: extras point for technology!

Mousse bien présente et crémeuse, de légères notes de café et de chocolat noir au nez comme en bouche. Faible taux d'alcool, se boit très facilement.
On est sur de l'ultra classique pour une Stout. Elle peut constituer une bonne introduction à ce type de bière.
My favorite Stout. A great beer. Did I say I like it? On tap it’s outstanding!

Poured from 440ml nitro can at 4.1% abv. Aroma: Very mild, but hints of malt and dark chocolate. Appearance: Dark brown-black body with creamy beige head and cascading nitrogen when poured. Taste: Malty and slightly sweet, flavours of milk chocolate and treacle. Mouthfeel: Very smooth, milky and creamy texture, however with surprisingly thin body. Overall: Nice easy drinking macro stout - would pair well with a stew, casserole or meat pie. Neither bland or overwhelming flavour, making it a good starter stout for those just getting into darker beers.

On tap @Treefolk's (Rome), Oyster Days. Nera, schiuma avorio/ecrù compatta, cremosa, a grana finissima. Al naso note di malti tostati, caffé, leggero terroso. In bocca è equilibrata, con note tostate, abboccata all'attacco, con leggera acidità da tostato. Corpo leggero, carbonazione leggera. E' sempre un bel bere, specialmente quando è fresca.
Pours pitch black with lasting small bubbled beige head. Light roasted malt and coffee on nose and palate. A bit creamy, but still, watery taste. Not bad but a little dissappointed of this ‘classic’.

Can from local shop. Dark brown with a creamy extra-pale tan head. Looks really nice. Predominately chocolate and flapjacks is what I get. Touch of treacle bitterness. Body is thinner than what I expected. Medium feel with a soft, nitro carbonation. A dry finish with an earthy, mild coffee bean roast bitterness. The bitterness pleasantly lingers. It's fairly subdued but it's a pleasant enough dark beer.

44 cl, canned. Widget ball containing nitrogen. Pours black with a beautiful creamy head. Aroma: Roasted malt, some smoked ham notes. Very mild earthiness. Taste: Mild-medium sweetness towards the end. Roasted malt. Earthy potates. Palate: Medium-light body, a bit thin yet creamy. Nice roasted aftertaste. Good one.
---
29.6.2010: 28 (4-5-4-4-11)
Creamy coffee taste. Best intro stout available on the market. Perfect for what it is. Will taste heavy to non stout drinkers and light to seasoned stouters.
Had a lot in a daily basis. Anyway palate is lacking. Surely do not expect much if you have been to the factory. Much inferior than the Foreign Extra variant.

Cette Guiness Draught ne transpire pas réellement les ambiances chaleureuses voire endiablées des pubs irlandais. Manque de présence et d'intensité me feraient plus penser à des chaînes essayant de les imiter. Beau visuel toutefois avec un brun foncé et une belle mousse brune et dense de 1 cm. Le nez est appréciable mais manque de caractère avec du café, de la noisette, du tabac et une touche de chocolat. En bouche, attaque, seconde et arrière-bouche sont très décevants, quasi insipides, avec de faibles arômes de café. Ce n'est que sur le final que les arômes découverts au nez se révèlent, mais sur une présence très moyenne. L'amertume est cependant agréable. L'alcool, à 4,2 % est cependant nettement insuffisant. Mais où est le fighting spirit irlandais?
Cervesa suau per ser negre. Molt bona peró no la puntuo mès perquè en genersl no soc de negres.

Schwarze Farbe. Die Schaumkrone ist sehr cremig und ist bis zum letzten Schlick vorhanden. Ein torfiger Geruch der  an Erde, Karamel und Kohle erinnert. Geschmeidiger Antrunk. Die dunklen Aromen, die ebenfalls analog des Geruchs sind entwickeln sich vom Körper zum Abgang hin zu einer immer stärker werdenden Süße ohne dabei zu starke malzige Aromen zu entwickeln. Etwas salzig. Ziemlich sättigend.

11.2-ounce bottle pours dark brownish black with ruby highlights and a 1/4" creamy light tan head and lacing. Aroma: faint brown sugar. Flavor: coffee, chocolate, burnt toast, black pepper. Mouthfeel: light-bodied, watery finish.
Black pour. Watery flavor  creamy head. Mild taste. Easy palate. Easy carbonation.

440ml can on 17th March 2021 from M&S, Camden Town. Pours almost solid, but clear, sepia black with pale tan foam and full lacing. Roasty aroma with chocolate notes. Coffee, chocolate and a lactic hint in-mouth. A developing finish that becomes bitter. Velvet smooth mouthfeel and plenty of body.

Wygląd: czarne/ciemnobrązowe piwo z beżową, kremową, drobnopęcherzykową pianą. Pozostawia przyjemny wizualnie lacing.

Aromat: ogólnie dość nikły zapach, ale można wyczuć orzeszki coli czy kawę

Smak: nuty palone, gorzkiej czekolady, kawowe, słodowe 

Posmak w ustach: piwo gładkie, lecz puste, mało treściwe, średnio wysycone i pozbawione jakiejkolwiek goryczki. Pozostawia delikatny palony finisz bez nadmiernej suchości w ustach.
Bardzo ładny wygląd, czarne i z białą pianą. W zapachu nic szczególnego. W smaku aksamitny , miękki wytrawny. Niska goryczka i wysycenie

Dark brown  ("black") color with a tan, creamy head. Light body, soft carbonation, lacing is present. Aroma of dark chocolate, caramel, roasted grain, cocoa, nuts and some wet hops. Taste of dark chocolate, milk chocolate, dark malts, coffee, some caramel, ashes, bread and licorice. A bit watery in between. Bitter aftertaste. No matter what, this stout is a classic and I enjoy it.

Because of the nitrogen ball, the wine was just poured and it was very beautiful. The foam was thin and dense, but the taste was too weak. It was more watery than water beer. It didn't even have the baking taste that Shi Tao should have. Only recommended for Xiaobai or ladies who are just getting started.

On the nose, it gives of chocolate-coffee vibe. The much expected roasted malt with maybe oats. It's creamy, yet thin on the palate. I guess I anticipated a more rich mouthfeel.  It's certainly an easy drinking brew, I get why it everywhere. It was okay, nothing remarkable, but certainly decent.

Kolor brunatny, klarowne. Piana drobna, ecru, sztywna jak białko. W aromacie dużo czekolady. Dalej kawa, trochę przypieczonego ciemnego chleba, delikatny karmel. W smaku podobnie. Czekoladowo-kawowe. Aftertaste przyjemny czekoladowy podobnie jak goryczka. Alkohol niewyczuwalny ale też woltaż niski. Klasyka gatunku. Polecam jako odskocznię od kraftu.

het is vooral het uiterlijk en de overdreven hoeveelheid merchandise wat deze stout groot maakt, want qua smaak heeft deze slobber niet echt veel diepgang. Dat is tegelijk misschien wel meteen het grote pluspunt, want bier hoeft niet altijd een enorme explosie aan smaak te bevatten, lekker doordrinken met weinig poespas. Kleur is diep robijnrood, en niet zwart, neus is moutig, heel klein beetje turfig, chocolade en koffie, evenals smaak. de dikke lobbige schuimkraag zorgt ervoor dat het geheel een romige touch geeft, en verder gewoon lekker wegtanken.

Old rating from 24-01-15 - Pint from the cask in Jersey, first time since enjoyed a number of times in Dublin years ago. Pours jet black with a off white creamy head. Aromas & tastes of dark chocolate, coffee, nuts, grain & roast malt. Above medium body. Slightly sweet dry finish. Enjoyable
I enjoy it but we all know it’s not most flavourful in draught  cans. Nice looker, not much nose or in palate
Buona birra. Economica, moderata in tutto ma beverina. Voto personale 7.5 /10.

Stout suave, amargor medio, espuma generosa y persistente de color marron claro gracias al sistema de bola. Sabor un poco comercial buscando agradar a todo el público. Si no tienes a mano una stout con mas cuerpo, aroma y sabor, sirve para quitar las ganas ya que es fácil de encontrar.
I expected a lot more from Guiness, but it's a good dry stout. Catching some roasty flavors.
What can I say its Guinness, if you haven't tried it you must. Its not for everyone, but you wont know until you try it. A true classic !
Deep,smooth and very tasty dark brew,a proper stout, served iced cold ,went with fish & chips meal perfectly

Aroma of roasted malt, slightly sweet chocolate and very light bitterness. The flavour is dry-to-medium, light roasted bitter malt. The thin body and smooth nitro mouthfeel is either the beers greatest strength of biggest flaw, depending on your view point. In the right context, as a session beer or with food, it really works IMO. Outside if that, I can see how, to some people's taste, it may seem to not be a "proper" beer.

Ciemny rubin. Potężna piana z efektem kaskadowym. Kolor ni to kremowy, ni to bezowy. W trakcie picia trzyma się szkła niczym śmietana. 
Aromat ciemnego piwa. Lekko palony. 
Wspaniała kremowość piany. Nie czuć gazu. 
Kawowość. Paloność. Wytrawność. Na finiszu nawet goryczka. 
Zacny klasyk.

this is a dark beer

i like me some dark beer

slides right down my norwegian tummy

Świetny efekt nitro, piękna wielowarstwowa beżowa piana w kolorze ciasta, piwo niemalże czarne, trochę jak coca cola, takie refleksy. W aromacie bardzo przyjemna delikatna paloność, biszkopt, mleczna czekolada. Wytrawne, bardzo wodniste, czekoladowe, delikatne, kremowe, przepyszne.
Una cerveza bastante popular, con un cuerpo medio y suave. Aunque con una espuma muy generosa y persistente debido al mecanismo de la "caniquita". Persiste el amargor de café y cacao al final.
Klasyk / A true classic / mocno wytrawne, kawowe z fajną goryczka / dry, coffee with pleasant bitterness / no i ten wygląd / and the perfect looks / guiness

Pours pitch black with a medium sized thick head. Aroma of roast malts and coffee. Taste of roast malts, coffee, chocolate. Low carbonation, thin body... almost like it was watered down. Light roasty bitter finish. Can't say I'm impressed with this classic

The beer is god, the nitro gives a particular feeling to it. However, except from a Coffee aroma the beer is flat and watery. The Extra Stout (5% ABV) version, at least in Europe, is much better.

P.S.: Having tried the Can version I can say that there is a huge difference between the Can and the Bottle, which should be avoided.

Об том знаменитом на весь мире, не писал только ленивый. Ирландская классика, пиво всегда ровного вкуса и аромата. ЧТо и не удивительно. Бытует правда много мней, что пиво из разных рабов и с завода имеет разный вкус, но сколько бы я его ни тестировал, вкус +- всегда один и тот же. Пена как сливки, пены немного, держится достаточно, пузырчатость очень очень мелкая. Цвет черный. Вкусовые качества: Сильный хлебный вкус и легкая водянистость, типа холодного кофе без сахара. Отличный классический стаут без каких либо излишеств.Можно выпить много и очень много,что ни однократно уже и делал.

dark, black coffee colour with a beige dense creamy head that lasts ages. 
Coffee and dark malts mainly, acidic towards the end, overall pretty mild. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel, but I guess it could feel watery to some. Easy to drink.
Guinness non ha bisogno di critiche se servita alla lettera come insegna casa madre. In questo posto risulta essere sempre quasi al TOP

color: negro con espuma blanca muy densa y persistente.
olor: ligero a malta tostada
sabor: malta tostada, amargor bajo, trago muy facil. carbonatacion baja.

La bière fut achetée dans un Lidl.
Le breuvage procure un premier parfum de café et sobre de chocolat.
Robe noire avec de légers reflets de teinte acajou. La bille nous montre un bel effet de pression qui fait un effet de nuage de lait. La mousse est d'une tenue correcte et de couleur avec une carbonatation moyenne.
En bouche, le stout est légèrement teinté d'une amertume de café suivi d'un adoucissement du au chocolat.
Wonderful smell, great head, good lacing, and Brilliant dark color. The Taste is wonderful, with the roasted caramel flavoring of a true Stout, and the wonderful creamy texture of a draught beer.
Nice creamy head over a black stout.  Nothing offensive about this beer, but nothing super special either.

Mild aroma of dark malts
Nice darkbrown colour with large lasting head
Nice taste of dark malts, dark coffee and licorice notes
Smooth mouthfeel with mild carbonation
Really nice to drink!
Dark stout with lasting brownish head. The foam works its way up through the glass. Looks great. Light smell of malt and yeast. Taste is malt, and little smoke and dark chocolate. A classic.

Guinness is a dark Irish dry stout that originated in the brewery of Arthur Guinness at St. James's Gate, Dublin, Ireland, in 1759. It is one of the most successful alcohol brands worldwide, brewed in almost 50 countries, and available in over 120. Sales in 2011 amounted to 850 million litres. A full bodied Irish stout. Guinness Extra Cold slow poured in a wet glass gives the perfect pint.
Dark color with a thick brown head. Watery, thin taste. Bit ashy, but not very exciting or challenging. Not really good. Works probably better with a higher alcohol content.
le stout de base historique. meilleure à la pression avec son beau petit col de mousse où une pièce est censée tenir dessus

The iconic stout porter, pours a near black with a creamy off-white/beige head, and a subtle roasted malt aroma. The creamy, smooth mouthfeel allows the slightly bitter roasted malt flavour to slip down very nicely, there’s just not a lot of complexity in the taste, leaving a dry bitter finish

Honestly, this is a perfectly fine way to serve a Guinness. It's better than the bottled version because of the brilliant idea with the carbonation cartridge in the can. It's pretty damn close to the real thing. And the thing about the real thing is, that if the pipes are not kept clean, the Guinness can easily get a sour and unwelcoming note. This NEVER happens in the canned version.

Nose: Light roasted malts and milk.

Taste: Earthy, tangy with chocolate and slightly bitter finish.

Frothy mouthfeel.

A classic.

440ml can BBE Mar-21. A very dark brown nearly black, creamy beige head which stays. Aroma of dark malts, earthy, coffee. Smooth mouthfeel, no carbonation, a touch watery. Tastes of dark chocolate, burnt toast with medium bitterness throughout. Easy to drink and makes a change from carbonated beers but couldn't have it as a session beer. Nice though.

Come on, does it get any better than this!  Obviously on tap (with nitro pour) is the way to go, but 2nd choice is can - and last choice is bottle....I actually don’t drink it from the bottle, and if an establishment pours it the wrong way I don’t drink it either.  Temperature is important - should not be ice cold.  Wait for it - don’t drink before it’s settled.  Enjoy the frothy, chocolate-milk like consistency. I taste a hint of coffee notes when I drink it, but others have disagreed with me. Although a dark stout, you can drink them for an extended period of time.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
L'une des pires bières, bien trop amère, gout de café trop prononcé et peu appréciable

Wygląd: Czarny kolor, bardzo klarowny , nie przejrzysty, smolisty. Piana piękna - nigdy wcześniej takiej nie widziałem. Bardzo drobno pęcherzykowa, beżowa, długo utrzymująca się. Efekt przy nalewaniu imponujący (Guinness w puszce z kulką azotu) - wręcz dzieło sztuki. 

Aromat: Kawowy, słodowy, trochę kwasu chlebowego. Przyjemny, choć mało intensywny zapach. 

Smak: Kawa, kwas chlebowy, ciemny chleb. Lekka kwaskowatość (bardzo przyjemna), wyczuwalne elementy słodowe. Jest chmielowa, średnia goryczka. Bardzo długi, przyjemny kwaskowaty posmak. Ogólnie rzecz biorąc - w smaku bardzo dobre, ciekawe piwo - które nie przygniata. 

Odczucie w ustach: Gładkie, nisko nasycone - bardzo przyjemne (anielskie), choć czasem lekko wodniste (co jest wadą, ale dzięki temu nie przygniata jak np. Porter). Łatwo się pije

Podsumowanie: Bardzo dobre piwo - Nic bym w nim nie zmienił, bo jest świetnie zbalansowane. Wyśmienity smak Kawy, kwasu chlebowego, kwaskowatość i długi, lekko wytrawny finisz. Mimo to, nie przygniata (jak niektóre Portery) i całkiem łatwo sie pije. Poza tym pięknie wygląda. Najgorzej wypada aromat - ale też nie jest zły. POLECAM

Puszka, kupione w Biedronce Warszawa. Spożywane i kupione 8 czerwca 2020. Data na puszce 2 luty 2021 rok.
Lekker, drinkt snel weg. Romig, prijs kwaliteit verhouding is eigenlijk zeer goed.
Barwa czarna, gęsta piana długo utrzymuje się w kuflu. Smak wytrawny, kawa, delikatna kwaskowość, chmielowa goryczka w finiszu. Bardzo gładkie, dobrze wyważone. Czysta klasyka.
Burk från SB. Svart med tajt, krämig beige skumpuck. Rostat, lite bränt. Kroppen blir nästan för mjuk.

Guinness bought from a supermarket and drunk at home from the can.
Always a guarantee.
Appearance. Pitched black with yellow white persistent foam. 
Aroma : not so intense and special. Slight touches of coffee.
Palate: gentle on the palate and tongue. Creamy and pleasant until the last sip. 
Flavour: chicory, lime, dark chocolate with orange. Some hints of coffee and nuts. Some smokey notes after some sips.

An all-time classic. Very heavy on the stomach.

In my experience is rubbish unless it's on draught. 

Seems to taste that bit better in Dublin than my average English offering. Maybe mental, maybe freshness.
Lata de 44 cl Nitro. Color marrón oscuro, con abundante espuma color crema, apariencia cremosa y buena retención. Aromas torrefactos leves, cereal. Sabor con notas a café, malta ahumada. Final seco.

Nitro-can. Very dark brown, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light roasted malt and light coffee, faint hoppyness. Body is light to medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, light roasted malt, faint coffee and light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dryish - lightly sweetish, light - some roasted malt, faint coffee and light - some hoppyness, faint alcohol. Smooth with light roastiness but bit thin bodied (compared to Murphy´s). For the meek masses.
Quite simply the best session stout in the world period. I have drank this in Dublin, Cork and Galway. Great memories and great company.
Only out of the tap, strictly never from the can - always seems to come out flat.

A classic. Definitely has a toasty flavour to her. Better on tap than from a can, but your bartender has to kinks what they’re doing. Nitrogen tends to be a bit flat from the can. Overall a solid stout.
Havde forventet en "tyk" øl, men den er tynd u konsistens. Men smagen er okay, den bliver bedre når man har drukket den lidt. Den virker meget flad i det, hvilket er ærgeligt.
Birra dal colore nero scuro, sapore molto intenso, piccolo strato di schiuma morbido e persistente.

Pours a black colour ale with a white thin head 
Notes of roasted coffee and cocoa nibs and liquorice

För det första så är det fantastiskt att se en perfekt upphälld Guinness komma till liv. Sedan möts man av något kallt och krämigt där man känner flera smaker samtidigt i form av sötma, beska och djup. En Guinness funkar alltid.

0.44 can
C: dark brown
N: roasted malt
P: very tall head, foamy, coffee, roasted malt, dry, dark chocolate. Stable taste throughout the years.

AR: Röstmalz, Schokolade, Kaffee,
AP: opales schwarzrotbraun
TA: Röstmalz, säuerlich, Kaffeesatz, bitter
Not sure what to say - it's iconic. Smooth, strong, magnificent on a rugby day.

Aroma : Some roasted dark maltiness, hint of nut but overriding aroma is a peaty earthiness  Taste : As aroma. Classic thick bodied stout. Smooth & gently bitter earthy all the way through. As with most traditional dry stouts it's a straigtforward and simple but this is the standard setter for the style
5 von 5 wer was anderes sagt hat eine  am helm finde es nur schade dass es so komerzialisiert wurde🍻
Piana aksamitna, natomiast reszta dla wszystkich i dla nikogo, brak aromatu, smaku. Moje domowy dry stout o niebo lepszy.
If you rate this beer any lower than 4.5 you are a beer snob. Its so fantastic and unique and I bloody love it.

The stout. Not the most exciting stout in the world but is the most accessible and affordable. Easily drunk. A gateway into stouts. I dunno what else to write really. It's the stout in a world where stouts are really underappreciated. The first stout you think of, the stout everyone knows.

Short Description: A fruity, lightly dry stout, with a burnt and a little watery flavour that is closer to black coffee with orange than espresso or dark chocolate. Due to the light flavours, low sourness, and low alcoholic content, this is a very easy stout to drink and relax with. .::. Pours very dark brown, almost black, with a golden head that's thick and persistent. A classic look, the gold standard for every other stout. The nitro makes for a very gentle, smooth presence in the mouth, with small fine bubbles. The aroma is a proeminent smell of roasted hops. The initial taste is dry, very toasted, and a little bit watery. Closer to americano coffee than full espresso. Then, the fruity notes open up, with light bitterness and a slight sweetness. As if you added some orange juice to your black coffee. Unlike many stouts, this doesn't hint of dark chocolate whatsoever, and the coffee flavour is dim, the burnt citrus being more proeminent. The after-taste is of burnt bread, but not sour, so it begs for another sip. A big sip. Thankfully, the lightness of this beer makes it pleasant and easy to drink.

Greatest of all time. Note that the color is dark ruby red (not black). 

This is for a reason, it's brewed with precision using a subtle amount of roasted barley which mix perfectly with the nitrogen for a smooth beverage. 

Healthier than orange juice.

Pours black with brown head with lacing, dark chocolate aroma, medium bitter taste, watery texture. Very overrated but still good, especialy when you have no access to less widely-distributed beers.

330ml bottle
Very dark brown, almost black in color with a nice head which lasts quite a long time. A malty stout which is very easy to drink.
On nitro. Pours black with a big creamy head. Toast, coffee, roast, chocolate. Normal nitro body. Always pleasant, never mind blowing.
# 1701; 12/2019. Coffee aroma. Dark brown, long lasting beige head. Fresh, coffee, very drinkable. 0,3 l bottle, market, Pilsen (CZ).

@ The Wheatsheaf, Howden.

Perfect poured pint. Thick beige head, jet black body.
Dry charcoal bitter characteristics. I really enjoy this drink when I fancy one. The first pint is always the best. Not something I could drink all night though.

Many a night have I "tore the hole off a few black ones" surrounded by good friends and warm characters. No beer comes close to this in terms of cultural importance and deliciousness. If there were Guinness cows I'd drink it from the tit. If there was Guinness rain I'd be out there in me jocks with me mouth open, showering in it, relishing in it, becoming it. From the debate around the perfect pint, to "splitting the G" on their famous glass, "Mothers milk" is perfect, and I'll fight any man who rates this below a 5/5.
Very nice macro brew. A dark classic in the dark months. Drink it if you are hungry and listen to live Irish folk songs.

Guinness Draught is quite possibly my favorite macro brew. Hints of caramel, roasted barley, coffee & chocolate are prevalent in this stout. The wonderfully creamy head is an amazing characteristic of Guinness Draught that simply cannot be understated. Its drinkability is out of this world. Tasty, complex, readily available, and ideal for cold weather. Yep, I’m going the full monty here. THIS IS A 5-STAR BEER!

Toujours un plaisir a redécouvrir 😁 
Ce n'est pas ma bière "quotidienne" ni la plus désaltérante mais ses arômes, faible taux d'alcool et calories en font une de mes top

En copa, cerveza negra con una muy generosa capa de espuma beige muy cremosa. Aroma a regaliz, junto con suaves notas de cacao y café. En boca, textura espesa y muy cremosa, sedosa al paladar, de carbonatación baja y amargor muy suave. Sabor seco acuoso a regaliz y especias, cacao y algo de café. Probablemente, la Stout más conocida, aunque sea una cerveza de aroma y sabor muy pobre. La textura y sedosidad que consigue el nitrógeno si que resulta muy agradable al paladar.
Drink draught version only, and also only in Ireland. It does not travel well and is highly regulated in Ireland. Bottle and can versions do not come close - 3.0 rating for those.
Best beer known to man. Could drink for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Refreshing, able to get drunk. Love it
nie znalazłem jeszcze piwa z lepszą pianą. Nie jest szczególnie intensywnym piwem , nadrabia smak swoją teksturą.
Czarne, nieprzejrzyste, gęsta, kremowa piana. Aromaty chlebowe, lekko palone, bez szału. W smaku podobnie - kwaskowy chleb, kawa zbożowa i paloność. Lekkie i niewymagające.
Rich, creamy head with delicious coffee and chocolate notes. Delicious and smooth going down. Very drinkable

Wygląda świetnie - czerń ale nie zbytnio mętna, piania średnia beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowata, długo utrzymuje się. W smaku już tak fajnie jest, czuć kawę zbożową na pierwszym planie, a dalej pustka, nic więcej.

Z kranu w Ostrawie na rynku. Efekt nitro przepiękny - piana sztywna jak białkowa, beżowa. Piwo niestety bez wyrazu, wodniste, kawa zbożowa, bardzo niska intensywność. Odczucie w ustach świetne, aksamitne, gładkie, ale poza tym niewiele.

Gekocht bij de lokale Albert Heijn en gedronken in een BeerBattle tegen de 7 Deugden Stout + Moedig. Voor mij kwam de Guinness als winnaar uit de bus.
Ik heb geen idee of onder invloed van de 'nitro-can' is, maar alleen het inschenken al is bijzonder. Het settlen van het bier is alleen al iets om naar te blijven kijken. De licht creme schuimkraag is niet fors, maar blijft  komen met een donkerrode glinstering in het ogenschijnlijke zwarte bier. In de geur springen er voor mij vooral de gebrande mouten uit. De smaak is niet erg uitgesproken. Mogelijk ook vanwege het bijna ontbreken aan koolzuur. Maar, het moet gezegd worden, je drinkt dit bier bijna meer voor de beleving dan voor de smaak

Why am I only rating this now? Creamy, thick, dense head on top of a opaque Brown body. It smells of molasses, with a touch of coffee. It tastes watery, due to the lack of carbonation. It has good flavors, with a bit of the dry aftertaste. I like it better than I like the extra draft. I don't dislike this beer but I couldn't see drinking it all night long. After one or two I'd want to switch to something else
Just like a supermodel; so good looking that it’s doesn’t matter it’s a bit light on
sjedim ja u sobi i smorena sam kad ono meni poruku šalje čika paki. odem ja u rodu i kupim ginis umesto blue moon, dođen doma i popijem njam njam sfrpslfrp

From the angle of active beer drinker (not beer expert):

Boughten in Serbia 500ml can. 
Pretty drinkable, nice aroma, but without specific taste. Undefined, not what I excepted...

The best that a beer can get. My personal favorite. Dark, aromatic, and definitely not for everyone. If you love Bud Light you may not like this. If you like bakers chocolate and black coffee then you'll like this.

0.44l can (with nitro widget) from a supermarket. Black body,  yellow creamy head, very persistent. Wonderful creamy texture of the foam (due to nitro, I know). Moderate roasted aromas, somewhat buttery. Beer tastes tastes bitter and sour. Bitterness coming partly from hops, partly from strongly roasted malt. Sourness makes it refreshing. Some dark chocolate in the background. Long lasting bitter aftertaste. Palate is very mild and watery: this is not a strong beer. In summary, this is a rather simple, easy to drink, refreshing beer. Yet, despite its simplicity, this is so well composed (with a perfect balance between the strong coffee like roasted bitterness and the bit of sourness) that this is still a very enjoyable classic.
Black colour, pretty brown head that stays long. Aroma is dark chocolate, a bit of ash. Medium bitterness. Light body, easy to drink. Good in hot days.
Personally, I don’t like this taste. It’s like medicine and kind of bitter coffee.  Its not Guinness’s fault. Maybe stout is not my thing.

I have had this beer 4 times and untill now it has not disappointed me. A thick black cream tops a beer with great body and tastes of chocolate and coffee. Smells like the old good Ireland evoking memories of places I have never been to except on books. Surprisingly light and refreshing, it tastes almost as a draft beer for summer days but God knows this is a stout.  If were not for the price I would buy tons of cans.
On tap in Dublin, Ireland. Pitch black with a creamy off-white head. Beautiful blend of malts, roast, licorice. Creamy texture. Love it.
Piana dość duża i ładnie oblepia szkło. W aromacie kawa, nuty mleczne. W smaku kawa, gorzka czekolada, laktoza, mało ciała.
Cerveza con una cabeza espumosa de buena retención. Ligera, de carbonatación media, con aroma tostado, café y caramelo. En boca es muy fácil de beber y resulta muy equilibrada.

On tap, nella classica pinta spillata al carboazoto. Aspetto molto bello, nero compatto coi caratteristici riflessi rubino, e bel cappuccio di schiuma basso, con le sue bolle minuscole, compattissimo e cremoso, color cappuccino, che lascia i baffi impregnati. Corpo molto leggero ma non annacquato (direi setoso), e classica carbonazione bassa. Al naso, molto tenue, pervengono aromi di cappuccino, caffè, lieve torrefazione. In bocca molto tenue, sentori di caffè, cacao amaro, e giusto un cenno di liquirizia. La persistenza gustativa è breve e il finale secco (ma un po' acquoso) pulisce e prepara al prossimo sorso. La bevo da una vita e l'ho sempre gradita anche come birra da pasto, e a mio avviso resta una birra fatta per essere bevuta, piuttosto che recensita.

440ml can brewed in Dublin at 4.2%. Black dark-brown. Nitro head. Possible barely perceptible roast/toffee aromas. Has the characteristics of a nitro can, no fizz, cool and smooth easy drinking. Flavour is very mild. Suggestions of bitterness, roast notes opening up as the beer warms. Utterly one-dimensional and a shadow of the Guinness Original XX, for example. I lump this along with the similar nitro beer John Smith's Extra Smooth as beer that has just enough flavour to remind you what beer it is, but with the focus almost entirely on delivering the nitro smooth experience. If you want that experience with Guinness flavouring, this is your can to pick up. I can't recommend it as a taste experience, however. There's almost nothing going on in that regard, however pleasant it is to drink.

Guinness
Perfect foam because of its nitrogen capsule. High formation, very dense, long duration. Very dark, like coffee.
Aroma brings coffee at first, toasted malted notes, even dark chocalate and a very very low sweetness. On mouth, a very light beer, almost "watered". You stil can feel the same notes (but less intense) like coffee, toasted malted but withou any sweetness. The biterness is medium, came from toasted notes and a dry end.
The aftertaste is much more bitter and kinda resinous, but all came from toasted notes. Notes of toasted bread persists for quite long.
The aftertaste of this beer is much more interesting than the sip itself.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Guinness
Perfect foam because of its nitrogen capsule. High formation, very dense, long duration. Very dark, like coffee.
Aroma brings coffee at first, toasted malted notes, even dark chocalate and a very very low sweetness. On mouth, a very light beer, almost "watered". You stil can feel the same notes (but less intense) like coffee, toasted malted but withou any sweetness. The biterness is medium, came from toasted notes and a dry end.
The aftertaste is much more bitter and kinda resinous, but all came from toasted notes. Notes of toasted bread persists for quite long.
The aftertaste of this beer is much more interesting than the sip itself.

First time i try this beer i disappointed very bad but over time i try and other beers of this style and in general and now i can understand "Guinness Draught" little more..
First of all the beer is very refreshing, watery and has a low amount of alcohol and the last one is amazing benefit. You can drink as many as you want.. Second the beer is like one ordinary "Stout" beer with coffe taste and aftertaste. Here you can't feel the taste in the beginning because the beer is really watery but definitely you can feel the great aftetaste and perhaps that is the strongest part of the beer. The aftertaste leave you one pleasand coffe taste in the whole mouth and with the refreshing draught, you feel great.. 
Overall for the style is great beer and i feel bad because i dont appreciate it in the beginning. But i'm here to fix my mistake and say this beer is very good!
Meilleur stout au monde selon moi, goût raffiné, col généreux, un vrai délice
Surprisingly the first time drinking this. On draught at Annies Tavern, jet back with a thick creamy head. Hints of coffee and a roast like aftertaste. One of the smoothest drinks I've had.
Great caramely and malty flavors, with light acidity. Gently creamy mouthfeel, good carbonation.

First time I taste this was in France and in tap and tasted so bad. Then tried 2nd time and it taste like a spoiled beer. Then I realized when I tasted back in Australia in Can and was like, wow this is very nice. I don't know how magic it comes to my mouth that I like this beer flavor different than the others. High white head and carbonation.
Black gold. Can’t beat a good pint of Guinness. Plenty of bars in Glasgow serve up some beautiful cold Guinness.
Ciemnobrunatne, z ładną kremową pianą i kaskadą.  W aromacie delikatna paloność, czekolada, kakao. W smaku dość wytrawne, lekko kwaskowate, mało ciała.

Malty, dark, yet light on the palate, Guinness remains one of my personal favorites that is readily available.  The "Extra Cold" variety wins out of all their different blends, but the standard doesn't do you wrong.  Not at all heavy despite its pour and color.  Only slight bitter notes.  Generally easy to drink any time.
Tumšs, ar noturīgu putu cepurīti. Krēmīga garša ar patīkamu karameļu pēcgaršu.
Co tu dużo mówić piwo legenda które trzyma swój wysoki poziom  , kto nie pił niech spróbuje a kulka która jest w środku to znak rozpoznawczy tego piwo .
Une bière hors catégorie. Et si vous avez l'occasion de la boire à la source, alors vous serez sur un nuage aussi joli que la mousse de cette bière.
W zasadzie jak lager z palonym słodem. Tylko fajna, kremowa konsystencja zasługuje na uwagę, poza tym nic specjalnego.

Fast schwarzes Dunkelbraun mit rotem Schimmer und cremigem, weißem Schaum. Malzschokolade mit einem Hauch Kaffee in der Nase. Im Mund extrem cremig, dunkelmalzig, ausgeprägt bitter, dunkle Schokolade.
Very smooth taste. Hints of chocolate and coffee aroma. It has a dark beautiful color. This beer should be praise more.

Guinness deserves every bit of praise it regularly receives - the sable liquid is hypnotizing when served in a (preferably) long, circular glass with just the right amount of godsent creamy foam on the top. 
The taste itself is deep, welcoming and smooth, like an espresso without any of the bitterness or rumbling stomach after. You can taste all of the typical flavours one associates with stouts; such as dark chocolate, fresh coffee and sometimes indeed a tint of newly worked wood, like an oak table recently oiled.
All of this blends perfectly together in a flawless fashion.
Another thing that separates Guinness from most other stouts (in my perhaps heretical opinion) is that I haven't found yet a temperature that spoils the taste - cold, room temperature or even warm, the taste remains luxurious despite the subtle differences that occur.
Guinness is, plain and simple, the Rolls Royce of stouts and even beers in general. So far the only beer I've ever tasted that deserves a full score.
Still one of the most beers anywhere it is being served. Ultra smooth, good amount of roast, a certain nuttiness. Iconic in the glass.
(On tap) Black with a big dense tan head. Subtle aroma of roast malt. Smooth soft palate. Dark roast malt with some nice bitterness in finish.

Bu le 06/04/2019
From a can, 
Served in a glass.
Bière noire opaque :-) 
La mousse est beige, persistante et dense ! 
Au nez, on perçoit des notes grillées, torréfiées (Café et céréales rôties).
La bouche est assez fluide, sur des notes de café, des notes d'olive. Elle présente une légère amertume et des notes fumées...
La longueur est plutôt belle !
Can,  firm foamy head, light coffee and caramel flavor. When I pour it I enjoy watching the bubbles making tidal waves in the glass. I’m looking forward to trying jt from tap

Kellemesen kesernyés,tartós hab,jó kávés illat csak egy nagyon kicsit vizes ,nem annyira szénsavas de sörnek ez tesz jót
És a habról még annyit hogy a nitrogén golyó miatt nagyon jó krémes habja lesz mintha egy pubban csapolták volna

Amazing and unique taste. Must be my favourite.

Beautiful texture and a mesmerizing "show" until the foam satles.

Has the best foam I have ever encountered in my life.

Quite expensive though, compared to other products of the same alcohol content and ingredients.

Pivo u limenci.
Sprženo , gorko-kiselkasto , vodenasto..
..nisam to mogao popiti više od jednog gutljaja.. :(

Cerveza sobrevalorada, la espuma que hace por consistencia y sabor es lo unico que vale la pena, por lo demás es aguada y sin un sabor caracteristico o especial, no entiendo por que esta tan bien calificada. Cara.
Coffee colour with a compact, foamy head. Smell of firs and caramel. Refreshing taste with a note of iced coffee and extremely smooth. A fine beer.

Couleur rouge très foncé. Mousse ultra fine vive l'azote. Bière peu gazeuse très aqueuse moyennement amer. Peu de goût / odeur de houblon. Une note de café, mais au final peu de goût. Bière au final très légère. Carbonatation faible limite plate mais ça colle.

Greatest beer ever! I went to the Dublin Guinness Brewery and poured my own to find it even better than someone else pouring it. Has a coffee taste to it. Very dark body with a satisfying foam aftermath. Heavy, filling and great with a good sized meal. IT"S THE BEST EVER MADE!
The aroma of roasted grain. Dark with brown head. Roasted barley, coffee. Medium body, light carbonation.
Who doesn't love a Gunness now and again. I like it best from the tap. The mother milk of the Irish never disappoints.
One of the best beers I’ve ever had. Still on the top of my favourites. The ball inside the can makes it like from bar tap.
Capolavoro birra leggera che va giù come l'acqua , aromi di caffè e orzo  , provata in lattina e alla spina
Ocena tylko poglądowa, wystawiona na podstawie ogólnych wrażeń, bez szczegółowych notatek.

Review: 75cl can of Guinness Draught: 4.2% vol.

Established way back in 1759, Guinness with its iconic Classic harp logo and black coloured can, complete with Arthur Guinness’ scribble. Has the widget inside it too, a small plastic ball containing the nitrogen, needed for the rise of the bubbles to form that fine creamy head we all know and love so well.

One of those beers that is on the 1001 beers to try before you die list. Well I have drank so many pints of Guinness over the years I must be reincarnated to level of Buddhist master super level of awesomeness. 

As expected the appearance is spot on and what one would expect from Guinness, a massive frothy and creamy white head that is alive and takes a while to settle, all with a pitch black colour. Once the dust has settled, we have a very decent looking stout, the iconic Guinness look just right in front of me waiting to be drank. Looks great, the widget did the business!

Soft carbonation and a good bit of lacing. Head sticks around throughout.

An aroma of roasted malts with coffee and chocolate smells, nice and inviting on the nose, pleasant aromas. 

For the taste I got lovely creamy mouthfuls at the start, nice and soft going down smoothly at the back of my throat.

Not a bad taste overall, very smooth and softer than what you would get in the pub from the tap. That is the difference really, the cans lack that bite that you’d have in the pint at the bar.

A slow burner, light sweet tastes, nice chocolate flavours, and a thin body, it is ok. Lovely creamy texture throughout. Nice roasted malts and barley, bitterness is not as pronounced as you’d expect, very manageable.  

An enjoyable drink but comparing it to what you get in the pub is not really comparing like with like. But still it is smooth, tasty, satisfying and very easy to drink, soft and velvety on the tongue, so still a very enjoyable drink from the can.
Simply one of my favorite beer, never disappointed when I drink a good and refreshing Guiness!

11.2 oz bottle (from Dublin, not Baltimore!)
A beautiful ebony color with incredible lacing.
Very creamy, milk like, vanilla taste.
Wonderful mouthfeel, an international standard.

Nose. roast barley, notes of coffee and chocolate.
Taste. The body is light, the taste is empty. Shades of coffee with chocolate and bitterness from roast barley
The finish is dry.

Bevuta alla spina
Aspetto molto bello,schiuma compatta marroncino chiaro. Carbonazione piuttosto bassa. Aromi di malto tostato,caffè e cioccolato e finale amarognolo. Molto bevibile.
Altamente consigliata
Guinness, une valeur sûre ! Jamais été déçu. Un mousse persistante et épaisse très agréable, et un goût inimitable. Un rêve de la gouter dans son pays d’origine !
I love it on tap loads better than the cans. Murphy's are better canned than Guinness but you can't beat a tap

The ultimate definition of dinner beer. Guinness is incredible. Coffee beer as they call it. Darker taste but not strong on alcohol content. Easy to enjoy once you get used to the taste. Guinness was not for me the longest time, but I’ve come to love it over the years and it’s one of my favourites now when the time is right - like having a steak dinner. This is NOT party beer. Try getting drunk off this stuff and watch what happens to you the next morning. You’ll wake up feeling like ass. They have an extra dark Guinness too which is abnormally powerful. I had one bottle of that and I almost went on a beer hiatus. Just stick with regular Guinness - when the time is right of course.
Een moutige bittere smaak, een beige kleur schuim en pik zwarte kleur. Ik proef drop . Afdronk licht bitter.
Heerlijk, mooi bier, bijna zwart met prachtige schuimkraag in een prachtig zwart blikje.
Burk på systemet.  Som alltid lite fadd, som foten har somnat, men så ska den smaka

Pour yourself a glass. Watch the bubbles settle. Guinness is an experience. Smooth with minor tastes of chocolate coffee. A bit of a bite at the end. Let's you know your drinking something special. Something that's been around for a long time and has been perfected. You can skip breakfast and just have a Guinness. Like a meal in a glass.
Can. Medium dark malty aroma, lightly roasted coffee. Clean taste with balanced sweet- and bitter notes. Not overly complex, not very heavy.

I usually don't rate mainstream or macro type beers but since I was in Dublin, figured I would tick this. Pour is a beautiful black color with creamy foamy stone head. Notes are light roast, bread, malt, and milkshake. Smooth and insanely crushable.

Negra opaca, con espuma beige muy persistente. La negra Guinness tiende a cansarme antes incluso de acabar la pinta, así que la bebo muy de cuando en cuando. Tiene un aroma y un sabor muy característico que no me acaba de encantar, amarga y muy seca.
La he probado en el "vuelta y vuelta" de Burgos en una lata. Una vez servida te la colocan en un chisme que hace que se forme y suba la espuma, una especie de agitador ultrasónico, como si te la estuvieran sirviendo de tiracañas.
A fresh Stout with The taste of cola. A foam that feels like whipped cream. A very tasteful beer

0,44l can. Pours dark brown/black with creamy off-white head. Aroma of roast, chocolate/cocoa, coffee. Taste is dry, roast, coffee, loads of chocolate eventually. Next to no carbonation, silky mouthfeel. Although there are better dry stouts out there, it's definitely a classic.
Belle bière noire avec belle mousse. Nez café. Bouche aqueuse sans trop de folie. Très peu carbonatée

Not much to say here - it's the most popular beer in the world, so there is nothing new I could say. Very light body, trademark dark coffee taste, nitro capsule. Definitely something everybody should drink in their lives. Probably multiple times, just to get acquainted.
Update: for some reason Ratebeer decided to turn my 4.0 rating into 0.5 which I noticed only by accident Another reason not to use this dumpster fire of a website.

Aromat delikatny, kawowo palony. W smaku przede wszystkim palone słody, w kwaśny sposób. W odczuciu bardzo wytrawne, a przez brak wysycenia CO2, niemalże wodniste, niemniej ciekawe. W retronosowym odczuciu, ewidentnie pojawia się nuta whisky. Klasyka dry stoutu, ale nie moja bajka.

Au service, jolie couleur noire plutôt engageante, mais cela sera la seule chose positive que je vais trouver à dire de cette bière. Bouche aqueuse, fade, on dirait une pils à laquelle on a rajouté une petite dose de malt torréfié, et encore. Super légère, elle me semble plus aqueuse que dans mon souvenir, ne présente aucun intérêt à mon goût. Je n'avais pas bu de Guinness depuis de longues années et je n'en gardais pas un souvenir dingue. Cette tentative me conforte dans l'idée de ne pas en reboire avant des années à nouveau. Je tenterai à l'occasion la Special Export en espérant qu'elle sera plus à mon goût.
Tap at Kings head, Appleby. Dark black appearance with good white head. Aroma is dark chocolate and coffee. Flavour is nutty, roasted, coffee.

Arguably the most hit or miss beer in the world Guinness has possibly the strongest head of any beer and a strong often creamy flavour but the problem with Guinness is unless it's stored properly it'll taste foul and bitter basically if you want great Guinness drink it in Ireland or somewhere that knows how to serve it
When it is stored and served properly it's probably one of the most delicious beers around with a smooth and soft texture and delicious taste
Aroma of hazelnuts, walnuts, almonds & chocolate. Black with a large longlasting creamy brown head. Lightly sweet taste. Thin body, creamy texture & soft carbonation.

Piwo czarne, ale pod światło widać spore rubinowe przebłyski. Piana oczywiście jak na guinnessa przystało wręcz idealna. Efekt kaskadowy bardzo dobrze widoczny. W aromacie trochę cola, ale też sporo świeżo zmielonej kawy. W smaku jest nieco gorzej. Pojawia się przyjemny kwasek palonych słodów, ale niestety kawa zamienia się w paloność / popiół. Piwo jest wodniste i przez azot gładkie oraz wygazowane. Daje to bardzo charakterystyczny efekt. Nie wiem czy to plus czy minus w tak mało ekstraktywnym piwie. Brak gazu w połączeniu z wodnistością. Ogólnie piwo bardzo prostolinijne ale przy tym bardzo przyjemne. Klasyka w najlepszym wydaniu.

A classic. A bit overblown, but still decent. Perfect creamy head. Served ice cold. Watery as a stout should be, with some roasted and malty notes. Far not the best stout, but might be the best in the mass-market.
Kolor czarny, piana niska, beżowa. Aromat dość nikły palony i kawowy. W smaku kwasek z ciemnych słodów, przyjemne odczucie w ustach.

-非STOUT愛好者
2018/12/26於全聯購買

深咖啡色
酒體中偏重
香氣麥芽、一些牛奶巧克力
泡沫細緻久不散
入口沒什麼雜味
苦味轉瞬即逝
乾燥收尾，有些仙草類的甘甜味
如果牛飲的話還蠻像在喝不甜的麥芽牛奶

If there is something near perfect that You can enjoy at home, not from tap, it is Guinness draught from can.
You can get tap like beer from a can, that almost looks and tastes as great as in Irish pub.
La clásica de las stout. Espuma cremosa y color negro café. Buen aroma y con carbonatación media. Nada más que añadir a una clásica de las clásicas.

Very good Guinness on tap. The dark brown - black color makes it look like a liquid lava, good texture, a bit bitter taste, but it goes into your throat as a water. Tried it in Seny, the best quality Guinness in Madrid at the moment.
Draught in London as Guiness Extra Cold, near Paddington - dark brown color, brown head. malty, medium sweet, some roasted notes. watery body. okay.
I love this beer because it is so flavorful. But he fact that the ABV is so low makes it hardly worth the price that it goes for.

Tall can at Teekay during St. Patrick day celebration.
Appearance: almost black with a beige head
Aroma: slight roasted malt and fruitines
Taste: same
Overall: drinkable stuff so you can consume a ton of it
The beer that got me started on stouts. Easy drinking though the version in Ireland is better than the US version.
Tried from a can, very low on carbonation and watery mouth feel for a stout.  Nice coffee flavour but overall disappointing
Pours cloudy black with a thick, off-white head that lasts forever. A classic beer! The aroma contains bread, toast, and malts. It tastes light sweet with a medium roasted bitter. Dry, toasty finish

Mousse : Crémeuse
Couleur : Cacolac
Goût : légere amertume + café
Vraiment belle bière mais le goût du café est bien trop présent pour moi
Głęboka czarna barwa, fajny efekt przy nalewaniu. Aromat słaby, troche kawy, troche czekolady i karmelu. W smaku wiele więcej się nie dzieje, dochodzi kwaskowatość. Ogólnie wodniste

Kutusunu salladığınızda içinde bir top olduğunu fark edeceksiniz. Açıldığında içindeki bu nitrojen topunun patlaması ile zengin bir kremamsı kalıcı köpük oluşuyor.Kavrulmuş Malt ve kahve kokusu geliyor.Çok az çikolata karamel karışımı hissediliyor.Son derece hafif bir bira bardakta içiniz.
Классический стаут с классическим вкусом Guinness. Тот случай, когда не хочется смотреть рейтинги, а выпить что-то гарантированно хорошее.
If the pub has nothing good on tap this is everyone's go to and the reason is it's a good solid drink that is sesionable and tasty and not fosters or carling. Always good

The brewery with the best advertising and probably the best refreshing stout on tap. Don't get this in a bottle or can because you need to be an expert to pour it up in a glass or it's gonna taste like a beer, who's been left in the Sun for too long with No taste at all. If you get it on tap be sure it's going to take about 119 seconds before you get it from the bartender, some bartender Don't know how to pour a great guinness. Good things Come those Who wait.

Poco se puede decir de esta clásica Dry Stout Dublinesa, que no se haya dicho ya. Sobradamente conocida para cualquier cervecero que se precie. Levanta odios y pasiones por igual. Algunos son de la opinión de que su fama es exagerada y otros, que es una de las mejores cervezas que existen. Yo soy de esos últimos. Una buena pinta de Guinnes recién servida (como se debe, con sus reposos) viendo un buen partido de rugbi o futbol en una pantalla gigante, es uno de los grandes placeres de esta vida.

Aromat: raczej skromny - paloność, czekolada, kawa, melano, ale nie wybija się to specjalnie. 



Wygląd: barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana w kolorze ecru, kremowa, obfita i dosyć trwała. ładnie zdobi szkło. 



Smak: niewielka słodycz, czekolada, kawa zbożowa, melano, tosty, paloność, trochę więcej się dzieje niż w aromacie. Nagromadzenie ciemnych słodów powoduje lekko podwyższoną kwaskowość. Goryczka palona, poniżej średniej przyjemna. Pełnia niska, wysycenie średnio-wysokie i kwaskowo-palony finisz. Alkohol praktycznie niewyczuwalny.

Piękny wystrzał kuleczki przy otwieraniu i cudowna kaskada. Piana utrzymuje się w warstewce do końca. To tyle z zalet. Eufemistycznie pisząc dyskretny zapach i takiż smak. Gdzieś tam może daleko jakaś kawa, coś. Ale w ponad 99% woda, woda z kałuży po deszczu na wyspach. Piwo-nic.

Data do 11.09.19 puszka 500ml. Wygląd: piwo czarne z rubinowymi przebłyskami, piana tworzy się poprzez piękny kaskadowy efekt, długotrwała, zbita, beżowa, drobno-pęcherzykowa. W aromacie słody, kawa zbożowa, mało intensywnie. W smaku ponownie kawa zbożowa, (gdyby było ciepłe, w ciemno nie odróżniłbym), lekka paloność, słodowść, goryczki brak. Wysycenia nie ma przez co piwo jest bardzo gładkie. Generalnie nic ciekawego, pije się je jak wodę. Wygląda ładnie i to wszystko.
Cerveza negra aunque muy ligera y con poco cuerpo, espuma color dorada y duradera. Gran popularidad que hace que parezca más de lo que es realmente.

Re-rate based on the checklist
Smell-medium strong, malt, roast, coffee.
Foam- thin, roast, bitter tones, malt. The Head is tiny, some are left inside due to the ball added, I will give one bonus appearance for the ball added. The foam looks very fine and pretty though.
Appearance- simple can, classic look. Black color weak carbonation, tiny bubbles.
From- stout glass
Taste - watery, malt, roast, bitter tones, bitter and hoppy aftertaste, dry. I am more used to sweet stouts and definitely not a fan of this, seems my taste changed... a bit better later but still don't get it why do people like this?

Old score 17.02.2019: 6/5/6/3/13=3,3
Smell- medium to weak, some roast, weak chocolate, weak hops, weak coffee.
Foam- Tiny, due to ball, medium to thick, some bitterness to sides of the tongue, some coffee. Lasting and sticky.
Appearance- very dark brown, maybe weak carbonation.Like foam sticking around.
Taste- weak sweetness, softness, weak chocolate, some roast, bitterness, some bitter aftertaste, foam feels bitter, drinkable

Pour moi une stout ça doit avoir du gout. J’ai donné 1 point à la bière car elle est jolie et donne une très belle mousse, mais c’est tout. C’est la stout la plus fade que j’ai jamais bue. Si j’avais pas lu les autres commentaires, j’aurais pensé qu’elle fut dilué avec de l’eau. La vie est trop courte pour boire cette bière.
Poured from bottle to glass. Dark beer as expected. Not much of a head. Very watery in taste and lacked the flavor I was expecting.

On tap at Chelsea, Vienna. Dark brown to black colour with big brown head, aroma of mocha, roasted malt. Taste of roasted malt, some coffee, pretty mild, bit sweet, lower bitterness. I know this is standard, but there are much better.
Mudy aspect. Waterly taste, little roasted malt aroma, good aftertaste. Nothing spectacular. (Oh...and that ball inside...)

Not much beats a Guinness for me! 
Smooth, creamy and lower in calories than you’d think! Not for all but definitely for me!
Despite fame of this beer, I was not that excited trying it this time. It felt a bit waterly and too blend somehow.

Puszka 0,33cl z plastikową kulką w środku. Wysycane azotem. Aromat niezbyt intensywny. Pachnie kawą i palonym karmelem. Wygląd: czarne z brązowymi prześwitami. Piękna beżowa piana. Smak niemal neutralny, trochę goryczki. Czuć oczywiście aromaty palonej kawy.
Heel plat biertje, net alsof je een platte water met alcohol in drinkt. Zeer weinig smaak. De Guinness export voor België is veel beter

12/02/19 Aromat właściwie brak jakiegokolwiek, lekko  palona kawa zbożowa. Wygląd idealna piana beżowa oraz czarne z rubinowymi refleksami. Smak lekko palone, kawa zbożowa, mało słodkie, bardziej kwaśne,goryczka dość niska. Finisz kawowy, kremowe, średnio lekkie, bardzo delikatne.. Ogólnie bardzo delikatny kremowy stout bez charakteru żadnego, takie piwo codzienne.
Poured out of a can black thick brown/tan head smell is light roasted malts coffee chocolate taste mostly of coffee little chocolate on after taste not a bad beer light goes down easy
Like thick coffee and alcohol. Good beer. Good on a cold night. Fall or winter.
Aroma of roasted malt,faint cofee. Taste of  roasted malt,cocoa,ash,faint caramel . Light body,  watery and easy drinking .
A little bit too watery to me. Not bad when weather is really hot, yet I don't see it as a great pub choice.
Zacht, romig en licht. Tonen van koffie en chocolade maken het doordrinkbaar maar niet echt uitgesproken.

Very creamy head, black/dark brown body.

Guinness is an experience, not a beer. It is a beautiful looking beer, and its century-old rituals add to its charm, but unfortunately the beer itself is just palatable. The creamy head and watery body do not mix well for me, and none of the usual stout notes appear, instead a taste of flat sparkling water, with a very weak finish of weak filter coffee.
UPDATE: Fuck this last rating. Guinness is above

Pours deep brown to black with a generous creamy fine tan head. Smells rich and malty. Taste is very smooth and gentle with a gentle creamy carbonation, but it's quite subdued. Roasty wholemeal bread and sweet with a very slight bitterness. Drinks very filling and cozy. Finish is short and sweet. Winter drinking. I like it.

Can purchased from Føtex, Midtjylland, Denmark.

Piwo warte zakupu dla zobaczenia "akcji widget" :-)
Barwa czarna z pianą więcej niż średnia, która utrzymuje się do samego końca.
W aromacie delikatna kawa - taka kawa wodnista:)
W smaku podobnie, choć ta wodnistość jest mniejsza.
Gorczycki brak i nasycenia brak.

The appearance is simple wouw, this beer you must drink in a glass, black beer with very long stable fine creamy light brown head, smell is light sour and roasted, a little later cold coffee, taste is light watery but for this style it’s ok, light roasted and light malty, very creamy in my mouth, light bread, very soft carbonation, creamy texture, full body, long finish, very mild,
(I have 0.44l can with best-before 26.03.2019 and batch L8147GE008)

Бутылка 330 мл. Классический стаут. Горечь в послевкусии.Пена довольно плотная,опадает не сразу. Композиция Shane MacGowan "That woman's got me drinking" рекомендуется к прослушиванию при употреблении.
Belle mousse dense comme une pression. Nez très léger malt et café crème. Bouche trop légère acqueuse avec légère amertume pas de longueur en bouche. Bof

Bottle from Albertsons. How did i miss this? After being wowed by the export version in the UK, its time to see if this Guinness can hold it's own. Used to be a go-to for me. Near black pour, thin cap of beige head, not as substantial as I remember. Aroma is sweet and roasty. Taste also comes in sweet, too sweet. Small bitter bite is nothing like it should be. What happened here? This is a poor excuse for a stout, while their export version is superb.
Bottle. Black with a tan head. Bubbles on the bottom of the glass. Fairly strong roast aroma. So so. Pretty weak compared to other stouts I have had. Not much flavor comparitively.
I really hated it when I sipped it for the first time but the more I drank it better it got, amazing for making bread, and cooking as well, I highly recommend this beer for anyone.
Ótima cerveja! Efeito cascata é lindo, ótima carbonatação e "drinkabilidade". Recomendo experimentar.
From backlog. On draft at pub in London, UK. Black with brown head. Roasted malts, coffee, Chocolate.
Lovely day for a Guiness. Always a good day for a Guiness... from tap. Bottles don't work at all.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

Pression le 06/12/2018.

Mousse : Marron, fines bulles, crémeuse, caractéristique.
Liquide : Robe noire, reflet rubis, presque opaque.
Nez : Café, malt grillé, lait.
Bouche : Café, lait, feu de bois, fade.
Palais : Carbonatation faible, trop aqueux.
Color negro, opaca. Espuma marfil, cremosa, de dos dedos de espesor y retención eterna. Aroma escaso a café y maltas tostadas. Sabor igual, amargor herbal. Textura acuosa. Carbonatación media.

Der Geruch ist schokoladig,  leicht rauchig. Ganz nett mit der Kartusche in der Dose. Im Glas ergießt sich ein tiefdunkles Bier mit geringer bräunlicher, sehr cremiger Schaumkrone. Der Antrunk ist leicht wässrig, rauchig, bitter. Die Aromen sind rauchig, Whiskey, Kaffee - leicht metallisch. Kaum bis keine Süße. Dezent carbonisiert, recht gelungen. Der Körper ist durchgehend wässrig. Ein "Kultgetränk", mMn. überhyped, mir fehlt einfach die Power
Excelente cerveza estilo negra, con un sabor exquisito con toques de sabor a caramelo tostado, una cerveza totalmente recomendada

Ciemno brązowe, piękny efekt kaskadowy, trwała, drobna piana. W zapachu trochę kawy zbożowej i tyle. W smaku wytrawne, lekko palone, zbożowe, kawowe, z niską goryczką. Mega wodniste i zarazem gładkie w odbiorze.

Edit 15.03.2021.
Enjoyed: On tap (Harat's Pub Rijeka), into English pint tulip glass.
Appearance: Black colour, beautiful view on development of thick creamy head; nice lacing. 
Aroma: Roasted malt, hint of chocolate, coffee.
Palate: Medium body, very creamy head; gentle carbonation.
Taste: Roasted malt, milk chocolate, coffee. 
Overall impression: Much more enjoyable on tap than from can or bottle, that creamy head is everything.

02.12.2018.
Enjoyed: Poured from a can into English pint tulip glass.
Appearance: Black colour, thick creamy head. 						
Aroma: Roasted malt, milk chocolate, coffee. 
Palate: Strange body, mixing watery and thickness; creamy head; soft carbonation.
Taste: Roasted malt, milk chocolate, gently coffee, gently bitter aftertaste. 	
Overall impression: Drinkable and easy, gently, tasty. Very nice sight. There are much better stouts, but Guinness is institution for itself and good enough for everyday enjoyment. Too pity that aroma isn’t stronger.

Draught at Finn MacCools, The Bush House and Bushmills Inn, Bushmills and The Bog Inn and Peadar O'Donnell, Derry, Northern Ireland. Poured an opaque black with a wide mahogany edge tint and 1cm of beige very dense foam that retained very well and laced very well. Aroma subtly sweet. Taste is sweet roasted and sweet coffee with a light roasted coffee bitterness. Medium body. Smooth and creamy.

500 ml can at home, bb. 4.7.2019. Pours black with a fine, creamy beige head. The aroma is medium malty, mildy roasted malt, toffee, nuts, mild coffee, hints of dark fruits, some grains. Light to medium somewhat watery body with a soft carbonation, a very light sweetness and a light bitterness. The flavor is similar to the smell with mild roasted malt - mild coffee, toffee, nuts followed by some burnt wood, licorice, some grainy notes and hints of cardboard. Finishes with a light roasty bitterness.

Aroma: 6
Appearance: 5
Taste: 7
Palate: 3
Overall: 11
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Dark color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
It is a decent stout, only 4.2%abv with a dry taste , not bad but overrated.

I dont really know about any other stouts that is so famous like Guinness but this one just wont be my favorite at all. On draft it could be a very nice experience and in Dublin especially, but this can version is just dull. Yeah got some smoothness and creamy head and coffee, chocolate aromas and so on. Drinkable as well but nothing else. Nothing special. Just a low carbonated beer with very boring flavours. I guess the real Guinness in Ireland is much more interesting.
Trying this one on Irish pub at BKK good taste easy to drink dark red brown colour not watery it’s good dry stout.

Es handelt sich wohl um eines der bekanntesten Bier weltweit, wohl auch wegen des ausgezeichneten Marketings.
So gibt es auch einige interessante Fakten zu dem Bier: So ist das Bier in einigen afrikanischen Ländern das meistgetrunkene Bier und wird dort auch in Lizenz hergestellt.
Seit Ende 2017 ist das Bier offiziell vegan; vorher wurde es durch einen Filter an Fischblasen geleitet und durfte diesen Titel nicht tragen.
Zum Geschmack brauche ich wohl nicht viel sagen; ich glaube jeder hatte schon mal ein Glas in der Hand.
Es mag geschmacklich bessere Stouts geben, aber dieses kann ich guten Gewissens empfehlen.
Ingresso maltato e lievemente caramellato. retrogusto di caffè. A mio parere la migliore stout bevuta in tutta Dublino.

Pint på O´Learys Centralstationen Göteborg. Kolsvart med smutsvitt underbart skum, mycket fin att titta på. Maltig och lite rökig doft. Rund och krämig smak. En av mina absoluta favorit öl, smakar bäst när den är tappad från fat. Har inga problem att dricka 3-4 sådana här om jag går ut på krogen.

As black as eternal oblivion, as bold as man who stands up for what he believes in, as beautiful as a goddess and as brilliant as Leonardo Dicaprio’s award winning “The Revenant”. This stout will eventually  knock any man out.
Doing this just as it is my all time favorite and go to beer!  Love love Guinness!
Veel smaken van mout, met een drop/koffie achtig aroma. Het donker zwarte bier met nauwelijks schuim is wel te herkennen uit duizenden. -backlog de BierApp-
Odgazowane, bezsmakowe, płaskie i nudne do bólu. Jedynie piana robi wrażenie.

14.9 oz can. Smells of malt, caramel, hints of coffee. Pours very dark in the glass. Tastes very sweet, caramelly, too sweet for my tastes. Very thick, though there are bubbles it tastes/felt flat to me. Finish was sickly sweet to me. Take my rating with a grain of salt, I know lots of people who love this, but it is not the beer for me.

This is the one you are looking for if you're trying to recapture the Guinness pub experience at home, including the nitrogen-driven cream on the top. At least, that's the way things have been since 1970ish. For many people, Guinness and stout are practically synonyms, so it's obviously a yardstick beer - even though it has been surpassed by a good few others. Wins a couple for bonus points for being unmistakable.

Piwo bardzo gladkie, w aromacie glownie kawa. Bardzo efektowne przy nalewaniu i piana ktora nie znika calkowicie po minucie w szkle.  Trudno tutaj mowic o wysyceniu bo jednak ten azot troche inaczej sie zachowuje dzieki czemu pijac nie ma takiego uczucia gryzienia na jezyku. Jedyna wada jest to ze w tym piwie nie za duzo sie dzieje, wodniste a w aromacie glownie kawa bez fajerwerkow. Goryczka raczej slaba. Jak ktos szuka piwa pijalnego na dluzsze posiedzenie to mozna sie skusic.

Had tasted this lots of times, but never rated it. Little aroma, also caused by the fine froth, which however gives it the distintictive velvety taste experience. Typical roast malt notes of coffee and chocolate, luckily not the sweet ones, so the pleasant bitterness stays in the forefront. None of the flavors are too dominant, keeping it easy to drink, even slightly watery, though not in a bad way.
Happy this cheap tipple is back on the menu since going vegan this year! Nice heady smooth stoutvfor relaxing or with food!

On draft at Abbotts Bar & Grill. You can’t go wrong with an ice cold Guinness on draft. This is a classic stout going back centuries. It’s an elixir of life when you consider all the nutrients, vitamins and minerals it contains. It’s hard for me to believe it’s only rated average on RB. The aroma, look, taste, feel all shout classic stout! Enjoy this one.

Piwo bardzo fajnie wygląda przy nalewaniu (efekt kaskadowy) i jest całkiem ok w smaku (lekka kawa, kwaskowe, chlebowa końcówka). Użycie azotu niestety odbija się praktycznie zerowym wysyceniem, przez co jest średnio pijalne.

Robe noire, belle mousse crémeuse (Azote) tenace. Nez sur le café torréfié, légère pointe fleurie. En bouche, c'est très aqueux, pas pétillant, avec un simple léger arrière goût torréfié, peu prononcé. Faible amertume, issue de la torréfaction. Pas mal, mais manque trop de présence et de corps.

Had it first in 2004 or 2005, was a fan in 2007 and 2008, rated it on tap at Dublin Irish pub in Ohrid, Macedonia. Perfectly poured. Malty, nutty, lightly roasty, metallic, caramel. Sweet and metallic taste. Smooth and creamy texture, light to medium body, soft to moderate carbonation, light roasty finish. A mediocre classic.
My "go to" stout when I don't feel like drinking the fizzy stuff. Easy to drink and widely available

Ticks the boxes when it comes to stout. Available everywhere, even in a generic pub with all the real ale taps turned round I can rely on Guinness to give me an enjoyable drink. Coffee notes, rich malt, slight bitterness but not overpowering like an IPA (which is my main favourite style but I also like this). Balanced but not boring is what I'm trying to say. 

My only gripe is that pubs serve it way too cold and while that makes it a refreshing drink, it does mask a lot of flavours so I prefer to buy it in shops and pour it at a temperature I like
Found on tap at bar in Plainfield, Illinois. Great dark appearance with an inviting tan top. It's a classic for a reason but there are certainly better ones made by smaller brewers.

This is a dark beer with a distinct coffee smell and taste. Its appearance is stunning and pleasant to observe. It is quite bitter at the start and finish, but i was able to get used to it quickly. It has a small creamy head which is pleasant and accompanied by a full body and some lively carbonation. However, it is a heavy beer which i needed to sip, and i got full quickly. This is a good beer which i feel some may enjoy while most can at least appreciate.
zapach czekoladowo kawowy bardzo delikatny. wygląd super azot robi robotę. smak delikatny czuć w oddali drewno. posmak delikatny przyjemny

Crna boja, kremasta bijelo-smedja pjena, srednje debljine, postojana do zadnjeg gutljaja. Arome kafe, duvana, dima, blago sušenog voća i čokolade. Srednje gorčine, umjerenog srednje dugog gorkog finiša. Veoma blage karbonizacije (skoro bez), vodeno-uljane teksture,više vodene.

Black color with medium lasting brown head.
Aroma: light coffee
Taste: medium bitter
Great night time beer!  Guinness is like Trump. Either you love it or hate it. I love both!
Não há muito o que falar. Clássica! O que mais marca é a espuma cremosa, o aroma e o sabor tostado.

Deze al vele malen gedronken maar nog nooit geen beoordeling gegeven. Puur zwart met fluwelen crèmekleurige schuimkraag die mooi stabiel blijft. Héél zacht en romig in de mond.  Chocolade, koffie, toffee. Milde (chocolade)bittere afdronk.

Jeżeli chodzi o wygląd jest bajka, mega piana dzięki azotowi, fajnie się utrzymuje, efekt kaskadowy robi wrażenie, w aromacie jest nieźle, lekka kawa i delikatna paloność i tu się kończy to co pozytywne. Po pierwsze piwo ma zerowe wysycenie, pije się je jak wodę, a do tego smak jest dziwny, lekko kwaskowy, jakby wiśnia
Sabor intenso tostado, aroma muito bom e com um sabor bem único, conheço a Fábrica na Irlanda e bebi muita  Guinness.

Piwo prezentuje się wyśmienicie, aksamitna pianka, zostaje na ściankach. Piwo ciemnobrązowe prawie czarne, lekkie rubinowe refleksy. Aromat średnio intensywny, czuć głównie kawę, nieco słodów. W smaku podobnie, mało ciała niestety - dominuje tu kawa ale nie jest jej aż tak dużo. Bardzo niska goryczka. Piwo aksamitne, bardzo pijalne. Klasyka gatunku, warto spróbować - tyłka nie urwie ale jest porządnym przedstawicielem stylu.
Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, na potrzeby uzupełnienia profilu.
Barwa czarna. piana trwała, drobniutka, na azocie. W aromacie pusto. W smaku bardzo gładkie, czekolada mleczna, niestety wodniste.

Mintha sör kávé keverékét fogyasztanám, bármikor napszaktól függetlenül, mindenkinek! :) 5/5
Egyébként sötét vöröses az árnyalata nem fekete!
Pours dark brown with minimal head. Mild roasted malt aroma. Flavour is roasted malt, hints of chocolate. Dry, bitter. OK, but not very good.
Wygląda pięknie, piana jest bardzo trwała, złożona z drobnych pęcherzyków. Barwa czarna. Aromat właściwie niewyczuwalny. W smaku wodnite, trochę karmelowe, finisz kwaskowo-kawowy.

Bijzonder en onderscheidend vanwege donker uiterlijk en bittere smaak. Volle blikjes met drijvende widget.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Virtually black in the glass with a creamy, tan head. A sticky lacing clings to the glass. Not a lot of aroma: mild toast, roasted grains, chocolate — but you have to search. Taste is mildly bitter, full of roasted flavors, with a touch more sweetness up front than at the finish. No doubt the palate is the highlight—medium bodied, rich, incredibly creamy and smooth. Even after all these years and many better beers it’s still a pleasure to find a nice pub and knock back a pint or two.
Dark color with beige head, aroma of roasted malt and chocolale light sweetness, medium bitterness.

Jedyne piwo z palonymi składnikami tolerowane przez żonę. Wygląda pięknie, kulki z azotem się sprawdzają. Jest bardzo pijalne bo trochę pustawe, wytrawne, z niewielką goryczką (aczkolwiek i tak lepszą niż większość koncerniaków). Klasyk, którego trzeba spróbować niekoniecznie więcej niż raz.

Barwa ciemnobrązowa, klarowne, z rubinowymi prześwitami pod światło. Piana kremowa, długotrwała ze świetnym lacingiem. Jest ten efekt kaskadowej piany.
Aromat bardzo, bardzo słaby, głównie karmel, troszke kawy, czekolady.
W smaku jest lepiej, ale bez rewelacji, wszystko jakieś takie przygaszone. Delikatna paloność, kawa, troszke kwaśności od palonych słodów i słodyczy karmelowej. Goryczka niska, ale wyczuwalna. Piwo zdaje się byc wodniste, ale przez to lekkie i pijalne. Jeśli wypiła je moja dziewczyna, która nienawidzi kawy i paloności to chyba coś znaczy :D
Nitro can. Pours thick black with killer nitro head. Slight aroma of malt with toasty flavour notes. Love me a good Guinness
Classic beer, everyone knows it, smells great, tastes great. Is great hell yeah

i remember my first pint of guinness. 
Black thick beer without bubbles. Absolute differend than czech lager, which i am used to drink. 
But after few pints, i started to love it. 
Thick, black beer, low cabonation, Coffee and roasty aroma. So thick texture, dry body, sweet. smooth creamy finish.
Great beer, very, VERY easy to drink. I drank 2 pints in one time, when i wanned to be wasted.

I cannot think of another beer that is as well known internationally and is also a great beer. It's best, if you get it from the tap in a country that allows using nitrogen, but even then you need someone at the bar that takes the time to tap it correctly. If you don't trust the bar staff, go for the "extra cold" tap. If the first sip is crisp and refreshing and you drink past the bottom of the harp in your pint-glass before you can put it down, it is well tapped.
The tins with the widget improve the experience over bottles or tins without,  but still only manage to draw even with a badly tapped Guinness.

Keg at the St. James Brewery, Dublin. Seems best when served out of the small tasting glass. Perhaps due to the higher temperature. It’s a totally drinkable beer, with a decent roast malt flavour. Just wish they toned the Nitrogen down a little.

Piwo jest mocno ciemnobrązowe, ale klarowne. Ma rubinowe prześwity. Bardzo bujna piana, która świetnie sie prezentuje. W aromacie płytko: troszeczke paloności i tak naprawde to tyle. Natomiast w smaku jest lepiej, chociaż nie jakoś bardzo. Też paloność, troche kawy, ale wszystko mocno wodniste i lekkie. Chyba troche za bardzo. Goryczka lekka. Poprawne piwo, po prostu
Stout histórica e clássica. Ótima para quem quer experimentar uma cerveja do tipo. Gosto bastante.
Nie można napisać niczego złego. Pamietajac, że produkcja idzie w miliony narzekać można jedynie na to, że z puszki, nie z beczki gdzieś w podmiejskich okolicach Dublina...

Guinness draught
Meget mild i kroppen
Fantastisk stort hoved, takket være nitrogenkuglen, der udløses. 
ikke megen smag, meget neutral, men læner sig op af de klassiske "Dry stouts"
En anelse roasted 
Let drikkelig
Fantastisk flot hoved og fin hazy brun krop.

Uiterlijk: Zwart, maar tegen het licht gehouden robijnroo met een  dikke witte schuimkraag, net slagroom.
Geur: koffie, cacao, geroosterd mout en gronderig.
Smaak: geroosterd bruin brood, chocolade, hout, tikkeltje turf en eindigt een beetje zurig.
Mond: Volle stout die droog en een klein beetje rokerige eindigt.
Een topper binnen het segment, van de tap nog beter.
Can at home, black beer, small head. Aroma is light, some roasted malts. Taste is the same, quite light somewhat watery, decent enough but somewhat lacking.

My favorite in the 90s
