Drunk lot of times. Last time, many pints during the evening of St Patrick’s Day at The Beehive, St Albans, UK. Colour is turbid dark brown to black, with nice creamy beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, biscuit, caramel, coffee and chocolate. The taste is roasted malt, coffee, caramel, roasted earth, liquorice, also a milky note. Is very difficult to describe all the flavours because the Guinnes taste is unique and everybody can recognize it. Body is medium and carbonation is low. Palate is sweet and creamy. I thought it was a wonderful stout, but then I tried other beers with the same style and I realized that it wasn’t so great as I thought. Just good.

From the turtle can, on the airplane, into the plastic glass. Black, nice almond head, and excellent "Guinness" effect, and left persistent pace even on the airplane plastic cup. Aroma is coffee and chocolate with a hint of cola. Taste is the same. Palate is a bit watery, as I remembered, carbonation very subdued. Not a bad beer, really, especially now that I’ve had a few to compare it with.

0,5l from tap at Hard Rock Cafe Vienna on St Patricks Day. black colour, small tan head. smells tobacco, licorice, earthy, bit grainy. ok smell. light body, quite light carbonation, decent mouthfeel. tastes of licorice, earthy, tobacco, but grainy. finishes lightly roasty and dry with notes of licorice, tobacco and earthy notes. decent but not overall special, too light.
Pint from tap at the Churchill Arms. Creamy and milky, with subtle touches of caffe. It’s a classic!

Proefglas van blik tijdens HOP goes Black in Gainsbar te Kortrijk. U: Bijna zwart met een rode gloed en een dunne licht bruine schuimkraag. G: Koffie, cacao en geroosterd. M: Waterachtige aanzet met enkele geroosterde toetsen. Flets! M: Weinig body met bijna geen carbonatie en totaal niet sticky.

Pours deep brown to black with a beautiful beige head. Nose is roasted malt and a hint of coffee. Taste is coffee, chocolate, and lots of malt. Very creamy and smooth. This is the original; if I’m judging on style it’s a perfect score. But to my personal preference, it’s just fine. It’s nice, light, and easily drinkable. I’d happily drink it all night long and, while, not being? blown away, wouldn’t be too upset.
Dark, dark brown almost black with a tan 1.5 finger head. Head retention is superb and watching the nitro pour in action is always cool. Thin creamy body with low carbonation.
a true classic! innovator of "pour aesthetics". best served ice cold with your mates on a sunny afternoon.
Bardzo kremowe i nisko wysycone. Prezentuje się pięknie. W zapachu słody. Smak: smukły i lekki z wyczuwalną lekką kawą.
The beer looks perfect (if properly poured). Excellent beige head, and it tastes very nice. One of my favourite light beers - definitely worth the price.

(440ml can) Aroma: Chocolate, caramel, a little bit like a dark lager. Not intensive at all.
Appearance: Dark, but not completely black, clear, good head - like always from nitrogen.
Taste: Little sweet and some bitterness is present too. It’s very blank. Little chocolate, some malt and caramel. 
Palate: No body at all, thin texture, actually, long, bitter finish - which is nice. And it’s flat ofc.
Overall: That was weak, more like a water, black water with head. Probably beter than most mass beers, but still nothing particular.
coffee, chocolate, black, cloudy, white foam, frothy, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter finnish.
Can. Clear dark cola body, small nitro beige head with good retention. Aroma of burned caramel, toast and condensed milk. Taste of burned caramel, burned malts, toast and herbs. Slightly odd palate.

Tap at Seamus O’Donnels, Bristol. St Patrick’s Day celebration.
Huge off-white, creamy head, very dark brown, nearly black colour, nice lacing.
Aroma: Roasted malts and coffee.
Taste: Lightly bitter, with dry/coffee finish. Light to medium body, bit watery, flat. Very nice at the beginning, quite boring towards the end, however had a great time.

16oz can. Pours black with a frothy medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, cocoa, minerals, and a little grain. Taste is about the same, with a little coffee, some earthy hops, and a touch of fruitiness. Bitter. Medium body. No carbonation. Watery but creamy.

Nitro can on St. Patricks Day. Pours dark with a full and lasting tan head. Aroma is caramel and roast malts, very smooth and silky palate, haven’t had a nitro can in a while. Not much malt or hop character to speak of really but enjoyable all the same.
roasty, chocolate, black, clear, frothy, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter,

Black coloured ale with a small creamy tan coloured head.

Aroma: roasted malt and coffee.

Taste: coffee, roasted malt, some mocha, some sweetness, watery and quite bitter.

Creamy medium mouthfeel.
roasty, bread, brown, clear, rocky head, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, flat,
Barwa idealnie czarna, gęsta, kremowa piana. Delikatnie wysycone, troche wodniste, ale przecież tak ma być. Jeden z najlepszych koncerniaków.

Big Macro beer, but probably the best major beer in the world. It’s rather thin, little bit weak in flavour, but it’s easy drinking beer and tho I’ve had many better stouts in more recent years I can still drink a Guinness and enjoy it, it’s got some flavour’s, it’s not like water. Also probably one of the only big Macro beers in the world that is not a lager or pilsner. To Guinness!

I enjoyed this beer very much. It has a nice smooth appearance and espresso color. The micro bubbles in the carbonation help in go down smooth and do not cause you to feel overly full. The taste was medium bodied and smooth with hints of coffee and remnisent of dark chocolate. I would drink this again and felt I could have easily had another without concern of feeling overly full.
Pours black with a pillowy lingering white head. The classic Guinness taste is silky smooth with a mild malt & a slight hint of hops. Classic.

That nitro induced appearance is nice. Aroma is roasted malts, weak roasted coffee beans, even a bit of hops appear. After a while, you can feel some chocolate also, but kinda introverted. Light body, watery, a bit creamy also, and it’s a smooth drinking. Flavors go with the nose, with the dry bitterness at the end being a faithful ally. Classic.

Nitro-can. Pours black with a creamy tan head. Nose is simple - just roasted malt really. Taste is rather watery, and is mainly the roasted malt note, plus a little bitterness. Palate is unimpressive - short, light, and slightly sticky. Still and all, Guinness is probably better than most mass produced beers if you end up somewhere that doesn’t have any decent beer.

Zwart bier met een rode gloed en crèmekleurige romige schuimkraag die blijft kleven. Geur: geroosterde mout, wat karamel, vleugje koffie en een lichte hint van chocolade. Smaak: licht geroosterde moutsmaak, droog, licht zoet. Romig maar waterig mondgevoel. Weinig tot matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitter en een klein vleugje zuur en wat noten.

Dark, almost black colour in the glass with 2cm of creamy head, dark crimson with a light shone through it. A dark malt nose but not much else. Roast malt flavour with a short lasting body. Nitrogen bubbles.
Dark amber color with big brown head. Malty aroma. Bitter and dry taste. Feels quite watery.

From nitro-bottle in shaker. Pours black with creamy head and aroma of roast malt. Smooth drinking thanks to the N2, classic mellow finish with a bit of smokey bitterness. Reasonably close to tap version.

14.9 ounce can into imperial pint glass, canned on 5/26/2016. Pours crystal clear very dark brown color with a 1 finger dense and creamy light tan head that lasts the whole glass. Thick creamy lacing clings down the glass. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, and toasted dark bread; with light nuttiness, smoke, dark fruit, herbal, and yeast/roast/toasted earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance of roast/bready malt and light earthy hop/fruity yeast notes; with solid strength. Taste of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, and toasted dark bread; with light nuttiness, smoke, dark fruit, herbal, and yeast/roast/toasted earthiness. Light herbal/roast bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toasted dark bread, light nuttiness/smoke/herbal, and yeast/roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Good robustness and balance of roast/bready malt and light earthy hop/fruity yeast flavors; with a nice roasted bitter/sweet balance, and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from roast/bitterness, increasing through the glass. Light carbonation and body; with a very smooth, fairly grainy/chalky, and slightly sticky mouthfeel that is okay. Very thin with no creaminess at all. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.2%. Overall this was a decent Irish dry stout. All around good robustness and balance roast/bready malt and light earthy hop/fruity yeast flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. This was too thin and bit watery than I expected; but it was still quite enjoyable overall, and a good style example.
Can a black colored beer with a white head aroma roasted malts spicy laurel citrus fruits and bitter hops flavor roasted malts citrus laurel spicy and bitter hops
Very nice and creamy head. Very smooth. Smooth mild malty flavor. I always enjoy a Guinness on tap.

Classic Guinness pour, lots of head if your not too careful. Eddies of tiny bubbles as the beer settles. Quite a mild aroma of roasted malt. Very clean taste, quite understated. Almost a little watery. Malt otherwise, chocolate and some coffee. Extremely smooth drinking. A classic.

Barwa prawie czarna. Piana jasno br?zowa, drobno ziarnista przypomina rozpuszczone lody kawowe. 
Aromaty kawy, kawy z rumem czy likieru.
W smaku bardzo podobnie.
Goryczka kawowa, palona jest niska i ma?o intensywna.
Wysycenie ?rednie w kierunku do niskiego, pasuje. Piwp jest zdecydowanie za "chude", wodniste i to jest na pewno minus.
Can. Nice coffee & roasted malt aroma, but taste is totally empty, almost like water. Only a little bit of coffee. Nitrogen gives some smoothness.
My go to beer, love it all my life. Black, creamy nothing much not to like. Great
Dark black and a solid creamy foam. Dark roasted malt and a medium body. I don’t liken it that much but it is a good beer

Bottle. Aroma- weak coffee and some maltiness. Black, clear, with a fantastic head- I’ve tried this beer couple of times, but nitrogen always makes an impression. Taste- creamy, with delicate coffee and nothing more- no roastiness, no bitterness. Quite watery in the aftertaste. Good beer for a football match, but as a Stout- quite poor.
Looks so fucking sexy. Taste dry roast with creamy body, easy going and smooth.

Draught at the brewery. One of those classics which deserves the attention. Pours brown and becomes a wonderful dark beer with a beautiful thick off white foam. Surely the worlds most beautiful pint (?!!). Lacks taste of other stouts but then again i like to think of Guinness in a world of its own and it’s one of those drinks I’ll always want on some occasions. 
-----
Less beautiful in can in UK (maybe 3.6 in Irish pub, 3.3 england can) 
----
Keg at Captain Cook, Östersund. A unique beer that does the job on many an occassion. Hard to rate guinness, certainly a 3.6 on draught, maybe less in can. 
-----
Keg, same place. Nicely caramel this time. Shame one is always thirsty af afterwards. 
-----
Keg, Bishops Arms Östersund. Today it was just so damn good. 
Smooth and cold. St paddy day after a shift. Moorish af 3.7. To 3.9
-----
Re-rated in brewery tap, Tullamore. Confirmed. Nutty, malty. More depth in ireland (9/11/18)
-----
Keg at Captain Cook, Östersund. Really didn't feel very wonderous this time. 3.9 to 3.6.
aroma of roasted malt and coffee, dark brown colour with creamy beige foam, tastes watery, a bit bitter , and coffee like, low carbonation.

Kolor niemal czarny klarowny. Piana beżowa z drobnych pęcherzyków, bardzo drobnych, sztywna, długotrwała.
Aromat palonych słodów, kawy, bardzo wytrawny, delikatny, niezbyt intensywny. Chmielów brak.
W smaku wodniste, znów prym wiodą kawowe nuty, prażone i palone zboża. Goryczka minimalna, palona. Bez alkoholu w odczuciach. Wysycenie wysokie. 
Piwo jest jednowymiarowe, trochę nudne nawet. Najlepiej prezentuje się wizualnie, zwłaszcza piana. Przyjemny delikatny zapach, a doznania wieńczy płaski i wodnisty smak.
Can. The appearance is very pretty, courtesy of the nitrogen. Some roasted malt with some creamy texture to it. But it’s flat and no lingering taste. Super boring stout, like a boring lager.
Can at home. Head big and creamy. Aroma sweet chocolate, taste more bitter coffee. A little watery, taste and mouthfeel both rather flat. Easy drinkable.
Piana jest genialna. Smakuje dobrze ale smak jest mało intensywny i to jest główna wada. Polecam bardzo
Dark brown beer with beige head. Aroma is roasted malts and coffee. Taste is a bit bitter, malts, caramel and coffee. Good balanced beer. Medium body, mild, easy drinkable.

Barwa ciemnobrunatna, z przebłyskami, piana trwała. W aromacie słabo, lekka kawa. W smaku wodniste, lekka kawa, lekka paloność, wyraźny finisz chmielowy, ze słabą goryczką. Wysycenie bardzo niskie, odpowiednie, bardzo mało ciała, dobra pijalność. Wodniście, aż zanadto...

Can. Of course great appearance: clear brown colour, large, durable tan head. Faint aroma of dark and roasted malts, some coffee. Taste is light sweet and bitter, malty, coffee, roasty. Light+ body, average carbonation, watery, but smooth texture. The same old Guinness: drinkable, but watery and not intense.
Guinness jaki jest chyba każdy wie. A jak nie to niech sprawdzi. Niezłe pifko.
Backlog. Przenoszenie ocen z innego serwisu, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Niezły dry stout, świetnie sprawdza się wtedy, gdy trzeba kupić coś w markecie, a do domowego magazynku daleko.

Barwa ciemnobrunatna, z przebłyskami, piana biała, kremowa, trwała, osadza się ładnie na szkle. W aromacie ubogo, trochę słodów, jasnych, bardzo minimalna jakaś kawowość. W smaku wodniste (nawet już nie wodniste), spora kwaskowość, lekka kawa, lekka paloność, wyraźny finisz chmielowy, ze średniej mocy goryczką. Wysycenie bardzo niskie, odpowiednie, bardzo mało ciała, dobra pijalność. Wodniście, aż zanadto, mimo wszystko to jednak "stout"
Draft in Doolin, famous cascading pour which settles ruby black. Drinks smooth, very little carbonation. Its a really well made sessionable beer.

Puszka. Piękna trwała zawiesista piana, widać na pierwszy rzut oka że różni się od tradycyjnej trwałością i wyglądem. Aromat ciemnego słodu, karmelu, z czasem wychodzi też kawa. W smaku kremowo - to wrażenie z pewnością potęguje piana, ale jednocześnie bardzo wodniście. Subtelna paloność, lekki karmel i kawa, to wszystko. Posmak palonego słodu i kawy, dość krótki. Bardzo lekkie, łatwo się pije między innymi dzięki niskiemu wysyceniu. Klasyk. Może i bez bogactwa aromatu i smaku, ale nie można oczekiwać wiele od stylu. Tak czy inaczej warto spróbować, przyjemnie się pije

Coffee, caramel, roasted malts in nose. Pours very dark brown with beautiful beige head. Taste is medium dry to dry with coffee and roasty notes. Low bitter, herbal finish, soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. Overall solid as always.

Cerveza muy sobrevalorada bajo mi punto de vista.
Un aroma flojo acompañado de un sabor a nada debido a su casi inexistente cuerpo. Un paladar también insignificante.
Eso sí, una apariencia destacada. Color negro con una capa de espuma amarillenta.
Como conclusión, una cerveza con mucha fama internacional que me ha proporcionado la misma satisfacción que cuando me tomo un vaso de agua sin sed...

The classic stout. first one I ever tried back in the day. I was blown away at the time, couldn’t believe something could look as pretty as this in a glass. Guinness knows that their shit sells so this stuff goes for a premium price. If it wasn’t so expensive id session this stuff, but oh well. Complaints are the price, the lack of flavor, and the lack of body this has. its just too damn watery. Overall great session stout if you are willing to fork over the cash. Looking to compare this with Murphy’s side by side soon.

Nagy izgalommal vártam, hogy a híres nevezetes sört kibontsam. Nagy csalódás volt. Valaki fogott egy adag kávézaccot, és leöntötte sörrel. Becsületből megittam. Lehet, hogy Dublinban egy helyi kocsmában megfelelően lecsapolva ízlett volna.
a classic. soft bodied refresher stout. roasted malts and slighlty coffee are nice, but it’s a bit watery.

Draft @ The Arrow, Yeovil (had it numerous times before and afterwards though). Aroma of roasted malts. Taste is liquorice, dark chocolate and cocoa. A pleasant little bit of butter. Some hops. Creamy but also watery. Low carbonation. Totally sessionable. Reliable.
Poszka 440 ml,barwa prawie czarna,piana beżowa,niezła.W smaki i aromacie palone,kawa,czekolada.Leciutkie z lekką goryczka.
puszka 500ml. Uzupełniam swój profil na ratebeer, piwo wypite jakiś czas temu.
Classique pour n’importe quel amateur de bière. La pression surpasse toutefois ( très ) largement n’importe quelle bouteille/canette.

Non-nitro bottle pour into tulip glass from Signal Variety. Appearance is mostly black (dark ruby with light source directly behind), thin beige head with poor retention and trace lacing. Aroma is mostly bitter roasted malts with hints of coffee. Taste is as aroma. Palate is medium-to-full bodied with thick texture, soft carbonation and finish as taste. Overall, always prefer the nitro version. This is rich but is pretty one dimensional.

Aroma is mild, mostly roasty. Pours extremely dark brown/red, nearly black. Widget does the magic and the beer looks great. Delicate flavor, predominantly roasted malts, coffee, some caramel, light bitter finish, dry overall. Light body, very smooth and mild, low carbonation, very drinkable. It’s famous for a reason.

Piwo w szkle wygląda na czarne, pod światło ma wyraźne rubinowe przebłyski. Piana jest piękna, to największy atut Guinnessa Draught. Beżowa, kremowa, wręcz śmietankowa, trwała. Aromat to lekka paloność i sumie niewiele poza tym. Klasycznie dry stoutowo i tyle. W smaku również głównie paloność, kończąca się lekką kwaskowatością, trochę czekolady. Bardzo niskie wysycenie, piwo jest prawie puste, sprawia wrażenie wodnistego, jest wytrawne, jest bez wątpienia sesyjne. Na finiszu ziołowa goryczka. Przy tym wszystkim sprawia bardzo pozytywne wrażenie i choć ogólnie jest raczej przeciętne, to jest ikoną stylu, ze wszystkimi jego cechami, wśród których jedną z ważniejszych jest wysoka pijalność.

W aromacie kawa, czekolada. W wyglądzie czarne z gęsta kremową pianą zdobiącą szkło. W smaku bardzo kawowe, kwaskowate w stylu mocnej kawy, trochę też czekolady. Lekka kawowa goryczka, wytrawne. Faktura aksamitna, bardzo pijalne, lekkie. Całkiem przyjemny klasyk.

W zapachu lekki kwas jest możliwy do wyczucia; po pewnym czasie nic a nic już nie czuć. Wygląd piwa jest największym jego atutem; widget robi robotę - widok osiadającej pianki (delikatnej, długo się utrzymującej) jest fantastyczny.
W smaku goryczkowe, ale lekko i przyjemnie. Posmaku praktycznie brak, dominuje wrażenie wodnistości.

Zwarte kleur met dikke badschuimachtige beige schuimkraag. Geur is eerder zwak melkachtig. Heel dun mondgevoel, te waterig naar mijn mening. De smaak is koffie, geroosterd met een toets van aangebrand bbqspek.

Wygląd: czarne piana niezwykle drobna(azot), w puszce kulka po azocie
Aromat: lekko kawowy, nuty palone, delikatny
Smak: Kawowy, lekka kwasowość
Goryczka: niska
Nasycenie: średnie,

the aroma is caramel and chocolate with shades of toast, toffee, black bread and nuts... the taste is caramel and cereal with notes of roasted malt, toffee, chocolate, toast and nuts... sweet and bitter aftertaste...

18. 12. 2017, Brežice bar. Bottled. Good ol' Guiness, probably the first stout I have ever tasted. Classic coffee aroma and full, silky body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

4.1% and previously 4.2% 440ml Cans and bottles.

Black with ruby red highlights and a creamy thick tan head of foam. It has a slight metallic, brine and chocolate flavour with coffee and roasted notes on the smooth, creamy finish. Good.
Faktura gładka spoko, wygląd idealny dzięki azotowi. Smak lekko kawowy i palony ale bardzo płytki. Aromat też płytki. Można wypić na imprezie ale szybszego bicia serca nie wzbudza

Negra con reflejos rubíes, casi opaca. Espuma cremosa color ocre de buena retención gracias al nitrógeno (único punto fuerte) Apenas aroma a maltas tostadas, sabe a lo que huele, a casi nada. Sin cuerpo, aguada. Cada vez me gusta menos esta cerveza, la peor sin duda de todas sus hermanas.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Can as a Christmas gift. Was nice to have a Guinness after a long time away.
Enjoyed but didn’t love. There are better dry stouts out there. Creamy head is a nice touch though.

En fût. Couleur brune foncée presque opaque, mousse moka crémeuse et éternelle laissant une épaisse dentelle. Arôme de malt torréfié, café froid, cendré. Goût de malt torréfié, café léger. Carbonatation faible, corps moyen-faible.

Lattina da 0,50. Schiuma densissima e persistente. Carbonatura quasi inesistente. Colore nero. Aroma fortemente legnoso, amaro e sentori di corteccia. Nel complesso poco decisa e troppo caratterizzata. Finale breve. Sará la lattina sará uscita male ma... Consiglio 2/10

Barwa ciemna, fantastyczna, genialna, mistrzowska piana. Piwo świetnie się formułuje w szkle, stopniowo przybiera właściwą formę. Aromat nie powala tak jak wygląd tego piwa. W smak karmel, trochę kawy i czekolady. Wodniste.

Delikatnie słodowy aromat. Piana niesamowita, wysoka, drobna, barwy kremowej, doskonale oblepiająca szkło i pozostająca przez długi czas. Najładniejsza piana świata! Świetny patent z kulką :) Barwa czarna, z rubinowymi refleksami. Smak delikatnie mleczny, troszkę kawy. Piwo dobrze wysycone, ale zdecydowanie za bardzo wodniste. Brak wyczuwalnej goryczki. Piwo wspaniale wygląda, ale w smaku jest nijakie i moim zdaniem do bólu przereklamowane.

En canette 33 cl. Superbe mousse crémeuse ... et qui reste. Odeurs : pain, biscuit, café, lait (breakfast ?). Saveurs en bouche : café, fruits secs style noisette, légère amertume. Un peu plus d’alcool et ce serait très bon mais ce n’est tout de même pas mal, loin de là !
有丰富细腻的泡沫，也有股烘焙过的大麦味道，但品起来没什么层次感，水感太强，后味发苦。

Went to Dublin to try "real Guinness". Oh dear, what a disappointment. It looks lovely in its black and white glory, but has no taste, body or aroma other than a slightly muddy aftertaste. Utterly disappointing. Beer for people who prefer style over substance.

From bottle. Really dark brown color with creamy tan head. Aroma has mostly sweet, roasted malt. Taste is just roasty with a hint of caramel but not much else. Light body, quite watery, low carbonation. Really easy drinking but it lacks some complexity.

On tap, 25cL. Home. A shining pitch black beer with a creamy beige head ; good retention. Roast, cereal, light coffee, chocolate. Light sweet, light to medium dry lasting refreshing. Medium body and texture, soft carbonation, dry sweet roasty finish. Overall, enjoyable !

F: pale brown, very creamy, not big but very stable.
C: dark, opaque, red tones against the light.
A: roasted malt, oats, some mineral, coffee, dark chocolate, yeast.
T: malt, roasted tones, dry bitterness on the palate, chocolate, coffee, watery, light body, good carbonation, for me quite watery but good balanced otherwise, 0,33l can from Colruyt in Brussels.
Looks beautiful and has a nice thick mouth-feel. Moderately smoky, coffee-like flavour mixed with bitter sweet taste of dark chocolate. It is a lovely beer.
coffee, nuts, roasty, black, minimal head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, salty, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation,
PL: Piwo czarne z brązową pianą. Lekkie aromaty palone i chmielowe. Lekkie, kwaskowate. Wodniste. Jest palność. jest zboże. Nic specjalnego.
Denne stout har et sort udseende med et tykt hvidt skum. Øllen har en sød maltet aroma og smager lidt ristet deraf med noter af chokolade. Cremet fornemmelse. Lav karbonering.
Sanft, samtig und sehr seicht. Leicht schwarz, dezent säuerlich und unaufdringlich. Kann man zwischendurch verhaften. A Bommel Surprise Gift.

Pours black with red tinge, cappuccino thick head from Nitrogen. Looks great and thick body. Taste is smooth roast, abit of ash and chocolate. Dry but low hop bitterness. Starts well on the palette but ends with little or no flavour. I guess it one of the more refreshing stouts out there but lacks any real character other than it?s looks and body. I feel if this was conceived in modern times this beer would be confined to back shelves of supermarket, but hey, it has plenty of historic charm and the go to intense beer for people who don?t really like intense beer. Extremely sessionable and well made though, if alittle dull

Can. 4.1%. From the local offie. Clear, dark red. Nitrogen induced, dense, creamy head. Nose has chocolate truffle. Some roast coffee bean. Sweet roast malt. Taste is slightly sweet, with light, roast bitterness. Mouthfeel is smooth, but pretty watery. Short, very lightly bitter finish. Ok.

0,44 l can, expected more, believe the reason of lower quality is in fact that brewery delivers ingredients to local factory. 
Standing that by side, aroma is smoky and you can smell the aroma of roasted ingredients and that is a huge +. Mi suggestion is not buy it in can, much better from bottle and it is a big difference between a " local Guinnes" and the Dublin one.
Cheers !
A roasted aroma but not a lot else. Black with creamy nitrogen head. Medium bitterness which lasts, a roasted character and a slight metallic note followed by a smooth creamy finish
Tap. Malty aroma a little bit roasted. Terribly empty, almost no taste, slightly bitter. It looks nice and has nice texture but nothing more

Tap (Nimeta, Tallinn)

OK, right now I’m in Arizona drinking a can version which is shit, worth about 2.7, but I remember last week’s so well I’ll rate that one. It was one of the best I’ve had. Lovely rich roast. Black, tight creamy head. Mellow roasty taste, like a milky coffee. Easy to criticise a macro, but no, this can be a delicious beer. Canned version is just so watery.
Seems strange giving something so commonly available such high marks but I love draught Guinness out the can. So smooth, the only deductions are the slight metallic taste and smell you get.

Aroma of yeast, roast malt, cold coffee. Appearance is a blackish ruby with a thick pillowy head with excellent retention. Nice sheets of sticky lacing. Taste is coffee with cream, hint of cocoa, mild fruity yeast esters, vanilla. Palate is medium bodied with a mildly sweet and creamy texture. Lingering fruity/roasty taste with no apparent bitterness. Overall- A classic stout that can hold its own, even amongst a plethora of craft offerings.
Canned. Black body, big beige head. The aroma is sweet, the taste is roasted, with some tomato (!) and herbs.

Poured from a nitro can. The colour is dark brown to black, the head couldn’t get any better - dense and long-lasting. The aroma isn’t very intensive, there’s some coffee, chocolate with raisins, some roastiness. The taste is sweet, coffee, dark fruit and tangy from the roasted malts. The mouthfeel is very creamy and smooth. It’s very drinkable, well-balanced, I could have this any time of the day or year.
16 ounce can with widget. Smell a little coffee. Dark black in color with big beige creamy head. Taste some coffee, kind of thin, very smooth. Enjoyable for a commercial stout.

Poured from nitro can into a classic Guinness glass. Colour is opaque black and slight ruby around the edges with long lasting white head. Aroma is not substantial, hints of roasted coffee, no noticeable hops. Taste is lightly malty with notes of roast coffee and a light tang on the finish that makes you want to take another gulp. The mouthfeel is creamy and smooth. The body and balance of this beer are really exceptional.

This is what all commercial beer should be. Perfect balance, palate, head, aroma. It just doesn't get better.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap@Kennedys, Copenhagen - can’t believe I had not rates this yet - dark brown to black with a thick beige head. Toasted and light roasted malty, smooth mouthfeel, sweet and toasted malty into the finish.

Very dark with a slight ruby sheen. No strong hop aromas but this accentuates the taste. Rich and creamy in appearance with good head retention thanks to the nitrogen system. No strong hop flavours and a smooth creamy taste with a slight twang after consumption that craves for more. 

One of the best stouts out there.

Quick tip, ask your server to pull the pint straight up without stopping, the stop and top up is a Guinness ploy to make the beer more special, don’t believe the hype.

Gezapft im Oscar Wilde Pub in Berlin-Mitte. Dunkles Braun, kleiner Streifen Schaum. Wenig Aroma, etwas Karamell, etwas Mokka. Mundgefühl angenehm weich und cremig. Leicht wässrig, Karamell und Kaffeenoten. Wird geschmacklich stärker nach hinten.

CAS- Cerveza melosa y de sabor muy suave y agradable que deja un regusto amargo.
GAL- Cervexa melosa e de sabor moi suave e agradable que deixa un regusto amargo.
Can at home. Black with brown-tinted edges. Invincible, creamy head. Roasty. Watery mouthfeel. Mild sweetness and citric acid. Faint toasty finish. Plain and pleasant.
Smell of dish water and money saving techniques contribute to a really lame dark ale that really tastes like chewing a dirty cloth
Aus der Büchse getrunken (Supermarktkauf). Dunkles Rotbraun im Glas und dank der Kartusche schöner Schaum. Mild, weich und wässrig.

44 cl. can. Pours very dark brown/almost black with a massive and very long-lasting beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, bread, coffee, biscuit, butter. It has an enjoyable medium bitterness. Full bodied with a creamy texture. Carbonation is very low and it has a creamy bitter finish. Although it is a quite heavy beer in the stomach, it still leaves a watery sensation in the mouth. I actually like Guinness, but I would not regularly consume it. Good to enjoy once in a while with company.
500ml on tap: Pours black with creamy tan head. Roasted notes with stone fruit on the nose. Finishes dry with a heavy body. Low bitterness. I like.

Dose aus dem Pyongyang Shop - endlich gibt es Guinness auch in Nordkorea ... - Tiefschwarz, stabiler kremiger Schaum. - In der Nase milde aber angenehme Röstnoten, Mokka. - Antrunk äußerst schlank mit sehr milder dunkler Malzsüße, fein ausbalanciert durch zarte aber tiefe Röstnaromen, pikante Säure und feine krautige Herbe. Schlank, beinahe wäßrig, wenig rezent. Im Abgang ein wenig Asche, Anklänge an Seife und gerade noch ausreichende Hopfenherbe. - Was sich in Worte gefaßt recht bescheiden liest, wirkt im Glas doch recht überzeugend; selbst der dünne Körper ist auf seine Art reizvoll. Sehr süffiges, rundes Stout.

Ah it seemed as if it were yesterday that I made my first foray into the realm of dark beers by the bottleneck of a Guinness Draught. Please understand my slightly timid approach to consume something of near polar opposite nature to clear golden lagers. Many many many...many pints later I shall digress. 

The most uniform beer in a glass the head is near milkshake density of pillowy nitrogenous orgy, light tan in color. The color is dark brown with ruby highlights at the outer edge. The aroma is slightly lactose, light milk chocolate and roast barley note. Prunes in the end. In the taste the body is on the light side for a stout. Super smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Light roast and caramel flavors with dark fruit (plum) in the finish. In reminiscing I always enjoy coming back to a pint of this to well... reminisce.

Pours black with a foamy tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt and coffee. Taste is mild and bittersweet with ripe fruits, nuts, roasty flavours and some coffee. Having a Guinness every now and then is always a pleasure.
Draft. Dark with Ruby red tinge, the creamy head is great and goes well with the malty, biscuity, subtle chocolate and bitter finish.. Always enjoyable and light enough to have a few.
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, На здоровье, Na zdravi.
Can. Black with perfect foam. A classic beer. Roasted, coffee, some dried dark fruits and some nuts. I like this one and still remember my first Guinness. I’ve saved it for my rating nr 500.

Piwo barwy czarnej z rubinowymi przebłyskami, piana niesamowita - beżowa, drobniusienieńka, zbita, można ją jeść łyżką, przypomina pianę w kawowych deserach. W aromacie czuć palony słód. W smaku jest mało intensywne - przypalona skórka od chleba, słodowość i niewiele więcej. Wysycenie w zasadzie żadne. Goryczka niska. Dobre na piwo codzienne, warto spróbować choćby ze względu na bardzo ciekawą pianę.

Bottle - Pours dark brown/black, creamy tan head. Aroma of dark roasted malt and butter.
Flavors of scorched pancakes, weak coffee, and a tart middle. Very mild hops finish.

Can, 0.44l. ABV of 4.3%. Pours dark ruby, almost black body with creamy, slightly off-white head that lasts. Smell is roasted malts and coffee, slight chocolate. 

Thin body, very softly carbonated. Surprisingly watery texture. Slightly bitter taste with roasty and dry mouthfeel. Sadly lacking in aroma department. Roasted malts, licorice, coffee... not bad, but quite watered down. Finish is medium lasting and dry.

Overall, very mediocre. Expected more out of this.
Great dark beer, I enjoy it a lot. It is a really nice beer, one of the best I ever tried

Can, 1 pint. A dark beer with a very creamy brown head. Aroma is of coffee ane roasted malt. Taste is moderately bitter with a character that reminds me of dried fruits, especially plum. Light bodied with a watery finish.

The original. My session beer of choice. Ubiquitous and cheap, it?s always there for you wherever you go. The output is so vast yet the quality usurps that of all the other commercial beers. APARIENCIA: de color marrón intenso casi negro. Corona de espuma color marfil, muy cremosa y de buena retención, con burbujas muy compactas.

AROMA notas a grano tostado y café es lo que destaca.

SABOR: ligeras notas a café y grano tostado, además de caramelo quemado, todo muy ligero. El retrogusto queda un amargor ligero, seco y no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: al inicio el cuerpo es ligero pero con sensación unutosa, conforme pasa el tiempo se vuelve más acuoso. Baja carbonatación.

RESUMEN: stout con poco cuerpo y sabores predominantes en el tostado algo astringente.

AROMA: Hard notes of coffee, bacon, and charcoal, along with a bit of chocolate.

APPEARANCE: Opaque, black liquid with a tan, brown head that stays. 

TASTE: Very heavy bitter taste enforced by the charcoal and coffee notes. 

PALATE: Full bodied with a creamy texture. A soft bit of carbonation with a strong bitter finish. This is a very heavy beer, definitely not one you chug down at a party. This is a pub beer through and through. 

OVERALL: Guinness is an acquired taste, more so than a lot of the other beers in it’s price range. I generally prefer my beers on the lighter, more refreshing side, but every once in a whileI do enjoy a nice heavy, frothy draught to change things up.

Donker / zwart, iets donkerrood onderin het glas. Bruin/creme kleurige schuimkraag die de gehele Pint blijft! De Nitro doet prachtig zijn werk.... het blijft een schitterend gezicht in het glas. Aroma: Geroosterde mouten, licht koffie, chocola en karamel zoet.... hint vanille.

coffee, roasty, dough, medium sweetness, medium sourness, black, brown foam, frothy, cloudy, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,

De la macro cervecera St. James’s Gate (Diageo)(UK) "Guinness Draugth" cerveza que es la presentación clásica de esta marca de origen irlandés pero en lata con nitrógeno y 4.2% ABV, el estilo es una Irish Stout. Históricamente los estilos Porter y Stout eran el mismo, cuando se hablaba Stout era el mismo tipo de cerveza pero referia a que contaba con características mas fuertes que resaltaban el sabor y el carácter que dictaba el estilo simple, la marca Guinness se especializaba en Porter y empezó a incluir en su receta tradicional la malta negra que ellos mismos tiempo después patentaron, luego agregaron copos de malta y emplearon malta tostada que doto a las Irish Stout de mayor sequedad, tambien a esta macro se le debe el uso de nitrógeno en los barriles anteriormente solo se utilizaba CO2, el nitrógeno al ser mas denso aporta cremosisdad a la cerveza mientras se desvanece y ya a finales de los 80’s la implementación del nitrógeno en las latas con la típica pelota que contiene esta misma cerveza en esta presentación, inovadora desde sus inicios. En la actualidad ya no necesariamente las Stout son mas fuertes o atenuadas que las Porter por la utilización de diversas maltas obscuras y procesos de fabricación dejan una muy delgada linea entre algunos de estos estilos.
La Guinness Draugth vino a dar identidad a la cerveza de Irlanda en apariencia si se ve con detenimiento se podrá constatar que no es del todo negra y tiene ciertas transparencias el las colindancias con el vaso de tonos rubi, esto es mas difícil de apreciar en la version de lata puesto que como dije el nitro le da aparentemente mas cremosisdad a la cerveza que la versión de lata , posee un cuerpo diferente al de la versión con CO2, puesto que una propiedad como ya dije del nitro es aparentar cremosidad ademas de que mejora la retención de la corona, ya que prácticamente es una nata que dura casi toda la vida de la cerveza, siempre y cuando se sirva de forma correcta. 
En aroma impera el carácter a café, maltas tostadas, costra de pan y cierto carácter terreo, un aroma minimalista y de tradición para el pueblo irlandés. Ya en el paladar es acida moderadamente, toques a grano tostado, carácter terroso, agua mineral, liviana en textura y un final muy seco pero que no es tan perdurable. Cerveza sencilla que simplemente cumple con el estándar y que en algún momento fue el parámetro para este estilo.
Nu ta janoverte. Vispar man jau kuro reizi, man tomer patik mazaa gaze, miikstaa garsha un grauzdetaa karamele. Nu dzerams izstradajums, bet aukstaa formaa. Buutu 5.5 abv, butu krietni labaka

Aromat kawowy, jednak mało intensywny. Barwa ciemnobrązowa, prawie czarna, piana przepiękna, kremowa, nie widać nawet pęcherzyków. W smaku jest lekkie, lekko kwaskowe, delikatnie palone. From foamy brown to pitch black as the head settles. Head is creamy, dense and shows very good retention with low lacing. Aroma of soft toasted malts and light coffee (grains) among a milky/soft feel. A hint of vanilla. Taste has a soft toasted malts base, a hint of milk coffee, vanilla. Light to medium body with extremely delicate/soft crispness, resulting in a very smooth and easy but still nicely creamy mouthfeel. A not very "natural" beer, crafted to enhance a creamy and yet simple/easy mouthfeel. It does it's job at that, and feels overall enjoyable; but definitely lacks depth or autenticity.

Nitro-can, nitro-keg and nitro-bottle; Filtered Usually called Draught; sometimes called Cold or Extra Cold - same beer, but served colder. Abv ranges from 4.1 to 4.3 % depending on where it was brewed (Guinness exports a hopped and concentrated wort to regional breweries who then brew it on site). Launched in 1961. Ingredients: Pale ale malt, about 25 to 30% flaked barley, and about 10% roasted barley, with no other grains or sugars; several hop varieties, mainly Goldings (pellets and isomerized extract); a flocculent head-forming ale yeast.

Stout beer, with medium body, black color, soft carbonized, some foam in the top, (drunk a pint during Guinness Storehouse tour).

330 ml bottle. Pours black colour. Tan head. Aroma of roasted barley, bread crust, smoke, burnt grain. Taste is the same. Thin body. Watery palate. Some roasted bitterness detected. Well, nothing special. Expected more from this beer.
Draft. Black color, nitro-foam. Burnt barley, light acidity, a little coffee, watery, good drinkability.
Actually had on fraught. Lovely head and black body. Aroma heavy roasted with cream. More cream and roast malt. Bitterness in the finish. Classic, but a bit too much bitter in stout for me.
Tap. Pours black with a frothy large tanned head. Aroma is malts, rye, burnt sugar and esters. Somewhat milky palate, taste of roasted malts, coffee and very faint hops. Bitter-ish. Oldie but goodie.
From can with widget: Aroma is mild but roasted malts and licorice with dark chocolates. Taste is sweet and brings the same tastenotes as the aroma. Pretty thin stuff.
Une bonne bière de soif avec une p’tite twist de stout, L’azote donne un nice mouthfeel. assez aqueux pour tinquer ça vite

Horrific taste, reminds me of weak coffe or tea.
Got a sore tummy afterwards, don’t buy this stout again! :(

I only bought this to get the Untappd badge... 



Black beer with a creamy,beige-brown head. 

Not much of a nose. Just a hint of roasted malt. 

A small taste of rosted malt, a little bit of coffee and nothing more...

Smooth with a dry ending. Almost no carbonation. Waterish mouthfeel.

Roasty, hints of coffee, white/tan indestructible head, beautiful black, law carbonation, light/medium body, taste of coffee, roasted malts, not too bitter, very creamy...yes, like everybody, one day, i want to retry it in Ireland but, for now, remains a good drink.
Vom Fass. Klassisch schwarze Farbe. Bein zapfen ein Traum. Heller cremiger Schaum. Schwacher Duft. Geschmack trocken bitteres Röstmalz. Unerreicht.
Pour is a thick black, thin white head and still as stone. Smell is roast, malt, strong black coffee, and dusty basement. Taste follows, deep and resonant, black and bitter. Long bitter finish

Marrom escura, opaca. Espuma cremosa, abundante e persistente. Aromas de malte torrado e café, que acompanham o sabor, incluindo chocolate, caramelo e um pouco de defumado. A espuma de nitrogênio dá um toque especial. Amargor de médio para alto. Retrogosto amargo com final de malte torrado.
440ml can in a pint glass. Pours black with a creamy tanned head. Aroma of roasted malts. Roasted malts and carmel taste with a smooth creamy mouthful.
Poured from can 14.9 oz black color with a nice creamy tan head. Aromas of roasted malt chocolate and caramel. Taste is smooth and creamy with balanced bitterness.

Draft @ Pickwick Pub, Malmö. Pours a black color with a creamy tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and caramel aroma. Roasted malty smooth caramel flavor. Has a roasted malty caramel and dark rye bread finish.

Przeklejka na szybko z UT: Rami RamiGuinness by Guinness Draught

Rami Rami is drinking a Guinness Draught by Guinness at Mordor na DomaniewskiejKawa zbozowa, fajna w uscie 

Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

From a can (0,5l). Pitchblack, beautiful creamy head (love that). Aromas of roasted malts, taste of roasted malts, a hint of coffee, cream. A bit on the light side, but still tasty. Probably better in Ireland from a pub, but still like it!

Pours a matte black with a creamy thick off white head. Aromas of roasted malts, roasted nuts, cream. Taste is slight roasted notes and lactose. Mouthfeel is creamy yet thin with moderate carbonation.
This beer is a first love. Great appearance, roasty aroma, smooth mouthfeel with a slightly bitter and dry finish. Stating the obvious, but this is the classic Irish dry stout.
Looks awsome. Aroma of caramel malts, little roast, coffee and hint of smoke. In taste light refreshing with nice touch o sweet and roast/smoke. I always drink this one when there’s no craft in pub.

Very dense taste with lovely creamy bubbles and lots of burnt caramel, coffee and a medium finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very weak aroma. Appearance is just iconic 10/10. Very nice taste, simply and a little bit watery but extremely drinkable. Low bitterness. Very fine beer from a big company. An icon of its style. Definitely must try to everyone.

I don’t drink a lot of beer, or different styles, but I started drinking Guinness almost 28 years ago on our honeymoon in Ireland. I have had it now and again over the years at restaurants, and on St. Patrick’s Day, and most recently again on a trip to Ireland. Bottles, cans, draft. . .it doesn’t matter . . . I friggin’ love this stuff, enough said.
Nesten helt svart med et silkemykt skum. Kaffe og vanilje i duften sammen med et lite metallisk preg. Kaffe og nøtter i smaken med en lett bitterhet. Myk og behagelig munnfølelse.

Draught at various places including Temple Bar in Dublin and have never really enjoyed it as much as the majority of other stouts I’ve tried. A marketing success and an iconic beer rather than a great beer. 
Pours close to black with a creamy solid head. Faint malty, chocolate aroma. Light sweetness, medium bitterness. Medium body, but a rather watery texture. Little by way of carbonation. Underwhelmed...
33cl bottle, pours black with a thin creamy off-white head. Aroma is mostly malts. Taste is smooth, creamy, roasted malts, finishes dry. Body is watery, light carbonation.
Very fine and creamy off white head on almost black beer. The palate seems just a bit thin, but all the good flavors are there. Slightly more sour than expected but otherwise very pleasant.

16 oz draft pour at Clyde’s Willow Creek Farm in Ashburn/Broadlands, VA. Served in a Guinness pint glass. Dark brownish black with frothy beige head. Aromas of chocolate and cream. Tastes of chocolate, light roast. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Not as watery as I remember from having it a few years ago at some average sports bar in Woodbridge.
Black with an off-white creamy head. Subtle coffee and roast on the nose. Low sweetness and bitterness in flavour, watery, smooth, a bit roasty finish. Drinkable but boring and too watery.

Deep brown, cream silky tan head. Light roasty aroma and herpal hops notes. Palate watery, low carbonation with trademark small nitro bubbles (cask). Taste faint roastiness and burnt sugar, hints of chocolate. Dry finish, lingering biterness. Nothing bad about this, but very mild and bland tasting beer, but it is Guinness - I guess its meant to be such.
Canned. Big head. Aromas of dark malt and nuts. Very dry, watery with roasted taste. Classic.

Sampled from a bottle at DFW airport. Ever reliable, tastes exactly as you would expect. Good roasted flavours, smooth and nicely bitter. Excellent. I prefer the Foreign Extra Stout, but it's still not bad.

Belle mousse bien crémeuse pour cette Guinness issue d'une canette. Bien que les Stout ne soient pas mes bières favorites, j'ai pris plaisir à déguster celle-ci. Amertume faible, léger goût de malt torréfié. Il manque peut être un poil de corps à mon goût.
What can you say. Smooth, creamy, and not at all overpowering. It seems to be just as good in the can as on tap.
Thick medium tanned head. Enjoy it’s subtle ruby color. Roasted malts, coffee, caramel. Strong body. Bitter finish. Even better when drawn in Ireland.

Opaque black color with a copper hue. Thick and creamy light brown 1 finger head lasting around 10 minutes and clinging to the glass. Powerful legs with a sexy pouring activity slowly revealing the foam.

Aromas and flavors of sweet smoky molasses, roasted coffee, cocoa and herbal spices. A little vinous with the smell of alcohol, almost metallic. Nice intensity and well balanced flavors, not too intense and having both sweetness and some sharpness.

Smooth creamy full body with pleasant carbonation. Balanced soft finish, slightly spicy and bitter dry mouth coat with a roasted coffee feel.

Overall : Very accessible classical craft. Great balance in flavors and well intensified with good freshness.

Pours from can a beautiful deep brown except for ruby depths, with big tan that leaves considerable lacing and skim.
Uncomplicated nose: roast chestnuts and coffee. Similar on the palate, with bread, a hint of chocolate and some chalkiness added to the dominant roast malt. That’s slightly bitter, but the major impression comes from the famous creaminess _ thanks, nitrogen. Light body belies the color and taste profile.
Not a particularly layered or ambitious stout, but an approachable and readily sessionable one. The Irish brew is preferable to North American siblings.

On draught. This is one of the Worlds’ most famous and popular beers. I think that is more down to clever and extensive advertising than the beer itself. Guinness is watery and quite a bland taste, there are dozens upon dozens of better porters and stouts out there. Try some.
Een houterige en waterige smaak voor deze Ierse stout. Redelijk vlak, ook vanwege de absentie van koolzuur, maar staat in zijn eigen recht.

On Draught. Subtle roasted malts with chocolate and toffee notes. Mahagony to black with a healthy head that sticks. Thin mouthfeel but still has a nice richness. Super easy to drink and looks beautiful.

I tried the canned, the bottled and the tapped version too. The tapped version was interesting. The bartender put the glass on a device that made the beer to fizz. (nitrogen in this case) So far the bottled version was my favourite.
Black colour with creamy long lasting tan head. Aroma: Coffee, roasty bread. Taste: Little sweet taste, the coffee dominates but the bitterness isn’t harsh becouse the beer is watery. Becouse of that the body is light/medium and almost no carbonation at all. Very dry finish. It’s an okey beer but the hype is too big.

Best way to have Guinness: from a nitro keg. Pours smooth, light tan head, very lightly hoppy. Need to quaff quickly or will tend to become flat after 10 minutes. Guinness Draught and Guinness Extra Stout are completely different, ES is much thicker, darker, has more chocolate and yeast notes, slight leathery aftertaste. Much better than regular Guinness, just cannot get kegs in US.
Pours dark with a thick tan head, watery mouthfeel, but a flavor. This is my all time favorite fallback

Tap @ Stringfellows. Dark with a creamy tanned thick head. Coffee nose with creamy milk chocolate. Creamy smooth mouthfeel. Sweet malty and creamy taste, dry roasted notes, chocolate, ash and creamy coffee.

Can from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is maybe some roasted malts. Taste is soaked malts in water, tea. Very thin and empty, especially consider how creamy it looks. Dried Out Stout. Perhaps I don’t get this style. One of my least favorite beers thus far.
Piwo z kulką. Cóż tu więcej... bardzo ładnie wygląda. Jak się nie umie, to się nie nagazuje i się pije szczyny.

Donc, c’est la version à 4.2% qui serait différente de la plus populaire? Alors, l’azote offre vraiment une belle prestation, c’est très beau à voir. Lorsque ça se termine, on dirait un dessin graphique. La mousse, couleur café-crème semble être empreinte de gélatine et figée sur place. Ça ne bouge plus. Au nez, ça sent le chocolat principalement, mais aussi le grain grillé et la crème dans le café. Le goût est ordinaire; aqueux, acidulé et minéral. En fin de gorgée, une impression suave, veloutée et svelte, comme si elle savait qu’elle n’a pas été à la hauteur des arômes. Et on lui pardonne son manque de profondeur gustative. (Encan. 10-07-15) (1703-070116)
La cerveza negra por excelencia, con mucho cuerpo, densa y suave. Entra muy bien y a pesar de ser un tanto densa en muy ligera, no es un sabor fuerte.

An Irish, black stout with low, very creamy head, infused by nitrogen that fizzes up once poured, and by a ball in the can. Aroma is roasted, coffee, yeasty, prune? Taste is bitter. Very low carbonated, almost flat.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,5 bottle. Pours dark brown, almost black color with creamy tan head. Aroma of caramel, malt, dark chocolate, medium bitterness.Good one.
Dry stout with some chocolate notes. Very smooth mouthfeel with some slight caramel and grainy notes. Some chocolate as well, but slightly metallic. Tasted quite good.
A classic. Pours black, amazing soft and foamy head. Best part is over once you have poured it. It is a timeless classic, but it’s mid range for a stout.
This beer is among my all-time favorites. Great dark taste with caramel tones and a typical ’dry’ aftertaste.

Negra con ligera transparencia, espuma media con buena retención. Ésteres a chocolate y café moderado alto, malta maltoso tostado moderado, lúpulo terroso bajo. En boca ésteres a chocolate bitter moderado, café, pan, biscocho, malta maltoso tostado bajo, ceniza, lúpulo terroso bajo, lúpulo de amargor bajo, lúpulo de amargor bajo. Final seco corto con notas tostadas, cuerpo bajo, mediana carbonatación.

Pours black with a fine lingering tan head. Nose is muted with a touch of coffee and sweetness. Flavor is smooth but extremely thin with the slightest bits of stout character. Waste of roasted barley.

On tap.
Black body with a large, creamy, light-brown head, fully lasting with some nice lacing.
Light-to-moderate malty (roasted), aroma with notes of coffee.
Moderate-to-heavy bitter flavour; bitter-roasted finish.
Light-to-medium body with watery texture; soft carbonation.

Had a glass of this on draft on 4.8.14. 

Dark off-black pour with some tan head. Lots of malt and sugar in aroma and taste. Not great. Not awful. It’s meh.
Can. Pours a dark brown to black. Decent taste of coffee and chocolate. Goes down real easy.
Sötét barna szín, ujjyi bézs színű paplanszerű habbal. Illata illata csokis, ize édes, csokis eléggé lágy. Egyáltalán nem testes, a végén hatrozott keserűség jelentkezik.

In a 11.2 oz bottle. Pours black with a 2cm thick tan head. ( does not have the living foam that a true Guinness draft has). Initial thin taste of cocoa and dark chocolate. Finishes with a dry astringent cocoa.

Klares dunkelbraun mit durchschnittlicher beiger Schaumkrone. Malzig, Röstaromen, etwas Karamell, trocken, würzig, spritzig.
Looks amazing - creamy yet hardcore. Tastes like water. Great for getting seriously drunk. Can drink lots of it. Not challenging to the taste buds at all.

Optisch nichts zu meckern, absolut top.... Der Schaum ist fest hoch und unverwüstlich. In der Nase dominieren röstige schokoladenaromen. Der Geschmack ist leicht hopfig bitter aber auch röstig und malzig aber auch etwas dünn.
Aroma: cocoa, chocolate, light coffee and sweet notes. Taste: chocolate, coffee, malts, very smooth and dry. Really drinkable. Great head, good lacing and low carbonation.

pours brown turning black, cascades nicely. not much aroma. tastes of choco, roasty malts, bit of coffee. worst thing is that it gets filling near the end of a pint but still feels thin as youre drinking it. ok tho

Aroma: weak chocolate and caramel aroma.
Appearance:almost black color, nice ceamy off-white head,nice lacing
Taste:sweet,very sour ,chocolate,toffii and roasty flavour,roasty aftertaste.
Palate:light to medium body,soft carbonation.

Guinness Guinness Guinness Guinness Guinness Guinness Guinness Guinness Guinness! 
Proper beer!
0,44l Can. Creamy white head. Light bodied for a stout, roasted barley dominates the aroma. Nice bitter aftertaste.
From tap at Doerak, during Nederlandse Bieren Festival Delft. Dood droevig medelij bier. Backlog from 2015/06/28.
Den behøver vel ikke den store introduktion. Den har dog altid forekommet mig mere vandet end farven og aromaen lægger op til. Men alt i alt en god øl.

This is my Gold Standard for Irish Dry Stouts. It’s definitely the Smoothest Beer I’ve ever had:) Good by itself and as a half-n-half -OR- Black-n-Tan. Love how the Cans & Bottles include the Nitrogen Caps that give the famous "bubbles" that you see in Draft;)
Can. 0,440L. Price 0,99€. Labai graži spalva, puikios putos... bet skonis nuvylė

Not one for me. I am used to stouts that are a bit heavier and are more full of flavor. This one has a light body and flavor is dominated by the burned malts. There is good bitter in the aftertaste with some smokiness but the ash flavor is stronger.

Nera e densa con cremosa schiuma bianca. Caffettosa e tostata, è una stout a mio avviso debole e poco profumata, troppo "scivolosa" al palato e povera nella struttura. Non è malvagia, ma la stessa Guinness dà il meglio in altre "versioni". Quando spillata come si deve guadagna qualche punticino.
440ml can. Pours dark with medium brown head. Aroma of burnt malts, ash, chocolate. Light, watery body with very soft carbonation and dry finish.

50 cl can, 4,2% ABV. THE classic stout. No deScription from me, that would be silly with nearly 5000 reviews already. Just a simple rating from my point of view. Tasted with a chocolate dessert. Cheers.
At draught, Three Tuns, London. A bit disappointing, mild to be a stout. Almost no hints of coffee, chocolate etc.

Dose 0,44l: Schwarz, deutliche Trübung, sehr kräftiger sehr stabiler beiger feinporiger Schaum; würzige Nase, leichte malzige Süße, kräftig Malz, Malzzucker, dunkles Karamell, kräftige Röstaromen, nussig, etwas Kaffee, getrocknete schwarze Beeren; sehr würziger Körper, kräftige Röstaromen, Röstmalz, Getreide, dunkles Karamell, sehr cremig, kräftig Kohlensäure, trockene Hopfennoten, Nussschalen, Kaffee; angenehmer trocken-würziger NachgangFlasche 0,5l: Schwarz, trüb mit kräftigem stabilen Schaum; die Nase angenehm mit leichter Süße, kräftigem Malzzucker, dunklen Beeren, schwarzen Kirschen, Röstaromen; würziger Antritt, cremig mit angenehmer Bitterkeit und einem trocken-würzigen Nachgang

This is an exceptionally good light beer. I will gladly drink it instead of the usual low calorie fare. However it any hold its own against most stouts or porters.

Nice creamy head. In aroma dark malts, a little bit of coffe and chocolate. In taste coffe with milk, dark malts. A bit roasted, but thin bodied.
Almost black with a medium off-white head. Aroma is bacon, bread and malt. Taste is toasted bread and malt.
0.5 l can. Extra thick cap. Dark, cloudy. Low carbonisation. Altogether typical stout, but rather flat and mild.
Aroma agradável, e uma aparência perfeita, negra, espuma densa e duradoura. Sabor marcante, amargo, cremosa e com notas de café.

0.56l draught. Black color with creamy, forever lasting brown head. Some roasty aroma, but mostly nitrogen. Taste is nitrogen sour and little bitter. I am not sure if this is normal, but it is not good.

Wygląd jak z pompy, brunatne z gęstą, zdobiącą szkło pianą i efektem kaskady. Zapach nie jest bardzo intensywny, ale da się wyczuć nuty kawy i czekolady. W smaku bardziej wytrawny, kawa z mlekiem i charakterystyczna cierpkość. Lekka, przyjemna kawowo - pyłowa goryczka.

44 cl can from Kaufland, served in a tulip. Dark brown, opaque, with huge tan head that lingers. Aroma is malts, subtle toffee, mild grassy, slightly roasted, faint coffee. Medium body, soft carbonation. Taste is low on sweetness, low to medium bitter, texture is oily.

Nitrokeg can. It’s been years since I’ve had this and my memory is off avery bad beer... Nose is malt, hint of coffee, nitogen, wet station platforms. Taste is nitrogen, nothing at all but nitrogen, slight sickly hop and a little malt in the finish. 

Guinness is overated in the bottle, but genuinely disgusting in the nitrokeg can.

Foam cream, beige resistant. Lovely. Swirling bubbles are fascinating for a few moments in front of a breath. The color of the beer completely opaque dark brown. The aroma zhzhenost malt, coffee, dark caramel, cream. Very attractive appearance and flavor. The taste is thick and viscous, creamy, bitter and slightly sour zhzhenosti. Incredibly soft, lightweight. The aftertaste burnt caramel and a little coffee.
One of the most popular beers in the world. The diamond of Dublin and Ireland. Great history normal stout
De barril en un pub irlandés, la espuma muy persistente, pero me faltó la cremosidad en la boca. Muy refrescante, aromas a café tostados y sabor balanceado entre acidez, amargor.

It is, of course, a symbol of the beer history. I don?t appreciate the big multinational. Despite of that and the fact I heard that Guiness used some strange ingredients, I have to recognize that it is an average stout. The main point is the color black and dark and strong like the cream and the foam is line an Italian espresso. After, we can smell the coffee, dry and fresh. The final note in the mouth is not so strong. I love the foam creamy.

Puszka (ostatnia pozycja z zakupu "anglików" w Lidlu, wypita dokładnie w International Stout Day :-))
Genialny wygląd, ciemne piwo w bardzo klasycznym wydaniu oraz kapitalna, specyficzna dla tego piwa piana, na której wygląd niewątpliwy wpływ miała słynna kulka i azot.
Aromat jest lekkim rozczarowaniem, niby czuć jest to stout, ale to wszystko takie odległe, płaskie. Czyżbym za długo trzymal to piwo na półce ? W smaku odrobinę, ale tylko odrobinę lepiej, bo jest i paloność, i kawa i nawet trochę ciemnej czekolady. Nie ma ameryki, nie czuć tamtejszego chmielu i dobrze, to jest w końcu Guinness a nie jakiś american stout. To co nie jest w/g mnie dobre to to, żę piwo jest cholernie wodniste. Być może dobrodziejstwa polskiego kraftu przesunęły mi nieco punkt odniesienia, ale Guinness kojarzył mi się ze słynnym onegdaj terminem "piwo chrzczone".
Aromática porém achei o corpo muito fraco para uma Stout. A espuma gerada pela cápsula de nitrogênio é show, nunca desce, mesmo após beber toda a cerveja.

0,33 l Longneck-Flasche aus einem lokalen Getränkemarkt. Dunkle trübe Farbe, wenig Kohlensäure und eine sehr schnell abfallende bräunliche Schaumkrone. In der Nase habe ich Weizen, leichte Malznoten. Im Antrunk fast süßlich, dann wird es trocken, leicht bitter und ich schmecke Röstaromen, Bitterschokolade

Ciemne, prawie czarne, w refleksach rubinowe piwo o obfitej, gęstej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w postaci dość grubej warstwy na powierzchni. Aromat przyjemny, palony, kawowy. W smaku lekko wodniste, kawowe. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie bardzo pijalne piwo, dość dobre, choć mogło by być bardziej wyraziste.
No me gustaba mucho esta cerveza, pero tras probarla un par de veces me ha acabado gustando. La apariencia que tiene me encanta, con su espuma eterna. Todo un icono, la verdad. La recomiendo.

Ah, the famous Guinness Stout. Still a good beer after all these years. Dark brown color, famous nitrogen-widget. A beautiful beer with a lovely frothy beige head. Aroma is subtle. Coffee, baked bread, slight piss (in that good way). Very dry with notes of char, grass, and coffee.

Subtle caramel note. A bit of acidity from the roasted malt maybe. Looks fine brown black. Taste is subtle. You know tho.... It’s super watery and dry but not bad. Certainly nothing bad at all. Mouthfeel could be a little less acidic I think. But just a super easy drinking nothing special beer. Dare I say the original session beer? 

I can do this. Not enough flavor to want to drink it but sometimes I’m just craving a Guinness.

Draught in York. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head, mostly lasting and with great lacing. Aromas are malty, somewhat toasted, very smooth. The flavours include creamy unsweetened coffee, mild leather, woody - not too bitter, though. The palate is impressively creamy, especially due to the head, very slick and lasting. The finish is smooth and clear, on the short side.

An amazing one if your compare the looks with the low alcohol percentage.
No other beer will look better in the glass. Beautiful dark colour with the famous head. Roasted malt, coffee, slice of chocolate, soft bitters. It is all there in a modest way, which make it drinkable on a good session with the lads.
Wygląd: bardzo ciemne, czerwone refleksy. Piana idealna dzięki azotowi. Zapach: paloność, kawa. Smak: Lekkie nuty skórki od chleba i palonej kawy. Gładki. Ogólnie: Klasyk, konkretne piwo.

Pours a black from a nitro can. Tastes like a chocolate mango wrapped in burnt bacon. Aroma of grass pressed into mud lit on fire with a butane torch wielded by a professional wrestler. Who the hell cares what anyone describes it as, it’s fookin’ Guinness!

440ml can. Pours black, with a nice large light tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, roasted malts, coffee. Same for the taste. Smooth, with light roasted bitterness to finish.

2015-06-27

Aroma:


Malts, caramel and roasted malts.




Appearance:


Opaque ruby/black beer with a small/medium beige head.




Taste/Palate:


Slightly sweet with malts, caramel and roasted malts.
Schöne dunkle Farbe braunen cremiger Schaum, Geruch nicht so sehr intensiv, Geschmack röstig, Kaffee sehr dunkle Schokolade, ein leckerer Klassiker

*Speaking strictly of draught* What can I say? Probably slightly biased on this one (being Irish) but jesus, if you get a decent pint of this stuff it can turn any normal day into one of the best nights of your life. The Irish know that Guinness doesn’t travel well beyond the emerald isle. But you can still get a good pint in other countrys. It seems the further you go, the worst it gets. Perhaps this is because there isn’t as high demand in other countries for it (probably 2 - 6 being poured every hour in a normal-ish busy foreign "Irish" bar, whereas normal domestic bars it could be anywhere from 10 - 20+ per hour). A consistent flow makes for better beer that hasn’t been sitting in the lines for a long time. In Britain, they used to (still do in places) pour it straight into the glass (disregarding it’s settle time) and serve it directly to the customer which earned Britain (this, and other obvious things) a bad name for upon Irish people (never mind the IRA, don’t mess with our Guinness lads, and we’ll be grand). Anyway, with a good draught pour, Guinness can be an other world experience if done right. A nice price, in the right glass with a consistent pour and a head just brimming above the harp, you know straight away when the Guinness is good. After the first little tester sip, you determine the bitterness of the pint, the coldness and overall drinkability, and with this, if she passes, you slug away about a quarter of the pint in one go, leaving only a little thin white mustache above your lip and unquenchable desire for more. Beautiful is all I can say. It brings a tear to my eye. *Warning. I am Irish and possibly biast*
It’s Guinness, not much to say about it, always a good stout to have at any time.

Can, 50 cl. Black body with a very fine light beige head. Malty and slightly hoppy aroma. Dry taste with light bitterness and medium acidity. There are nearly no flavours from the dark malts. Light body with very soft carbonation. Dry and slightly bitter finish. This beer is really not for me. The combination of it being dry and sour, and almost flat, is unfortunate. I pretty much prefer the opposite of that, so I guess Guinness never really had a chance.

Not quite like the Guinness I know and loved from my trips to the UK.

Taste is very much like toasted caramel. Seems very flat on the palate, but there are definitely carbonation bubbles in the glass. Color is dark brown to black. Full bodied, thick. Pours thick with a 1/4 to 1/2 inch head.

 A great beer on tap, and probably a good beer if you’re just getting into stouts. Won’t be buying bottled Guinness again.
Guinness Draught ma niesamowitą pianę, utrzymuje się do samego końca picia. Kolor czarny. Aromat kawowy. Smak kawowy, mleczny.

I don't know what to say. It's not awful, but it's not great. I'll never drink it again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The "American Standard of Stouts" Guinness does not disappoint. The taste is symbolic of stouts from the UK though Imperial Russian have come to dominate the stout game. 10 years ago this would have been a 10.

Tap @ Flintstones thanks to the beautiful Nynne Uhre! Lol. Pours black with a medium offwhite head. Aromas of malt, sweet chocolate, dry. Taste is bitter, sweet, dark chocolate, malts, dry, light sweet licorice. No carbcarbonation, medium body.
This is one of my favorite beers. Nice aroma; smooth and creamy on the palate. Dark color with a thick head. Nice, malty taste; slightly bitter. Geat, classic beer.
Originally rated on 10/8/06. "One of my favorite beers, have been drinking it for years, always in my fridge, malty and smooth going down, fine aftertaste. Easy to drink.
Wygląda wspaniale, pachnie nawet nieźle, ale jest tak wodniste w smaku, że nie ma się czym zachwycać.

Can 50cl. (with nitrogen-widget). Deep dark brown nearly black color, good dense capuccino-colored head, mostly lasting (because of the nitrogen-widget I presume), good lacing; aroma sweet malts, roasted, bit tobacco, chocolate; taste medium sweet and bitter, milk chocolate, creamy; medium body, creamy to oily texture, at first lively, later soft carbonation, aftertaste slightly roasted and bittersweet, cardboard; classic.
A true Irish legend. You can never go wrong when you order a Guinness! Its in a class of its own

Poured exactly according to the video.

Pours a neato looking dark brown to black color. Creamy beige, long lasting head. Nice lacing.

Aroma is coffee and chocolate. Also of cream. But there’s also a small amount of medium roasted malt.

Taste is creamy and sweet. Low bitterness. Low alcohol. The chocolate and roasted malt are right at the end. But really only at the end. It tastes good, but not a lot of character.

Mouthfeel is great. Very creamy. Very smooth. Very drinkable. It’s watery. A light-bodied stout.

Overall, I like it a lot. It’s fun to drink. Has a great head and lacing start to finish. I could go into how it brings back memories, but I won’t. It’s good, but not great. Certainly worth a try!

Pours dark brown almost black with a medium sized brown head. Body is a little thin. Aroma is of roasted malts but not very strong. Taste is smooth, dry, and somewhat bland. I didn’t really like the flavor that much. Too simple without much lingering taste. I did get a slight taste of bacon grease near the end. Not sure if I imagined that or where that came from but it was distinctive. No harshness or bitterness, some of this is due to the lack of overall flavor. Not my favorite Stout.

Actually had this for the first time
-Big chocolate w some roasted coffee upfront
-slight notes of caramel
-incredible creamy head retension
-carbonation almost non-existent
-slightly chocoltaty,watery finish

always good seeing actual good macro beer out there.
11.5 oz. bottle. Pours dark black with lasting tan head. Aroma of coffee, roasted. Taste, coffee with slight bitterness.

This rate has been some time in the making. Consumed plenty of times is plenty of places in the past. This particular review is keg at The Swan, Bayswater. It pours darkest brown / near black with a thick, creamy beige head fir which its famed. The nose is always a challenge due to the denseness of the head..... sort of creamy, toasty, smooth roast, coffee grounds, light cocoa and liquorice. The taste is smooth bitterness, toasty, earthy roast, charred stuff, some acidity, coffee grounds, cocoa, pepper, light burnt notes, soil and sort of watery aspect with a short, dry finish. Medium body and moderate, velvety carbonation. The taste and aroma aren’t exactly game-changing. The body is pretty good considering. A safe option in a shit pub and a decent chaser for a whisky pretty much sums it up.
Bottle. Brown black appearance with brown head that quickly dissappear. Weak aroma. Light sweet taste with notes of coffee and a small bitter finish. No carbonation.

50cl van de tap bij John Mullins, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 4,1%
Uitgeschonken in origineel Guinness glas

Uiterlijk: zwart met stevige cremelaag 

Aroma en smaak: koffie, gebrande mouten

Conclusie: bekende draught, niet erg veel smaak voor een echt stout

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap in England pub in Ljubljana. Very nice and soft white head, pure dark appearance and a roasted, coffee like aroma. Medium bodied with a very mild hoppy aftertaste. An excellent autumn beer.

From tap at the pub in Blåvand. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Beautiful dark appearance, clear liquid. Long lasting soft well tasting foam - definitely a part of the experience of drinking a guinness. Sweet taste, not much bitterness. Well tasting and a light stout. Great beer!
From can. Black color with nice off white to beige creamy head. Roasted malty aroma, licorice and coffee. Light sweet and heavy bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Can, Dover. Pours black, with a good tan head. Aroma and taste is roasted malt, coffee, dark fruits. Creamy mouthfeel. Medium body. Soft carbonation.
Bittersweet finish

Bottle @ Publix Supermarket, Sarasota, FL - Have read some of the reviews on here and seems this is one of the best the Guinness brewery has put out. So i must have gotten a bad batch, because it was watery and bland. Tasted like they took a regular Guinness and poured half out and filled it with spring water and hoped no one would notice. Only drank one bottle but it was so bad i took it back and demanded my money. Hopefully, next time i’ll have a better experience and can re-write this review.
Ciemne, lekkie, smaczne piwko. Niczego nie urywa ale też niczym specjalnie nie zniechęca.
----- I’ve tried it before joining to the RateBeer. ----- Date of tasting: 26.02.15
The Best Stout of the world in my opinion. Good appearance. Fantastic color. Fantastic aroma. Good merchandising. Specially on draught version at pub’s.

Ejemplo de cerveza Stout comercial que cumple con los mínimos de sabor, y apariencia. Buen aroma a dulce y tostado con  espuma persistente. El comportamiento en paladar es agradable ya que tiene un cuerpo medio y carbonacion suave. El sabor es algo amargo a malta tostada y algún toque de café. Postgusto algo amargo y seco.Un clásico que ha sido engullido por la industria.

Black as the night with a creamy tan head. Coffee and mild roasted aroma and flavor. Medium (light) body and a soft carbonation. Mellow sweetness. Can or draught....well I do not know. Probably draught, because then I am at a pub.
[Can and on tap a lot of places]

Dawno Guinnessa nie piłem a dodatkowo chciałem się przekonać, jak to jest z tym widżetem umieszczonym w puszce. Mała kulka ma być wypełniona azotem i po otwarciu puszki uwalniać tenże gaz do piwa. Dzięki temu piana powinna być kremowa i puszysta. I tak rzeczywiście się stało. Czarne piwo pokryło się beżową, z niemal niewidocznymi pęcherzykami, pianą. Bardzo fajny efekt był widoczny podczas nalewania - najpierw szła piana, która widowiskowo zmieniała się w piwo. Wyczuwalna paloność, gorzka czekolada, kawa. W smaku wytrawne, jest czekolada i lekka paloność. W tle kawa i lekki metal. W sumie, choć komercyjne, to jest całkiem smaczne, przyzwoite piwo!
Bubblegum, citrus, herbs, rotten eggs, cooked vegetables, toast, citrus, basement aromas, butterscotch

500cc can and on tap at Guinness. Pours black with beige creamy head. Lots of coffee, malt, a bit bready and smoked bacon in the nose as well in the mouth. Lovely head creamyness but the beer is just too flat for my taste ( used to belgian beer). A very pleasant beer always. I have had it many times and in very different places and situations and it is really consistent. Always the same
Bottle. Black, rocky head, tan foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, & abrupt finish.
Barwa czarna nieprzejrzysta. Piana zbita jak smietana, bardzo drobna. W aromacie palonosc, kawa, slodowosc. W smaku kwaskowe, palonosc i kawa, piwo gladki. Goryczka niska

On tap just about anywhere. Had to finally rate it. Deep reddish brown with the famous everlasting tan head that laces all the way down. The Nitrogen leaves a muted nose of roasted malts,, nuts, coffee, dark chocolate and vanilla. Light sweet molasses under a medium bitter coffee and chocolate. Mouth is medium and cream with very soft carbonation. Reliable and easy to find worldwide.
Nitrogen makes brilliant head despite flat carbonation. Aroma is roasted same as taste. Too light body, oily texture.

Aromat: Bardzo słaby lekka kawa , paloność , czekolada gorzka.
Wygląd: Czarne z rubionowymi przebłyskami , no i piękna piana utrzymująca się do końca , oczywiście duży wpływ ma na to azot.
Odczucie w ustach: Kwaskowe , bardzo lekka paloność , goryczka znikoma, trochę wodniste w smaku.
Odczucie w ustach: Lekkie , ale też i fajnie gładkie, nisko wysycone .
Ogólnie: Lekkie , trochę może wodniste piwo, ale dobrze gasi pragnienie, .

Aromat: delikatna kawa i paloność.
Wygląd: barwa czarna nieprzejrzysta, piana niesamowita, beżowa, trwała, ubita.
Smak: kawowo-palone, nisko-średnia goryczka.
Odczucie w ustach: mała ciałą, bardzo gładkie
Ogólne wrażenie: poprawne piwo, jednak aromat i smak zbyt delikatne. Ogromny plus za świetny wygląd i potężną pianę.

Piana beżowa, bardzo drobno pęcherzykowa, zostawia piekną koronkę na szkle, kolor czarny, aromaty paloności , skórki od chleba, kawa, z tyłu lekko czuć gorzką czekoladę, smak lekko słodki na początku do wytrawnego, nasycenie słabe, alkohol niewyczuwalny, bardzo pijalne, przyzwoity stout

W ogóle nie wiem jak podejść do tego piwa. Niby duch craftu i nie wypada, ale w sumie to jest ponadczasowa klasyka. Z puszki, nagazowywana azotem dodatkowo zyskuje, a przede wszystkim przepięknie wygląda. Kremowa, gruba piana, absolutnie drobnopęcherzykowa, delikatny aromat kawy i czekolady, w tle paloność. W smaku delikatne, lekko kawowe, z czekoladowym muśnięciem i niskogoryczkowym finiszem. Dobre piwo, nie ma co narzekać, że komercja.
What can be said about this that hasn’t already been said. One of my favorite all around stouts. Not nearly as strong and heavy as the newer craft stouts, but still one of the best.
Czarne piwo z czapą beżowej, gęstej piany. Aromat zdominowany przez nuty palone, przebija się też kawa. Smak lekko palony, wyczuwalna czekolada. Piwo lekko wodniste, ale dzięki temu bardzo pijalne.
Pleasant roasted aroma. Great creamy and extremely durable head. Clear almost black body. Smooth and pleasant roasted bitterness in taste. A little bit watery but still very good.

Dobre piwo. Na początku czuć dużo kwaskowości, a później zostaje mocno, gorzkoawy posmak kawowy. Piana świetna, bardzo gęsta od tego widgeta. nie rewelacyjny, ale dobry dry stout. Za mało alkoholu. Zbyt wytrawne dla mnie(kwaskowe).

FTA. While talking to an Irish guy I found out that I have not ticked this yet. Best one I had was in Southern England. Worst one probably in a pub in Moscow airport. Can is not to my taste. Just a reminder.
Sjecam se da sam par puta pio ovo pivo iz limenke i da u limenci ima kuglica ..dosta dobro pivo ..suho ..odlicne boje ...okus pun ..sve u svemu dobro pivo
A good beer with a strong aroma at the back of the throat. Moreover this THE beer in Ireland and its got a very rich history that helps it taste god in your mouth

On tap. Pours black, with a short light brown head. Aroma of dark malt and dark roasted coffee. Mouth feel is rich, full, creamy and foamy. Body is thin. Tastes slightly sweet, then somewhat bitter, slightly burnt. Flavors of bitter espresso, dark malt, burnt flavors. I’m not a Guinness lover...

6 July 2015: 10 oz Draft. It poured dark black with a beige head. The aroma was toasted malt with a dry taste with maybe a hit of chocolate. I had better Guinness elsewhere but not in a long time.

10 March 2019: can. Black color pour with a lasting creamy head.  Roasted malt with a note of chocolate. Creamy on the tongue. Mildly sweet. Very drinkable.
