On tap, dense black body with light tan, sticky head. Earthy, chocolatey aroma, some metallic undertones were noticeable. Smooth taste of roasted malts. Slight sweetness at the end with a mild bitter finish. Creamy, velvet feel.
Not my favorite style of beer. It is pretty dull actually.Widespread because there’s a Irish Pub in every godforsaken place around the world.

LET ME TELL YOU GUINESS IS COARPORATE CHINA FACTORY BEER SINCE THEY’RE SOLD OUT. (NO)OBAMA WILL BE SO PROUD OF GUINESS. AND THEY’RE OTHRT BAD THINGS ITS SO HEAVY AND BLACK. ITS FINE DRINK STOUT OR PORTER BUTT WHY IS IN TALLBOYS?? FLAYVER IS CHEAP FACTORY BEERS CHINA . GUINESS USE TO BE SOOOO GOOD BEFORE NOW ITS NOT GOOD.

440ml can. Aroma is sweet. Pours dark like Coke, minimal head. Taste is soft, woody, slightly coffeeish, sweet aftertaste. Body is quite thin. Overall a classic stout that you could always count on and get from anywhere around the world.
Still an excellent classic dry stout. Creamy as nothing else, black with his spectacular head.

Cerveja ícone,merece toda fama que tem,aparência bem escura,espuma bege abundante e persistente,líquido cremoso,,aroma suave de malte e torrefação,no sabor notas de café,tofee,chocolate amargo,lúpulo presente contrabalanceando bem com o dulçor do malte torrado,final seco ,bem refrescante para o estilo,bom conjunto.Recomendo.

A black beer with a beutiful brown creamy head. The aroma is slight - too slight - but with notes of sweetness and roasted malt. The flavor is creamy smooth with a sweet malty start and ending on a slight roasted note, that lingers a little and turns dry. Not a good stout - too thin

On tap at Heart & Crown - Byward Market. Black pour, red hues and a creamy off-white head. Flavors are roasted malts, coffee and dark chocolate with a light acidity. Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth texture.

440ml widget can. Pours a deep ruby/black with a one finger, creamy head that lasts forever and coats the glass. Aroma has notes of caramel, slight roast, and a touch of traditional hops. Taste is balanced but a touch tart with caramel, very slight roast, and not a lot else. Medium body with a low carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a slightly dry finish. Overall pretty basic. Hints of bread, caramel, roast, and hops.

Espuma linda e consistente.
Gosto torrado com aroma de café. 
Não é do meu paladar mas vale a pena tomar uma durante a noite para intercalar sabores

Moje najlepsze koncernowe piwo na świecie(pomijając belgijskie), jak wchodzę do sklepu i nie ma kraftu biorę Guinnessa. Nie będę opisywał bo prawie każdy zna ten smak, wszystko co powinno mieć w stylu ma,oczywiście idealne nie jest, zawsze można powybrzydzać. Poza tym to mój ulubiony styl, ciężko zliczyć ile warek już smakowałem a mimo to nigdy się nie zawiodłem, z wadą się nie spotkałem. Można brać w ciemno.
Draught. Looks stunning when poured correct. Nice roast and a great mouthfeel. Very easy drinker despite the body of the beer. Medium dry finish. A staple beer.

Black, ruby light reflexes, tanned creame head (nitro). Aroma: pretty pour as for stout- coffe, some cocoa, caramel, but really not intense. Taste: light sour, some coffe and cocoa flavours. Palate: medium body, nitro makes it really smooth, altough lack of flavours makes it empty. Overall: sessionable, smooth, nice nitro usage. Altough lacks aromas and flavours. Pretty empty comparing to other stouts.
Not amazing, but there is a reason Guinness has been around for so long. Good choice if your looking for something on the cheaper side that doesn’t taste awful.

Mecanismo para simular la presión de cerveza de barril (nitrógeno). El aspecto es magnífico, con el característico color negor opaco y esa espuma parda de textura única por lo cremoso. Aroma tostado con notas de café. Cuerpo ligero, pero estupenda textura, que la hace muy agradable en boca. Amargor característico y recuerdos a chocolate y café. Mejor que en bastantes pubs (todavía lejos de en los que la tiran bien de verdad) Y su baja graduación hace que pueda caer una tras otra..
Can, mild carbonation, mild flavour, dark caramel malt notes. Standard Guinness taste.
Birra in lattina particolare, perchè riesce a ricreare l’effetto di una birra alla spina. Non è come berla a dublino, ma sicuramente meglio di come la trovi nella maggior parte dei pub in italia.

Lattina . Dal colore nocciola, che varia dal beige a un nero inesplicabile. Schiuma molto presente e cremosa: ne ha molta, ma una bassa carbonatazione rispetto a quella che ti spetteresti. Amaro percettibile. Intensità olfattiva di malto tostato e orzo. Corpo pastoso. Gusto dalla poca amarezza, cioccolato bruciato, cacao, caffè, vaniglia, liquirizia e caramello. La Guinness Draught è la prima a mettere all’interno della lattina una pallina grande come quelle del calcetto, grazie alla quale "ritrovate a casa vostra tutto il gusto della birra alla spina del pub grazie al sistema di pressione integrata che si presenta sotto forma di una biglia pressurizzata galleggiante".

Chocolatey molasses aromas come from this clear deep brown brew whith a finger of creamy brown tiny bubbles. Te taste is smooth chocolate and a full body. The aftertaste is molasses I believe. A nice enjoyable brew.
just better out of tap in Ireland it this Guinness do i have say any more would nice aroma would world class appearance and that over all palate ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Tap. Black, rocky head, tan foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, & abrupt finish.

Can 44cl ,4.2%. Deep brownish-red with nice big creamy beige head. Mild aroma of carob with notes of coffee and butterscotch. Flavor of roasted malt, creamy, some herbs and carob, light bitterness, quite watery. Soft carbonation, light to medium-bodied.

Pours dark brown turning into deep black after head is stabilized. Everlasting thick creamy beige head. Light aroma of toasted malts. Taste is bitter with light sweetness, bread and toasted malts. Light body, very easy drinking! Awesome session stout.

Aroma of malts and barley,
 Fairly mild, similar taste, dry and mild, almost a lightstout
From a can. Pours black. Aroma and taste are light roasted malts and very creamy.

This is a re-rate.  I poured it from the bottle into a mug. It pours a dark brown to almost black color with a tan head and lacing.  A Guiness pour is a beautiful thing.  The aroma is roasted coffee and smokey malt.  The taste is roasty and dry. It is malty, bitter, and has hints of chocolate. The mouth feel is very smooth and creamy. It holds its own against other more expensive stouts.

On tap at Pub Galway. Pours a dark brown with a thick creamy beige head that leaves nice and foamy lacing. Nose is of light roasted grains and char. Taste is lightly acidic and dry indeed with flavors of roasted grains but again really light. Body is light, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel watery. Overall I know this is a dry stout but I found it to be lacking a little body and taste to be considered really good.
Strom tap: deep dark, brown foam, frothy, smell and taste of burnt bread. Watery, creamy, bitter, would not drink this over hyped Irish brew again unless it is for at Patrick’s day

Can. Black with a slight reddish tinge. The soft and creamy head forms slowly as the nitrogen rises. Nose is oatmeal and raw grains. Very creamy light body. Some coffee and toffee, minus the sweetness. Earthy and dry. Nothing else like it. Finishes soft with a lingering roasty bitterness.
Ein Bild von einem Bier, ein Schaum wie Cappuccino. In der Nase Kaffee, im Trunk leider verwässerte Aromen, matt im Abgang. Wenig Nachgeschmack - hatte ich besser in Erinnerung.
İts like fumed water it has no bitter or sour taste . Little fruity but very little.

This is the bottle version. Please note that the pour/tap version is quite a bit better, around a 3.5 or something.

Dark black beer with a brown head. Slight aroma of chocolate malt. Creamy and dry in the back with a bit of alcohol. Finish of light alcohol as well as chocolate. Not nearly as balanced as the aroma.

Much larger head when draft with better flavor. I’ll rate in between the 3.1 for the bottle and 3.7 for the draft.
Can; Appearance: deep dark, small head; Aroma: dark chocolate, roasted coffee, caramel; Taste: sour, bitter; Palate: watery, zero carbonation; Overall: to impress yes, to drink regarly no;
Classic beer. Very dark with tan head and smooth finish. This is wonderful and worth every drop.
Cerveja fantastica! Uma das minhas favoritas! Uma boa referência no estilo e sua cascata de espuma é linda.

14.2 oz. nitro can to shaker glass. It has that signature rolling nitro release tan head, deep reddish brown in color, very nice lacing and awesome head retention. Aroma of smoked malts. Taste is generally sweet, with just a touch of earthy English hop bitterness. Light bodied, light carbonation, creamy mouth feel though a little watery. Finishes rather dry. Tasting notes of coffee, burnt wood, tree nuts, toffee and chocolate. A classic yet too tame for my tastes.
Poured from tap. Aroma - roasted dark malt, nutty, but fairly subdued. Taste - light coffee, lightly burned toast, subtle caramel and roasted nuts. What can you say? This is a classic.

Pint at The Handyman Irish pub, Madrid, on St Patrick’s Day 2017.
Pours pitch black with some reddish glints. Thick, dense, almost non-lacing tan head.
Aroma is smoke, bacon, dark coffee, liquorice.
Mouthfeel is soft, lo-carb, somewhat watery. Taste is crisp and bitterish. Slightly long-lingering finish, with reminiscences of walnut, coffee beans and liquorice.

Tastes horrible. Too.much dry. Avg 1.

Sabor horrible. Superseca. No me la volveria a tomar ni aunque me pagaran por ello.... Avg  0.5

11 March 2017. Can from Carrefour. In Ikea's pint glass. After dinner. Creamy water, with slight roasted notes. At  least it isnt the unfinishable burnt and dry mess I remember, or maybe my palate has chaged. One of the worst feels i remember. Nasty colour, like dirty water, brownish. Avg 1.98

13 Jan 2017. Can. In Ikea's pint glass. At lunch, after futsal match (win by 1), with russian salad + nuggets. Im getting used to it. Yes, its flat, bland, light, watery and artificially smooth; but it no longer disgusts me like in the past. Avg 2.7

16 March 2018. Can. From Hipercor. In Ikea's pint glass. Playing Game of Thrones. Enjoyed it more than previous times. Still watery and artificially smooth feeling, but this time i could appreciate some nice roasty notes

23 Marzo 2019. Lata. De Hipercor. En vaso de pinta de Ikea. Tras partido de futbito. En almuerzo, con bacalao dorado + chocos fritos. Habia que sacarse la chapa de untappd. Cada vez me gusta mas, encontrandole notas tostadas algo cafetosas agradables, y me acostumbro mas a su suavidad. La espuma dura eterna

Can@home. Black no head. Very low carbonation. Roasted chocolate notes. Sweet gentle mouthfeel. Not my beer in long run. I bit onedimensional. 1/8-15. Guiness draught can @freedom of the SEAS. Black one finger dense beige foam. Roasted coffe toasted flavours. Smooth. Low carbonation. Fine dry. 3.6
Dohány, kávé, füst, kátrány, korom, feketeribizli, citrom. Utóíz: ínyen, szájpadláson tartós, savas-kesernyés. Enyhe stout, de a legjobb "kommersz" eddig.

Chocolate, coffee and note of caramel in aroma. Deep black color with ruby reflection - something like in coke. Smooth, velvety, creamy foam with nice lacing - thanks to nitrogen. Low carbonation. Dry, maybe even a little watery. Coffee and chocolate in taste. Little sour. Aftertaste is pretty same but has nice bitterness - not too high, but its enough for this beer. Very easy drinkable and well made stout.
Had on Draft at the Guinness Store House in Dublin. Guinness has laways been a favorite of mine, but the fresshness of the one I had there took it up another notch. Just an amazing beer.

Poured from a 330 ml bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has sweet malt aroma
Appearance- Pours black with a thick beige head
Taste- Has a rich malty flavor, very enjoyable.
Palate- A medium to heavy bodied beer with very little carbonation. Has a thick texture.
Overall- A good beer, recommended for everyone.
Still a good stout. But can taste very bland compared to some of the new craft beers.
Looks great when poured but that’s about the only good points it has. Aroma is faintly roasty, flavour is bland and the finish is very watery. Not what a stout should be at all.
Cerveja muito bonita. Escura com espuma branca. Aroma de grãos torrados e café. Muito leve, até demais, parece um pouco aguada. Bom retrogosto e alto drinkabilty
Não curti muito. Tem uma aparência boa, espuma cremosa pouco persistente e nada encorpada. Dá pra sentir o malte tostado o amargor do lúpulo, mas dá impressão de aguada. Gosto de cerveja encorpada

Okay, the only reason this doesn’t score higher is that I find it the least Amazing of it, Original and the best, none are my favourite drink but are still the best all around, here goes.

The Draught version of Guinness Boasts a powerful, deep complexity of Roasted Barley, Heaps of malt, Target hops, and traces of Nugget, along with it’s rich mighty yeasty beastly liquorice.

It pours...it pours magic, the blackest beer Stouts and Blackest of it’s family, dense, formidable, brave hidden ruby beauty, with a strong, defining world class head.

On the palate is very heavy, creamy, velvety with minimal carbonation, and in it’s taste is near perfection, staple Guinness harsh and dominating malts and barley, roasted coffee, background’s of vanilla pod, liquorice, turmeric and Galena hop’s along with side hint’s of nugget and and a little target.

It gives the impression of eating a meal, a Sunday roast in liquid form, with a powerful burnt chocolate and aniseed finish, very bitter, long and merciless rattling of your mouth, simply exceptional!
One of my favourite beers of all time. It’s hard to explain why, but maybe everyone has that with a particular beer.

After all these years, it still has one of the prettiest pours. It’s black w/ a retaining & thick tan head that leaves lacing. The aroma is rather subtle w/ a little bit of dark malt poking through. The taste is relatively plain & dull but the mouthfeel really makes up for it! It’s very light & creamy on the palate making it highly drinkable! Pretty darn good for being 1 of the world’s most popular!
One of the best in my opinion. If the bar has it I must drink it at least a pint or more

Tap/can: pours black colour with creamy light brown head. Aroma: roasted grain, slightly burnt, with chocolaty notes..., similar is the flavour: roasted slightly burnt chocolate/coffe-like grain, with moderate hop bitterness. Body is light to moderate, texture is smooth, creamy, carbonation is moderate to low.

Pours black from a bottle with a tan head. Aromas of coffee, smoke, vanilla and bread. Flavors of the same. Palate is medium. Overall nice as always.  This is the standard bearer. The one all other dark beers are compared to. You say it’s either better than Guinness as good as Guinness or not is good is Guinness. That’s just the way it is. May not be the best but us very good.
Burk systembolaget. Svart kulör med beiget krämigt skum. Lätt rostad doft med kaffe och lite rökt korv. Maltig smak med lakrits och kavring. Aningen vattnig munkänsla. Svagt kolsyrad och lätt beska

Colore nero impenetrabile, schiuma densa e molto persistente color nocciola.
Forte aroma di liquirizia, deboli note di caffè e cacao.
Corpo pieno, poco carbonata.
Al palato prevale sempre la liquirizia, in un secondo momento si percepisce caffè tostato e cacao, con una nota amaricante sul finale; a tratti lievemente "piccante".
Hard not to love a good ol’ Guinness. There’s a ton of great stouts out there, but its easy to go back to this when I’m at a pub that doesn’t have a wide selection. You can’t go wrong!

Copenhagen 6/4 2015. 44 cl can from Føtex. The black can with the golden harp. Dramatic Sound effect when opening. Pours muddy brown which separates into black beer with dense creamy white head. Aroma is rather weak. A little salty - not much else. Very soft and silky carbonation. Taste is malty with a nice but not very distinct bitterness. Like lukewarm coffee (in a nice way). Fine Irish draught - in a can.
Un incontournable du genre, noire, sombre, une belle mousse blanche compact, un gout de noisette et de céréales. Délicieux.

Aroma of bread, roasty malt, coffee and cereal. Pours dense dark liquid with a rather small dark white head. The flavour spreads very nicely in the mouth and is mainly coffee with a medium bitterness and some malt. Mouthfeel is rather full with an oily texture and a bitter finish. The coffee taste is surprisingly appealing and I’ve never had a beer that tasted anything like this. Very unique and nice.
Origin: Tap. Vessel: Pint Glass. Supplier: Guinness Storehouse (Dublin). Roasted barley with coffee hints, finishing with hoppy bitterness.
04-04-2015 - This is a can with a nice gimmick, but the beer is a good as a real Guinness in Ireland!
can poured into a pint glass..dark brown with a thick tan head..aroma of roasted malts,coffee..dry,malty...that’s about it.
Just love me my Guinness! Beautifull color, aroma and a unique great taste.

From the can the color is dark black with a thick off white head, the aroma is malts and wheat, taste is smooth creamy roasted malts, mouthfeel is thick and full, great beer with an almost milkshake quality from the can, overall a solid choice.

Draft at Fox and Hound. Poured an translucent dark brown almost black with a mammoth tan head and beautiful lacing. Taste or slight coffee, mild roasted malts and water. Creamy body, medium carbontion
Nice thick head. And that’s about it. Mouldy smell, burnt taste, sour in the end. Expected more considering price (20kn/2,6€ for 44cl can).

Nice dark beer. Black and beautifull. Beautiful creamy foam head. The beer is deeply bitter, touches the back of your tongue. Nice sweet souerness to compensate it. A touch of caramel in the distance. Little burnt hint, but that isn’t annoying. Nice.

44cl can from Kiwi mini market. Pours black with a creamy beige head. OK canned version of the original draught. Have tasted this on tap in Dublin - way better. This is flat coffee tasting substitute. But stll good..
Thin, watery, dry, overrated. Nice creamy head though - looks very good but the taste just isn’t worth it.
Great everyday stout, but after trying some others, mire complex and tasty this seemed to me low profile
Minha dry stout preferida. É sempre uma festa quando encontro vendendo no mercado perto de casa.

Sicuramente non c’è birra spillata in modo migliore. L’azoto che le da questa schiuma compatta e pannosa la rende visivamente la birra più bella e desiderata al mondo. L’aroma è tostato e di cioccolato. In bocca parte un po’ aquosa ma poi si apre rivelando un giusto bilanciamento ed un lungo finale. Di sicuro un prodotto industriale, niente di fuori dagli schemi o di sconvolgente ma una birra veramente piacevole.

I’ll admit that at times I am a sucker for a good deal on a twelve pack at the grocery store. Who can pass up a box of this for eleven ninety nine? I couldn’t. Unfortunately, straight from the bottle, this product falls well short of the magic that is a fresh keg of dark Irish love.

Coffee roast with notes of chocolate in the aroma. Appearance is a very dark brown, almost black with a large creamy off tan head with good lacing. Moderate roast character with notes of chocolate in the flavor with a moderate acidic note on the end. Finishes dry. Creamy medium high body with low carbonation. Slightly astringent from the roasted barley. Overall, it's the classic dry stout. Great session beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33cl can @ home. Very watery beer. Hope it’s just this can. I has not that much taste.
Bland watery bitterness charachterises this all time classic. Supprisingly high rating!
Everything said about guinness. On tap better for sure. Black, creamy head, soft body, good taste. Great if you are in a bar watching a soccer game.

14.9 ounce nitro can. Barely translucent deep brown color. Small creamy light tan head. Mild nutty roasted malt nose. Subtle, smooth earthy roasted malt flavor. Slightly lactic character with tangy notes. Hints of worcestershire and toasted bread. This is the first stout I ever tasted some 35 years ago. It was fuller and richer tasting back then, at least in my recollection. Still, this is the benchmark of dry stouts. And it always tastes a little better on St. Patrick’s Day. Wonderful stuff this Guinness.
Classic Guinness. Looks great. Mild dry Irish stout flavor, roasty, creamy, a bit bitter on the finish. A classic.

Poured can to pint glass. Light roasty aroma. Beautiful appearance. Jet black color with big creamy off white head that sticks around awhile. Heavy lacing. Taste is on the lighter side for a stout. Light bitterness but smooth. Light to medium bodied with a creamy texture. Soft carbonation. Long sweetish finish.

Basically tastes like a watered down stout but overall good beer. Not really the most flavorful stout but the texture and overall experience is great. Typically a St. Patrick’s day tradition for me.

Can into pint glass. Pours a jet black colour with a nice thick white head. Aroma is roasty. Taste is roasted malt a light pleasing bitterness. Fantastic beer.-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Beautiful dark body, with nice creamy head. Tastes of light coffee, dark chocolate and hints of caramel. Light and creamy body, extremely smooth  carbonation and a great finish of creamy chocolate. Good when poured from can, absolutely great from draught in Dublin

En overall god øl til pengene og så er den irsk. 
Go øl på den 17 marts 
Hugos vinkælder
What can you say about this beer. We all know what it is and it is perfect in everyway. That is all that needs to be said

Beautiful stuff.  Creamy and delicious almost dessert like.  The one of kind beer to be cherished.  Designed for leisurely sessions with friends and family. Will put you in a great mood without getting you sloshed.

On tap on St. Paddy’s day in Oz. Rating #100 on my world trip. Pours black with a slowly developing sticky foam where you can paint in. Slightly roasty aroma, but can’t tell which direction. Taste of bread, minimal coffee notes, but hinting at more aromas... Mostly water and bitterness, also in the palate.

Can.
Black, small creamy head. Well balanced. Smooth to drink, always a good choice for me.

Draught at woodshed bar in Helsinki. Light aroma, bit of roast but not so much. Almost pitch black with brown hue. Beautiful coffee cream head with perfect retention. Lacks a bit of bubbles. Co2 pression a bit lighter than it should be... Very close to flat. Super easy to drink with smooth roasting and a little pleasant very light sourness. Great session roast beer!

barwa piwa czarna,nieprzejrzysta,piana jasno brazowa,delikatna,utrzymuje sie do samego konca,nasycenie prawie zerowe,w smaku slod palony i kawowosc,piwo jakby rozwodnione,poprawne ale sa lepsi przedstawiciele gatunku

Had this on tap at the old Tadg's in 2013 for St-Patty's Day. Deep only black with a thick dense creamy head. A fantastic creamy mouthfeel and smooth flavor make it much better than the sad sack bottle version.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gosto mas só dá para beber com amigos, sem acompanhamento, não dá para acompanhar refeições. Tipica cerveja britanica, só para beber no pub.
9.4.2014. Nose: raisin, syrupy malts. Palate: low carbonates, in a way watery. Taste: very malty, a bit sweet, tasty despite somehow watery feeling. Dryish finish.

330 ml bottle. (4.2% ABV) Pours a dark brown with a small, creamy, tan head. Mildly sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate and a hint of coffee. Sweet, smooth flavour of roasted malt and dark chocolate with a slightly dry, bitter coffee finish. Light body with a watery texture and flat carbonation.

Barwa czarna, piana jasno bezowa, gesta, trwala, ladny lacing. Aromat slaby, palony, nuty kawy w tle. W smaku bardzo delikatnie palone, bardzo lekkie nawet troche wodniste. Posmak palono slodki. Piwo bardzo delikatne, gladkie, dobrze pijalne.
Cloudy thick appearence with fat head. Roasted malts and very dry. A classic on tap.
On tap. Beautiful dark chocolate color. Creamy palate smooth semi sweet caramel toasted malt. A classic. One of the best mainstream beers around.

3/3 (Draft Chicago Houlihans) - Dark pour with minimal texture or aroma. Very smooth pour, light taste and abv. Was a regular consumer as a teen, young adult, but moved on to stronger beers with a better taste.
I like! Klassisk lækker boblende smuk stout - altid et sikkert hit i min bog! Sådan - bum...

Pours a deep, chocolate brown with a large, creamy tan head with good lacing. Aroma is mild of roasted malt. Taste is medium sweet, a pinch bitter. Mouthfeel is great: soft and creamy, full bodied, with a lightly bitter finish. Overall, I enjoy Guinness as an everday beer: easy to drink and pleasant. It is not spectacular but a personal favorite (which feels so contradictory).

Keg served extra cold at The Green Dragon, Leek (JDW) A black colour with a ruby tint and a thick creamy white head. Aroma of roasted malt, slight coffee, burnt toast and a little bit metallic. Taste of slight roasted malt, toast and a little cocoa. Smooth and creamy texture and light bodied. Soft chocolatey bitterness in the finish. Super smooth and easy drinking because it’s watery and light. 10 times better in Ireland but it’s still Guinness at the end of the day.

Can from Family Mart. Poured into an English tulip pint. Pitchblack color with a nice tan head. Slight aroma of toasted malt and toffee present. Tastes of roasted malt, toffee with a hint of woodiness...a little bit of hops noticeable as well. Nice smooth, dry finish. Solid enough.
Great stout, everyone should try this. Black pour with a perfect medium head. Aroma and taste of roasted malts, barley, and little hops.

Bewertung importiert von bier index: 
10	/	8	/	8	/	7	/	3	/	4	/	6	/	8	/	80

440 ml can, clear dark brown - almost black with strong creamy latte color head. first taste are roast malt with some kind caramel. taste are roast malt with medium bitter and hidden oak taste with a bit toffee notes. aftertaste are fine roast malt with medium bitterness and pleasant dry finish. easy drinkable, not too wattery or over carboned.
Poured from the bottle. Pleasant smell, very nice appearance. The head looks nice and feels great in the mouth. But taste is pretty bad. Would never drink again.

Barwa: ciemno brunatna, klarowna.
Piana: zwarta, kremowa,bardzo trwała.
Zapach: słodowy z nutami ciemnymi, trochę kawy, kakao.
Smak: piwo jest wytrawne i smukłe, czuć delikatną palonośč. 
Wysycenie: niskie.
La auténtica y genuina Guinness, suave y fácil de beber, de baja graduación alcohólica, aromas tostados, espuma cremosa, a disfrutar!!
Es la primera que debería probar un bebedor que empiece a introducirse en las importadas. Esta todo dicho de ella, no voy a aportar nada nuevo.
A melhor! Uma Guinness Draught. 440ml, 4.2% Alc e aparência espetacular! Sabor inconfundível! Brewed In Dublin, claro!

33cl bottle
Appearance: A Good light brown small soft pillow creamy head on top of a black body, with ok retentiont, the big ring of lacing is nice.
Aroma: Coffee, roasted malts, nuts, caramel
Taste: Moderate sweet, a hint of sourness, which makes it light sour. Taste folllows the Aroma. While nice allthough it’s a bit watery.chocolate aftertaste
thin body, soft carbonation,creamy foam wih a more oily texture.

Compared to the non nitro version the softer carbonation does work better. Now the body slightly to thin to make it really good. But still this is better as the Extra Stout version, but not as good as from the draft.
Aroma: coffee, caramel, toast, Appearance:black, rocky head, tan foam, Taste: lightly bitter, medium sourness, Palate: light body, thin feel, flat,

50cl can@home. Pours black with the creamy head building slowly in that inimitable Guinness way. Makes it one of the best looking beers I can think of. Subdued aroma - not much of it frankly. Taste smooth of roasted malt but also slightly metallic. The latter thankfully disappears in the aftertaste. Somewhat watery palate. To me, Guinness is a beer of its own and best on tap in Ireland. It may be just snobbery, but so be it. As for this canned version, the jury is still out. I accept it for what it is, but I am more of a hop man I suppose.

440ml can straight from fridge (it says serve extra cold!). Fine long lasting off white head. Roast malt aroma and flavour which is also slightly metallic. Mouth feel is smooth, flat and a bit watery.
Czasrne piwo z betonową pianą, która pokrywa tafle napitku do samego dna szklanki. Aromaty palonego słodu i kawy, klasyczne.

Aromat słodowy, karmelowy, orzechowy, żelazo. Piwo ciemno brunatne, nieprzejrzyste, piana solidna - wiadomo azot. W smaku atakuje paloność, kawowość, także wyczuwalna metaliczność, goryczka średnio niska. Piwo wodniste, bardzo pijalne, aksamitne, nisko wysycone, metaliczny posmak psuje zabawę. Ogólnie niezłe pijalne piwo, ale bez szału, taki już styl. Metaliczność trochę odpycha.

Can from Sainsbury’s.

Pours...well watch the volcano effect! Black as the night, beautiful creamy 1-2 finger head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate. On the taste it’s roasted malts, smokiness, peaty smokiness, coffee, chocolate and all so smooth! Beautiful!

This was amazing when I had it in England a few times on tap. It was the first time I saw how the poured it in two separate goings which really adjusted the flavor and head of the stout. It had a nice white fluffy head with a bold dark body. It’s flavor is so full and rewarding - It was literally like having candy off the tap.

When having it back in the states, there’s no comparison on tap, especially from a can or bottle. It still brings back memories of on tap in England though exploring Dorset and London :)

@ Röhällavägen 150216. Nitro can (440 ml) from Systembolaget. Roasted malty with notes of coffee and chocolate, sweet, full body with a creamy texture. The finish is dry, bitter and roasted. Quite thin in flavour.

My go to choice of draught drink when the choice is poor available pretty much anywhere you no where you stand with Guinness not exciting but predictable nice long lasting head which will stay the course of f its kept right OK tasting but can feel a little thin OK but so much better choice out there if you put in the effort to find it.

Nitrogen keg. Pours black, base is slightly translucent to reveal red hue. Foam from the keg is perfect every time. Scent and taste are particularly mild but finish is like water. Very easy drinking. Unpasteurized keg in Ireland has a fuller, more malty flavor.

Second rating: Pint, pours dark brown with a light Ruby hue and a thick medium tan white head of cream subsiding slowly. Scent is light lager yeast. Taste is dense cream and light toasted malt. Nice sweetness of maybe orange peel but light on the flavor. Finish is very good and a tiny bit grainy. Great.
Olfato bem leve, quase imperceptível. Espuma espessa e em quantidade. Paladar chocolate, e café intensos. Aftertaste aguado.
Burk från SB. Svart färg med smutsbrun skumkrona. Lätt doft av rök, medwurst och svart malt. Rund lätt krämig kropp. Söt och torr. Smak av kavring, grädde, nutella och lätt rök.
Uma stout clássica, 4,2% de ABV, sabor suave e levemente amargo. Os grãos torrados lembram café.

Drank huge quantities of this during a trip in Ireland. You just can’t go wrong with this classic, especially if served in a traditional pub. Ruby red, huge head, hints of liquorice and coffee, refreshing and very very tasty.
Pours deep brown with a thick creamy head. Aroma is nutty but because it’s served so cold its faint. Taste is a little earthy and metallic. Too watery though.

Jet black with cascading light tan head that of course lasts for ages and gives a nice beer mustache. Aroma is the weak link and is rarely present but sometimes there's some light toasty notes. Flavor is of light chocolate and roast malts. Slight tang. Creamy but light finish.
The color is what really catches my eye. The aroma is nice, but the taste isn’t as good. It does have a chocolatey after taste to it.

Draught. Dark brown colour with a creamy and slightly tan head.
Slightly roasted aroma. Roasted flavour with notes of malts and liquorice.
A simple but very good stout.

NOTA DE CATA: 
- Aspecto: La Guinness es de color ámbar oscuro, casi negra, con espuma abundante y espesa que dura bastante y tiñe la copa
- Aroma: Tostado, muy intenso
- Cuerpo/sabor: Espuma muy carnosa, sabor agradable y dulce, con poco amargor

TIPO DE FERMENTACIÓN: Alta fermentación
ABV: 4’1% Vol.
I really like this on tap. But in a can do not like this. On tap is a great easy pleasant drink

Dark, malty aroma. Extremely dark color with a pillowy head. Not much at first for taste, but immediately followed by a wave of roasted/chocolate flavor. Not much for palate, as a lack of carbonation makes it go down so smoothly as almost to a point of fault. That smoothness dampens the flavor, which brings it down a bit for me
Dry. Refreshing. For me one of the best beers in the world. Amazing!!! Guiness for sure!

ASPETTO: nero impenetrabile. Schiuma pannosissima, da cappuccino, abbondante e persistente. AROMA: quasi inesistente. GUSTO: in bocca e’ acquosa, secca e amarognola, con un tostato che si fa sentire solo nella parte finale della bevuta. Sentori lievissimi di orzata. Retrogusto amaro e persistente
A modern classic. So creamy and smoothie. Bit watery taste, with roasted wood and low bitter end. Nice!

Opaque black. Absolutely fantastic head retention. Fairly pungent dark chocolate roast aroma. Incredibly creamy and rich, although light bodied for a stout. Roast, dark chocolate, and malt with a dry, mildly hoppy finish. Has been and will continue to be my go to macro.
440ml can into pint glass. Nitrogen widget. Caramel/cocoa nose. Opaque black with tan cream head. Taste is mildly bitter, aftertaste is dark chocolate then tin. Nice.

Bottle from El Corte Inglés (Barcelona, Spain).  Appearance: Deep black color. Hazy body. Low carbonation. Medium, creamy, thick, intense white and lingering head. Aroma: Roasted sweet malts. Earthy hops. Taste: Balanced bittersweetness. Palate: Medium and creamy body. Bitter, dry and roasted aftertaste.
Classic. Lacks body, tastes burnt, has no aroma, but looks great just after pouring.

En god, men mild aroma af malt og ristet malt. Den dufter af irsk pub. Træ, pibetobak, kaffe, mørk chokolade. Et vedvarende helt cremet skum. Og næsten ingen kulsyre, faktisk en doven øl. Måske er det den manglende kulsyre der gør at man også kan smage alkoholen, som eller kun er på 4,1%
Had this in a can and on tap at various places. Pours dark brown with a creamy off white head. Aroma is slight roast, some dark chocolate. Very smooth mouthfeel. Nice beer.

Puszka 440ml. Piwo o bardzo ładnej, czarnej barwie. Widoczne rubinowe przebłyski. Piękna, drobnopęcherzykowa, biała piana, wspaniale zdobiąca szkło. Aromat to delikatna paloność i czekolada. Przyjemny. Niskie nasycenie. Jedno z najbardziej pijalnych piw na świecie. W smaku bardzo gładki. Paloność świetnie uzupełnia delikatną goryczkę. Czekolada bardzo przyjemnie łączy się z kwaskowatością. W smaku jest dosyć wytrawne. Świetne piwo.

Can. Pours big, creamy white head. Dark brown almost black color. Looks perfect. Smell of chocolate, roast grains and metal (at lower temperature). Flavor of coffe, roasted grains, and some tobacco notes. Earthy. Watery. In aftertaste classic notes of earthy british hops. Overall: ok beer but overrated.
44 cl can @ home. Pours black with a light tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt and a little coffee - with a slightly dry finish.

Puszka 440ml. Piwo o bardzo ładnej, czarnej barwie. Widoczne rubinowe przebłyski. Piękna, drobnopęcherzykowa, biała piana, wspaniale zdobiąca szkło. Aromat to delikatna paloność i czekolada. Przyjemny. Niskie nasycenie. Jedno z najbardziej pijalnych piw na świecie. W smaku bardzo gładki. Paloność świetnie uzupełnia delikatną goryczkę. Czekolada bardzo przyjemnie łączy się z kwaskowatością. W smaku jest dosyć wytrawne. Świetne piwo.
Do I need to describe Guinness? Light smoke, plenty of grain, moderate bitterness, earthy, liquorice. Lovely.
Draught at the Londoner, Xiamen. Pours black brown with an off white head. No great aroma, slightly medicinal. Off taste. Bitter finish.

Dominant sweet chocolate, some candy, little bit roasted malt and cocoa. Clear black color, medium light brown creamy head. Roasted taste, some cocoa and milk chocolate, mild cocoa bitterness in aftertaste. Tragically watery body, completely flat carbonation, little bit creamy.
Can/ Beer I drink most frequently/ Most familiar stout/ Doesn’t feel like liqueur
At The Stag’s Head in Dublin. Classic Guinness pour with black body and thick creamy head. The flavour didn’t really live up to the hype.

These look so cool when poured into a glass. Drank some of these with a friend many years back but never drank them again until now. Got two cans in a sampler. They still look cool after pouring them so overall points for that. OK now for the bad part. There is almost no aroma at all. Not enough to even say there is a smell. Taste is odd and I’m guessing the nitro cause it is something that I have never tasted except in Guinness Draught. So this is why after me and my friend drank some many years ago I never drank them again and now that I have had this trip down memory lane I will try not to drank them again in the future unless they come in another sampler of stuff I have never tried. They do look cool when poured though.

For me, one of the best beers in the world. It is watery, the mouthfeel is thin, but this beer is such an easy drinker with enough flavours to keep it interesting forever and ever. 

Flavours and aromas are cacao, vanilla, coffee, hopbitter, metallic and a nice tart to keep the balance. Creamy mouthfeel. 

It is like going for not the most beautiful girl at school but you know deep inside, this one has all the qualities in the bedroom to keep you satisfied so you don’t have to look any further.
Der Klassiker, frisch gezapft. Pechschwarz mit einer gewaltigen, cremigen Schaumkrone. Zuerst ein süssliches Kaffeearoma, dann leicht herb im Abgang.
A classic. Blacker than black with a thick, creamy head and a chewy texture. Really slight and subtle tastes of coffee and roasted something.
Absolute classic. I just adore the appearance of this beer. Huge, creamy head. A bit of coffee and almost charred malt. Easy to drink
Can. Dark liquid with soft tan head. Light body and carbonation. Light sweetness, medium bitterness. Coffee aroma. Watery. A bit sour and dry.

Nice creamy head. Nice dark color. Almost no aroma and carbonation. Anyway refreshing, easy to drink. It not so clear why this beer is so popular and expensive all over the world. Probably marketing. For that money one can buy much better liquid. But, magical name is the miracle!
From tap, black opaque with low creamy hard head. Aroma with notes of caramel, coffee, bread and herbs. Taste is full and semi dry.

How: tap/can. Appearance: dark brown, black, foamy off-white head. Aroma: coffee, milk chocolate, raisins, some fruits. Taste: Medium sweetness, light to medium bitterness.. Palate: medium body, creamy texture, a bit watery.
Appearance : deep black color , nice creamy beige head. Aroma of coffee, malt , chocolate . Taste is similar to aroma. Low carbonation

Can liberated from a friend’s fridge. Pours brown with a creamy off-white head. Looks nice. The nose is unmistakable. Light cocoa. Tinny ash and roasted malts. Soft marshmallow. I don’t drink Guinness often but I’m always surprised by how light it is. The flavor’s of cocoa and grain. Not particularly roasty or bitter. Dry finish. Very light body. Almost watery. Moderate carbonation. Overall, it’s not great. However’s it’s a very consistent easy drinker.

Draught at the silver eel Aghadolgan. Had this many many times but the first time I could be bothered to rate it. Aroma is woody, earthy light roast with a little vanilla cream. Opaque black coloured pour with reddy hues and a lovely creamy head that lasts to the last drop. Flavour is composed of light roast, dried fruit, little creamy, slight tart and metallic in the finish. Palate is medium bodied, creamy and easy to sink. OK.

Aromat czarnej kawy, czekolady deserowej, ciemnych palonych słodów. Barwa ciemnobrunatna, prawie czarne. Piana - miazga! Drobna, azotowa, beżowa, kremowa. W smaku czarna kawa, gorzka czekolada. Lekkie, wodniste, bardzo pijalne. Goryczka delikatna, kawowa.

How have I not rated this? Before the craft ale explosion, this was often a "default" pint. If you haven’t sampled it and formed your own opinion, do so now. Otherwise, I’m not sure what you’re doing on this site. I still enjoy the occasional pint, but NEVER the extra cold version. Years ago, I laid off the beer for 18 months due to a medical condition, and despite the fact that I rarely drank it before abstinence, this was the beer I craved, and what I eventually supped on my return to the fold. Ubiquitous and rarely disappointing, terrifyingly consistent, there are those who say it tastes uniquely different in Dublin, but this is blarney.

Aroma: coffee, not to strong. I think nice. Color: black, clear, very nice nitro head. Taste: medium (but good for it) bitterness and medium sourness. Palate: light body, thin feel. One of the best in this class.
Draught in local - pours a dark brown - black with tan head. Marketing is superb, prob has best reputation out of all the macro beers on here. Aroma of coffee, roast with little bitterness to finish.

Used to be a huge Guinness drinker before craft. Still a pretty decent pour that’s readily available. The best part is the deep reddish brown pour with the thick thick light tan colored head that laces your glass the whole way down. Aromas of roasted malts, toast grains, and somewhat of a metallic finish. Creamy thick mouthfeel, with a dry finish.
Draught. Worlds best known stout. Pours a dark brown with off white head. Roasted coffee - light on palate despite the appearance.

440ml can from local shop. Pours black-dark brown in colour with a creamy beige head and aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruity. Flavour is roasted malty, sweetish powdered chocolate, raisins, fruity notes, slightly bitter. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry light bitter finish. Quite OK.
This I keep stock for everyday consumption. Also a favorite when out to dinner. It’s a great social beer.
Keg in some dive bar in Glasgow. Pours black, nose is sweet toffee, hint of liquorice, taste is cold, sweet, creamy, light roast.

The Irish milkshake!!! What can I say about Guinness that hasn't already been said. It's a beer but it's also it's own category of beer. Pours a midnight red color with a pillowy off white head. There is always a generous lacing whether can, bottle, or draft. Super smooth flavor with roasted espresso notes. A classic mainstay and always a go to favorite for a pick me up. Call it beer or mother's milk it's intangible spiritual qualities will immortalize Guinness on most bar's tap menus.

On tap Michael Collins, Brussels. Tasted dozens of times before in different countries, so time to rate finally. Smooth, creamy, aroma and taste mainly roasted coffee. A classic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 oz. bottle from Trader Joe’s. Pours dark brown; turns black. Light tan to almost eggshell white head. Nose of mild yeast and malt. Taste of mild caramel roastiness, slightly grassy, a bit of dark chocolate with a little hop bitterness on the back end. It’s dry and light; an excellent session brew. Tasty for what is essentially a light beer.

Peu habitué et pas amateur du style, elle reste encore accessible malgré une certaine lourdeur et une arrière bouche malt grillé café, qui ne me plaisent pas. Bue à la pression à Paris, à Londres et à Stockholm.
Guinness is a standby for a reason. Just an all-around good beer. As with most beers, it’s only made better when paired with the right burger or pizza.
Aroma toasted malts, coffee. Dark brown color. Lght bitter. Nice beige creamy head!

It's Guinness Draught. Nothing else need be said.................................

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a can to a glass. Pours a very dark almost black color with dark copper hues when lit up. One finger frothy creamy silky head. Aroma is roasted malts, dark fruits, slight smokiness and charred note. Taste follows the aroma with a slight hop bitterness, slight raisin, fig, plum, in the sip. Silky smooth medium mouthfeel! Excellent session Stout!

Pours black. Nice brown head, which stays. In aroma iron, some roasty, some chocolate. In taste watery, with some sourness and bitterness. Medium to light body, oily texture, little bit sticky. Almost flat carbonation. Bitter finish. Looks fabulous, but taste could be better.
Slight roasted chocolate flavor. Very smooth on the palate. Really easy to drink, especially with pie. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Ok, it looks absolutely impeccable: great foam, color. But there’s something in the taste i cannot stand (this special kind of sourness), not even mentioning that it lacks any aroma. Too watery and flat.
Can at home. Poured a dark brown with a fair and solid white head. Smells of wood, earth and slight coffee. Tastes sweet with a coffee finish. Everybody should try this one.
Multiple draught pints! Classic drink. Dark, full body, creamy head. Roasted, light body

Puszka. Barwa ciemna. Piana obfita kremowa drobno pęcherzykowa (azot). W aromacie bardzo słabo wyczuwalne nuty palone. W smaku puste delikatnie kwaskowate i goryczkowe. Słabo nasycone. W porównaniu do Guinness Original ma lepszą prezencję lecz słaby smak i aromat.

Pours dark brown; turns black. Light tan to almost eggshell white head. Head is nice when left on draft. Downfall is that aroma and initial taste is too much like a typical American light beer. However, you can’t beat that trademark Guinness aftertaste. This creates a conflict with how to rate the taste. I went with a seven instead of eight because the thin palate leaves much to be desired. Overall a good trade-off between a dark beer and something thin and easily drinkable.
Absolute classic. I just adore the appearance of this beer. Huge, creamy head. A bit of fruits, coffee and almost charred malt. Easy to drink.

Ik dronk dit donker zwart bier met romige schuimkraag uit het 33cl blik.
Neus vult zich met aromatische moutgeur.
Koffiesmaak in de mond, mondgevoel duidelijk minder dan van de tap.
Caramel in de afdronk.
Hetzelfde als de Special export maar iets lichter van smaak. Wel blijft het ondrinkbaar bier voor mij, jakkes.

Tapped. Nothing new to say. Black colour, cloudy liquid, full body. Caramel aroma, extra low sweet, some chocolate bitter in the taste. Awesome creamy head, with bubbles that come upside down. Nice aftertaste.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je znát po hořké čokoládě a karamelu s lehkým chmelovým nádechem. Pěna je světle hnědá, jemná, nízká a držící. Barva samotného piva je temně měděná. Chuť má nádech jemně hořké čokolády s bylinným nádechem, finiš je středně kávově hořký a držící. V ústech pivo působí průměrně, má střední říz a je dobře pitelné. Jedná se o klasiku, stout s letitou tradicí, dobrý, ale ne excelentní.

Stout de baixo amargor. Cerveja leve da pra beber em grandes quantidades. Baixo teor alcoólico. Aroma de café, tostado, toffe. Esperava mais intensidade no sabor assim como ela é forte no aroma. Talvez mais amargor. No geral uma cerveja fácil de beber. Boa para iniciantes por ser uma dry stout bem levinha.

Une stout sèche tout à fait plaisante à condition de la servir pas trop froide : 10 degrés minimum.
Belle mousse beige crémeuse, aucune bulle, robe d’encre.Nez d’houblons amers et de malts torréfiés, cacao.
En bouche, très sèche, malt grillé et torréfié, houblons finement amers.Corps épais voir gras.Finale très sèche.Relativement désaltérante pour une brune.
Bottle. Pours a dark dark brown with a layer of beige head. Aroma and taste of roasted malts.

Bière de Diageo, qui fut jadis l’institution irlandaise. Est-ce encore le cas ???
Je doute de certaines versions draught, alors que la version export belge à 8 % abv est un prodige.
Mais ici, avec son classique niveau de 4,2 % abv, il me semble que cette bière est plus aqueuse qu’auparavant … Industrie oblige … (On est loin du « noblesse oblige » …).
(Entre parenthèses, le monde entier sait que la Guinness draught est à 4,2, mais ratebeer l’a enregistrée à 4,1 …. Cherchez l’énigme !!).
Couleur noir d’encre (toujours … obligé …). Mais, c’est facile à obtenir…
Mousse crème d’expresso (mais là aussi elle est moins dense qu’auparavant…).
Arômes de chocolat, café (moins fort qu’avant …), houblon, tourbe, candi brun (qui n’existait pas avant …).
1ère bouche soyeuse (la crème) sur du café crème (comme on dit en France … amusant !!), charbon de bois, cendre de feu de bois.
Arrière-bouche sur la tourbe, la terre, pointe de fumée. (Mais tout cela est moins distingué qu’auparavant…).
2ème plus aqueuse. Café au rabais !!!
3ème avec du houblon intéressant, surprenant dans l’ensemble.
La longueur n’emballe pas (ou plus??). Elle se laisse boire, sans vraie surprise…
L’alcool est banal, mais il l’a toujours été (et c’est voulu …). N.B 4,2 …
La finale est plate.
CONCLUSION : une bière de légende qui perd doucement sa légende … Mais il vous reste la version « special export belgian version » à 8 % abv pour compenser, et continuer à rêver ...
This is a mass produced and marketed beer that actually holds up. Good flavor, mouthfeel and presence. A beer I can get just about anywhere and know I will enjoy it.

Tap. Perfect beige head. Coffee, chocolate and dark bread in aroma. Bitterness low, delicate taste of roasted barley. Very drinkable. What is wrong with their marketing staff? Why extra cold? Makes no sense absolutely.

Beczka w Guinness Storehouse / Gravity Bar (piwo nalane przeze mnie - perfect pint :-), Dublin. Zapach lekko palony, chlebowy, ale nie wyrazisty. Kolor prawie czarny. Piana obfita, kremowa, bardzo drobna i trwała. Goryczka dość niska. Pijalność wysoka :-).
On tap. Black color with creamy beige head. Aroma roasted malts and coffee. Taste chocolate, coffee with moderate ending bitterness. Much better then can version.

On tap. Black colour with small beige, creamy, thick head that lasts. Soft carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts. Taste is malty with hints of coffee. Roasty, bitter aftertaste. Overall exellent beer, a real classic. But way better on tap than from bottle or can.

Heard a lot of this one. nice medium tanned head that lingers; medium roast malty aroma with some coffee. has an intense roasted taste of malts, coffee and some chocolate, some caramel and dry-bitter aftertaste. im not that much into dry stouts. but pretty nice alltogheter

Guinness Draught in a can. The aroma is way lighter than my delicious Foreign Extra. Smells of very light caramel and burnt malt, with a slight hint of molasses. The appearance is excellent, as it’s a nice dark brown with an excellent head. The taste is Guinness light. Great for drinking with a meal, as it won’t overpower the food. Good cold as an after work drink as well. Palate is on the watery side tho, so no sticky lips - goes down easy. Personally I like this beer as a stout to have when you’d like something with flavor but aren’t up to a full blown Guinness. A nice session brew,... I’d luv to go out and have it on tap. My score looks negative, but I’d definitely choose to drink this again.

Nice black appearance with small milky foam. Not much to say - slight aroma of roasted malts, taste is the same, low-carbonated. Watery mouthfeel, easy to drink. A classic indeed, but boring.

EDIT: From the bottle, this has a surprisingly high carbonation.
Nice apperance. Dark with at Think creamy foam. A little roasted aroma. Taste is a very watery, clean and a hint of coffee and roasted chocolate. Easy to drink but boring and thin.
14.9 oz can: No way you can lose with this beer. Dark with two fingers of creamy, tight head. Hints of coffee and tobacco with a smooth finish and very sessionable.

Tap. Pours black with a thick creamy tan head that lasts. Pleasant aroma, mostly roasted malts that is masked by the thick head. Feels thick an creamy on the palate with soft carbonation. Taste is very light sweet then heavy bitter with tasty flavours of roasted malts and biscuit. Leaves a slight caramel aftertaste. A deserved classic!

Lattina presa in Inghilterra nel lontano 2005 e bevuta dopo 10 anni dalla produzione. Una volta aperta già ne senti gli aromi. Versata nel modo giusto, in perfetta posizione verticale con la pallina di azoto a determinarne la schiuma, si presenta di un bel colore scuro, nero, con una schiuma finissima, pannosa, di color beige chiaro e di lunghissima persistenza. Al naso le nota di torrefazione non sono invadenti, anzi risultano ben equilibrate tra loro: in successione si avvertono caffè, nocciola, lieve tabacco e infine cioccolato. La porti alla bocca e ti accorgi che, se già di per sè una dry stout è carente in bollicine con carbonazione bassa, in questa lattina i gas sono quasi spariti. Risultato è una birra assai vellutata, morbida, con bel corpo tendente al watery, che ne ottimizza la bevibilità. Al gusto invece oltre a ritrovare quasi le stesse note dell’olfatto (assenti stavolta il tabacco e il cioccolato), si rinviene la liquirizia, che con lo scaldarsi della birra viene ancor più fuori esaltandone il sapore. Finale sorprendentemente secco, con amaro quasi impercettibile, per una persistenza molto molto corta. Tutto sommato, trattandosi di una lattina britannica di dieci anni ben conservata , è stata una bella bevuta.

Tap. The creamy head of this brew is is fantastic, if served well, as I was lucky enough to experience. Notes of nuts, caramel, bread at first sip. Roasts come next but surprisingly fresh despite its dark colour. An excellent dry stout.

Draft. What can one say about a classic? To watch this poured on Nitro is a thing of beauty. Creamy off white head, aroma of deep roasted malt. Taste of malt and roasted barley. Nice! No idea why I never rated this before.
Bottle from SB. Pous one finger of head. Earthy and a little roasted aroma. Taste is a bit watery, clean and a hint of coffee and roasted chocolate. Easy to drink, a classic beer!
On draft at old Chicago in Duluth. Had this many times. Always a great tasting roasted malty beer that’s not overpowering on taste or abv.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a brown color that looks darker in the glass with a light tan head of foam. The aroma is a bit weak with very light notes of cocoa, cola and dark bread. The flavor is more roasted with a nutty, bready malt backbone and a burnt grain finish. Smooth body with a decent amount of acidity without being harsh on the palate. Pretty watery in the finish. It’s funny how people slam pints of this stuff and think they’re drinking a "strong" beer. Pretty sessionable and goes down easy, but overall bland.
50 cl systembolaget. Helt ok på burk. Kan inte säga att den skiljer sig särskilt mycket från den tappade varianten.
smells roasted, black with white head (come on its guiness do you need to be told what it looks like???) is thick creamy roasted and dry. possibly the best beer you can get in any average pub

Appearance: a deep black color with a big head. Aroma: smells like roasted malts, a little of caramel and coffee notes. Taste: it has coffee, chocolate and roasted flavors with a dry finish. Not my style but it is not a bad beer.

440 ml can from Tallinna Kaubamaja (€ 2,10). BB 09.07.15. Pours brown, appears black in the glass and ruby against light. Head as expected, the widget makes it look very nice, thick and creamy, well-retaining, some lacing. Nose... god damn, this ain’t nice... I get too much dank earthy hops and only after that some stale roasted malts, some sourish black bread too. Taste equally no good, like taking a sip of your morning coffee in the evening; it has some dank earthy-herbal-grassy hops in the taste too, with quite mild bitterness, and as it’s warmed quite a bit, gets sightly chocolaty, but only slightly. Body expectedly light, texture creamy and soft, carbonation non-existent, palate dry and grainy, yet overall a bit watery.



Had it on tap on various occasions but the canned version just doesn’t seem to come close. Should quickly get it on tap again for camparison to see if I’ve gone mad or not.

Color is black, hazy; slightly tan, stable, creamy head - subtle Aroma of roasted malt, maybe chocolate and coffee - taste is slightly bitter - medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation - roasty, bitter finish.

Draught at the Magpie Inn Dalkey, capping a swim at the Forty Foot. Very dark brown, clear, more like black, boasting a creamy nitrogen-assisted head. Aroma is subtle. Some light roast malt, light weak coffee. Flavour is light coffee and some dark malts. Body is light with very faint carbonation.

Poured from can. Aromas of roasted malts. Pours almost black with tan head. Has a light bitter taste. Light to medium body with creamy texture. A nice beer but seems a bit too light in the body (almost too watery). Could use a bit more character.

Reviewed On: (7/10/14): (Bottled Version)


*Glassware: Nonic Pint


*Serving: 11.2 oz


*Aroma: dark chocolate, roasted malts, cofffee


*Appearance: Dark brown with a soft tan two finger head that has lots of bubbles. The head stayed around for the whole duration of the beer. Decent lacing was left behind on the glass after finishing the beer.


*Taste: Dark chocolate upfront, burnt bread in the middle, and finishes with a coffee bitterness at the end. Tastes too watered down.


*Palate: Light body, smooth, but watery mouthfeel, low carbonation on the tongue. Finishes semi-dry, with a nice bitterness.


*Overall: Not a bad beer that is extremely sessionable: however, its nothing outstanding or mind-blowing. It tastes too watered down, and lacks the robustness that the Extra Stout has. It goes down real easy though, so I guess that is a positive.

0.44l nitro can poured in a chalice
A: Beautiful deep black color with a huge and dense beige head. Great retention but practically no lacings. Guinness trademark, I would say
S: Roasted malts dominates, some notes of coffee and a little bit of grassy hops in the end
T: Dry and bitter, basically. Delicious, nevertheless. Roasted malts dominates its taste, but also reminds me some black chocolate and coffee. Also some fresh grassy hops in the end
M: Light but creamy body, very low carbonation and ABV
D: High. Refreshing beer, after all. The combination of the dry taste, reasonable bitterness and a low ABV makes it a very easy drinking beer. Good black stuff! ;)
[ BA Review @ 6/2/2010 ]
Cor escura com colarinho pequeno e beje. Boa acidez e baixa carbonatação. Sabor torrado e leve amargor. Corpo leve.

An old favourite and just as I remembered. Opaque deepest brown with lovely creamy head. Roasty aromas, notable hops. Taste is still chocolate, vegemite and charred meat. Thin but creamy. Brings back good memories.
From a can. Draught. Aroma, taste, and feel of a good stout. I am a fan but don't quite rate it as highly as everyone else. Still a steady and good beer.

Dark brown with a thick, creamy, off-white head. Slight caramel aroma and no hops to speak of. Roasted malts, caramel, with very slight hint of coffee with vert little bitterness. Creamy mouth feel.

This is an enjoyable old standard. It is easily the most readily available stout to be found. It used to be my beer of choice in the late 80’s and 90’s. Today’s stouts are pushing the bounds of what a stout can be and I love the big RIS out there. Sometimes it is nice to go back to the things that have just been there for so long.

Tap. Big foamy brown head lasts till the end, thick lace. Black. Malty bready arom. Tastes as the aroma, some minerals and dark bitterness. Watery body, smooth as silk.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Slowly settling lip sticking, lacing, drinking rings forming, lasting smooth light brown foam head, just the way I like it. That alone is worth while having this beer. Dark brown color, small coffee aroma. Great taste. Had this many times but somehow did not rate. (Dubai 201410)

still not a great beer, and there are hundreds of stouts that are better, but at least the nitro gives it a smooth feel, and takes your mind of the lack of flavor. you can pull out the roasted malt notes if you try, but you shouldn’t have to. too bad macro drinkers think all dark beers are Guinness."

Guinness : her name says all !

Drink it, love it ;) One of the most complex beer to describe. Like the coffee it seems...
Dark, creamy, toasted, caramel. Refreshing throughout. Traditional and always a pleasure. Irish pride.

Aroma: light toasted malts, some dry chocolate, some caramel. Appearance: dark brown/black, massive, frothy, off-white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: turning sweet, intense malts, turning slightly bitter in the average-long finish, medium body, soft carbonation. Overall: very nice Dry Stout, a true classic. Pint at one of many pubs in London.
Almost black with white creamy head. Dry and mild - Guinness as it is... (Just wandered, that I didn’t rate it before, as I knoww it well before I joined Ratebeer :) )

Stout couleur café, brune-noire. Mousse beige crémeuse persistante.Très peu carbonée.
Arômes de torrefaction principalement, café et légèrement fruité.
En bouche goût de torrefaction et café, avec une douceur fruit et caramel. Passe facilement en bouche, peu d’amertume. Légèrement houblonnée. Peu complexe et peu de longueur en bouche.
Très belle, mais déçu par le passage en bouche. Etonnament sur-notée.

Tive o prazer de degustar esta cerveja com um amigo britânico conhecedor do ritual de servir a Guinness.
Maravilhosa é a formação da espuma. Foi simplesmente perfeita, bem como a cremosidade da cerveja, a cor bege e a consistência.
O aroma tem tudo aquilo que se espera, o amargo, o café, as notas de torrefação...
E o sabor realmente é algi que surpreende. Muito suave para uma cerveja com sabor tão intenso. Café, algo de especiarias e lúpulo.
Muito boa, vou tomar de novo sempre que tiver chance.

Una buona stout considerando che, effettivamente, non è una birra complessa. Colore scuro con meravigliosa schiuma, fine e persistente, color caffellatte. Aroma di orzo e xereali, alla bocca riporta l’orzo ed una bella asprezza, ma troppa, veramente troppa acquisità per potermi far impazzire. Buona stout, non eccellente però.
Tap. Pours black with a creamy tan head. Everyone knows draught Guinness. And I love it.

Beautiful pour. Great flavor. The quintessential session beer. A draft (or draught) Guinness in Ireland is as close to perfect as it gets. My favorite.          

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Typical taste and aroma of a stout. This one is much worse than the bottled version, mainly due to the strange "buttery" mouthfeel it has to it.

On draught. Stouts always have a lovely appearance and guinness is the daddy of them all. Enticing in looks, this may be a lightweight tasting stout compared to some of those on the craft beer scene but it still packs more punch than some bland macro lager.

Black beer with a cream-colored everlasting head.
Taste is like roasted flavors with a creamy coffee finish.
Fris aroma, kolenzwart uiterlijk. Dun van smaak ontwikkelt zich langzaam, warme afdronk.

I’m actually fairly surprised by the high ratings this beer has. 
I don’t hate Guinness. In a bar serving only crappy macro beers, it’s often my go-to sipper. (Mind you the older I get, the less time I spend in such bars.)
Oh yeah, the beer. It looks great: jet black with that everlasting head. But everything about it is muted: the aroma, the taste - the carbonation.There’s a bit of chocolate and coffee, roasted grain, and a finish just dry enough to make it sessionable. But compared to a big, bold craft stout (or even St-Ambroise), I don’t see how Guinness can stack up.
Cheers! Cheers! Cheers! Cheers! Cheers! Cheers! Cheers! Cheers! Cheers! Cheers! Cheers!

Classic dry stout example and one of the first stouts I ever tried. 
Even though years have passed, and much better beers have been tried, Guinness is still a very pleasant session pub beer.
Bottle....not as good as draft.  11.14.14 had draft...much better than bottle.  Creamy head a big plus vs. Bottle

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 13A). Can 44 cl - Batch L4133GE002. AROMA: roasted coffe like aroma with cocoa notes. some faint alcoholic aromas. low esters and very low hop aromas. APPEARANCE: jet black color and opaque with ruby highlights. thick slight tanned head with good retention. TASTE: roasted flavours with a coffee-like dry finish. some chocolate sweet flavour. medium-low bitterness and no hop flavours. PALATE: medium-light body with a creamy sensation. low carbonation and no astringency. OVERALL: a good and creamy dry stout that maybe would benefit from a little more hop bitterness.

Roasty malts in aroma, a bit of chocolate and coffee. Not too complex. Appearance: Guinness - no need to explain. No sweetness, very small bitterness. Extremely drinkable, very smooth and creamy, very low carbonation. This, for me (and for many other, I’m sure), is a definition of a dry stout. Perfect, session beer.

Caramel-roasty nose with a phenolic cough-drop overtones. Moderate sweetness, with a roasty bitter finish with a slight astringency. Creamy texture, a lightly flat and watery palate--might be a bit oxidized. Really, not as good as what many of our west coast craft breweries are doing now

Botella, caña y lata de 33 cl de el c. Ingles en montón de ocasiones. Cuerpo ligero a medio de 4.2 vol bastante cremosa y ligero paso por boca. Color negro con espuma beige con aromas y sabores ligeramente tostados, acabando con un ligero amargor. Fácil de beber, buena.
Its Guiness. What so you say? Dark with beautiful creamy head. Low nose aromas with bitter roast flavours.

Wersja z nitro-tapu

Piana: Jasnobeżowa, bardzo drobnopęcherzykowa i bardzo sztywna.

Kolor: .Ciemnomahoniowe z czerwonymi refleksami.

Zapach: Kawa z toffi. Nuty biszkoptowe, po ogrzaniu dochodzi mleczna czekolada.

Smak: Dość wytrawne, spora paloność, nuty kawy z mlekiem.

Tekstura: Bardzo smukłe, lekkie. Nie pozostawia osadu, ani ściągania.

Nasycenie: Minimalne.

Goryczka: Średnia z wrażeniem pochodzenia od palonego słodu.

Pijalność: Średnio-wysoka.

Wątpię czy ten Guiness różni się czymś w smaku od tego, którego można dostać u nas w Polsce w tzw. "irish pubach". Nie ulega natomiast żadnej wątpliwości, że jest znacznie lepszy od butelkowego. Smak nie jest głęboki, ale przynajmniej czuć paloność, nie czuć alkoholu i można wlewać w siebie bez skrzywienia na buzi. Wolałbym coś innego, ale w obliczu festiwalowego zatoru na kranach i rak ryba...

Wersja "in a bottle": Zapach z butelki: Typowo stoutowy, paloność, kawa, palony jęczmień, słodkawy biszkopt.

Piana: Średnio obfita, brązowa, drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała.

Kolor: Mahoniowe, lekko przejrzyste.

Zapach: Sporo paloności, palonego jęczmienia, kawa zbożowa, nutka kawy ziarnistej. Ciasteczkowość, herbatniki, biszkopt. Lekko mleczny aromat.

Smak: Dość wytrawne, średnio-niska biszkoptowa podbudowa. Sporo paloności. Nuty prazonych orzechów, kawy zbożowej.

Tekstura: Ciało średnio-lekkie. Piwo smukłe, dość aksamitne. Przyjemnie odkładająca się paloność.

Nasycenie: Bardzo niskie, ale obecne.

Goryczka: Ponad średnią, komponenta palona. Szlachetnie krótka.

Pijalność: Bardzo wysoka.

Nie owijając w bawełnę, to chyba najlepsza wersja Guinnessa jaką piłem. Zaskakująco wyraźna goryczka, dobrze zarysowana paloność i niepłytki profil słodowy przy zachowanej wytrawności bardzo do mnie przemawiają. Wielka szkoda, że ten wariant nie jest obecny w naszych hipermarketach. Na przykrą politykę namawiania do picia z butelki spuśćmy zaś zasłonę...
Absolutely love this beer. A very dark and rich appearance, with a full white top. A full, roasty taste of malt, almost coffee-like. One of my favourite beers to drink.

Full pint draught. Deep dark brown colour, beige superbly creamy head. No aroma. Watery taste, a little roasted coffee and chocolate, vanilla. Creamy, silky soft mouthfeel and aftertaste. Very low carbonated, thin body.

On draft at Baton Rouge.
Arguably the most beautiful beer in the world with its jet black body and perfectly shaped mocha head.
Aromas are slightly underwhelming with some roasted malts and hints of coffee.
Tastes are pretty much in line with the aroma. Nice dryness on the finish. Mouthfeel is incredibly creamy.
Overall there is a reason this is one of the world’s most recognizable beers and it’s the quality of every draft of this I’ve ever had.
On tap at Nick’s. Looks like coffe/cola. Really nice creamy top Coffee-like modest aroma. Tastes like cold coffee. Bitter on palate. I’ve had better Guiness before.
Echt niet mijn soort bier, dan zijn er veel en veel lekkerdere dan dit te vinden

Pours a pitch black color, topped with a beautiful cream colored head. Roasty aroma, notes of caramel and chocolate. Very inviting. Creamy body, decent bitterness in the finish, roasty notes and slight coffee. Gotta love it.
500ml can with nitro. Pours dark brown with a medium-sized beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, smoke, caramel. Taste is dry, roastiness, smoke, caramel. Light bitter finish.

Can version with the widget. Chocolate, roast and grainy malt aroma. Subtle and delicate. Deep brown with red highlights and a full, fluffy tan head that lingers. Taste is moderate roast. Dry with a thinnish mouthfeel. Not too bad. The can is not as good as some pints that i have had.
A Guinness is always a Guinness. The bottled version doesn’t hold a candle to the draught and the finish is rather watery. Still a good solid brew.
Faint roasted barley aroma. Dark red to black with tan nitrogen head. Flavors of toast, roasty, chocolate, coffee with indefinable acidity. Dry finish.

Not sure how I’ve never rated. Tap most recently. Great dark body with great, lasting tan head. Decent bitterness, but body is thin without nitro (and compared to other stouts). Still, a gateway beer into other good stuff.
from can, on tap better but still a fine drop, been 20 years since 1st tried in Ireland, dark creamy enduring head always leads to a silky smooth & tasty finish

Color is opaque, dark chocolate with a thick, creamy beige head. Smell is toasted oats, nuts, and cereal. Taste is black coffee, dark chocolate, slight toffee and finishes slightly bitter with cereal notes. Nitro carbonation makes this a super creamy beer. Not my favorite but slowly growing on me.

The world-famous Irish nectar and the archetypical dry stout, tasted from can and from tap. Classic dense, beige head made out of tiny nitro bubbles, colour as good as black. Very, very creamy, velvety and bit oily mouthfeel more so from can than from tap, iron, black coffee and sweet tobacco aroma, taste a strong roasted bitterness, bit metallic, bit thinnish, finishing in a full, but not very long bitterness.

I do not know why I have not rated this before. Drank from the bottle. Aroma is chocolate, nuts, coffee. Taste is much the same with a slight bitterness at the end. Medium bodied with very light carbonation and an oily mouth feel. One of my few go to beers when I want something familiar and good.
Zwart bier met romig schuim. Smaak is rook en licht bitter, niet zoet. Blijft helaas niet erg lang hangen. Toch een erg goed bier.

A classic beer, for someone just getting into stouts.   It's clean and not offensive to taste.  You can taste the caramel and hits of oats.  But be sure, this is a light tasting stout.  Great in a dank wet pub on a Friday night.
Helt sort med et beige skum. Aroma av røstet malt, kaffe, karamell og sjokolade. Smaken følger aroma, flott fylde og rund og fin i smaken.
Dark happyness! Caramel, coffee aromas. Great dark pale head. Chocolate, caramel, and coffee tastes. Just a great beer.

Anywhere, anytime. The classic stout to compare all other stouts to. Love it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great feeling to open the can and to fill the glass with that creamy, smokey black beer. Aroma from chocolate, coffee and caramel. Very soft carbonation makes it a great beer which I really enjoyed drinking. I?ll have another one for sure!

Bière noire de 4.2 % d’alcool. Elle possède un col épais, laiteux et très joli au versement. Elle possède un aspect de bière « flat » et aussi un goût de métal. Elle possède un nez sucré et amer simultanément. On sent même un aspect de torréfaction. Le goût est intriguant, légère amertume en finale. Bonne bière à déguster, mais pas rafraîchissante. Une bonne bière « sociale ».

It’s the good stuff . as close as you;ll get too extra cold which is about the best you will get outside of Dublin. 
I always put it in the freezer for about 75 minutes as it has to be perfect temperature to remove the slight bitterness . When served at correct temperature it is like liquid gold , just a joy to pour and then watch it settle ,
And it tastes as good as you can get although for some reason I cannot explain the second can always tastes better , not an alchoholic thing but a science thing I reckon .
I was brought up on Guinness and to me drinking this is as good as it gets .

Drink cold (8°C)
Eye: very creamy, buttery beer in its consistence, pours a deep black colour with the nicest and thick beige head-
Nose: coffee, roasted malts and smoke
Mouth: dark coffee, roasted malts, buttery but i don’t really taste the chocolate..
Palate: a bit thin, not so long finish (disadvantage of this beer)
Overall: nice stout, which is available almost everywhere, certainly in every irish pub, can’t drink more than two pints in one evening.

This beer has a delicious aroma of roasted malts. The beer is a pretty chocolate color with a creamy, well retained head despite its low level of carbonation. The palate is medium bodied and the taste is rather bland, mostly roast malt with the bittering buried deep. Drinkable but I have never understood the obsession with this brew.
Draught. Thick off white head. Roast and coffee nose. Black body. Sweet, malty, chocolaty.

Guinness, always a go to and will forever hold a spot in my fridge. This beer tops my list of readily available beers!
The aroma of this beer in my opinion is one of the only downfalls. Notes of chocolate and coffee are present however they are very mild. 
If any beer were to look sexy Guinness would be the one! Pitch black with a thick creamy khaki head. Lacing seems to hug the inside edge of the glass for the duration of the session. 
The taste of this beer is smooth, thick, and creamy. chocolate and coffee are still subtle but compliment each other well. A slight hoppy after taste is present 
Overall this well know beer will always be a go to. This beer truly was my training wheels into the beer culture.

Small draft at la central de Cambrils. Pitch black with foamy head. The toast is dark, smoky, creamy. Very soft palate. Apart no carbonizations Even more since the foam does not dissipate. A good beer actually
Collar of very thick foam. The beer has a deep dark colour and tastes and smells roasty.

Black body with a creamy thick light brown head. Malty aroma with light chocolate notes. Taste is smooth sweet malt with light bitterness. Not very complicated and thin. Still, one of the few beers that can be found widely and will still satisfy.

Ingen tokhöjdare men en Guinness är alltid en Guinness. Funkar kanon i solen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Pours black with thick creamy tan head. Nose is roast. Taste is thin and dry. Very thin mouthfeel. Okay.
Guinness continues to brew a good product. One of the best light beers on the market. Cheers!

0,44l can. It had very nice creamy foam. Black colour. But body is almost thin, texture also. Taste is dark chocolate with coffee and it was very dry for me. No malty sweetness, no smoke a little simple. And it is price is a fortune.
Gotta love good old guinness! This is the beer that comes to mind when I think of stout: a thick, dark and minerally brew that tastes of oats, fresh baked bread and dark chocolate.
Aroma is sweet and yeasty, taste is sweet, chocolate, lots of sugar, very easy drinking.

Smells really creamy and sweet. Creamy, caramel and sweet taste. Light bitterness that sits down in front of the mouth to a weak moment. But still a classic drink. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Almost black with off-white head. Roasty aroma, some chocolate, but not very strong. A decent stout flavor, but a little thinner feeling than most. Good, for a mass-market.

Hard to argue with this classic. I just returned from a trip to England where we swam the channel, and I have to say having this on draft at a small pub in Dover is one of the cooler experiences you can have.
For a widely available stout, this is pretty good. Had it many times. Roasty flavors and aromas with just a hint of cocoa. Extremely smooth. Great and fresh stout

Draught @ Dubliners Cph: Pours dark brown with persistent creamy white head and low carbonation. Aroma contains caramel, grain, cream, chocolate, coffee and mineral hints. medium body with dry finish - overall a light stout with a nice try twist

Pint from Nine Bar, Newcastle. Pours deep black with a luxuriant creamy head which lasts. Ends up feeling a touch thinner in the mouth than you might expect but the extremely satisfying roasted flavour makes up for that

First Guinness! First appearances are amazing, to watch the head form (poured from can). Absolutely opaque black, head with tight beading, colour of milk coffee. First reaction to taste was a thinness?, probably actually the low carbonation. The dark malt character is very light on the palate, making this a far lighter flavour impact than I expected. Can understand how this could be drunk all day.

A classic! Deep, rich brown/ almost pitch black* pour (*actual color is amber according to their website but I can only vaguely distinguish that during the long pour) with a huge foamy tan head which Guinness is so well known for. Flavour of roasted malts, barley, chocolate, coffee etc. Can’t go wrong with this! I’d also like to make a note that this draught has a very very low carbonation level - and thus I can down a pint of it in 5 seconds flat. Cheers!
Pours jet black with fading tan head. Been years since I’ve had this beer. Better than I remember. Still more of a fan of the extra stout but good beer

Piana: beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, trwała, ładnie oblepia szkło, pozostająca do samego końca.
Kolor: czarne z rubinowymi refleksami.
Aromat: palony, karmel, słód.
Smak: wytrawny, karmel, palony, goryczka słaba.

Aromat slodowy, lekko chmielowy, przewazaja nuty palone, karmelowe. Wyglad nienaganny, gleboka czern z rubinowymi refleksami, piana niska ale drobnopecherzykowa typowo azotowa, utrzymuje sie do konca picia. Piwo dosyc wytrawne, dobrej jakosci. W kategorii koncerniakow sam top.

Barwa czarna pod światło ciemno wiśniowe refleksy. Piana niesamowicie drobna gęsta i treściwa. Piana bardzo dokładnie oblepia szkło. Aromat mocno palony może nawet trochę wędzony.
